description:
Was killing some time after lunch and was looking for a place also showing the game. This was the perfect place to sit, watch the game, and enjoy a drink. This place specializes in rum. Really good rum!  They have punch drinks available for a great price. I had the Victorian punch and it was amazingly good. Great coconut and cranberry flavor and could taste that kick of rum. Would definitely be back to try the others. 

On a side note, would have given 5 stars but there was a really bad piss smell at the bar. I moved towards the other side of the bar and I could still smell it. Despite that, I really enjoyed the place and would come back!
author: Mark W.

description:
If you're looking for day drinking spot with good people watching then Hobson's Choice is a good pick. Order a few rounds of punch bowls to share.. these things are deceptive, it's sweet so you keep drinking without realizing you're getting tipsy. Wish the ladles worked better and didn't spill all over as you tried to pour the drinks.

If you get a chance, sit by one of the tables with the large windows facing Haight Street and you can people watch too. Every now and then you'll see a SF Sightseeing tourist bus pass by. Hobson's Choice is one of those places where you can spend hours and have a great time. Hungry? Head next door to Street Tacos and bring back some al Pastor nachos or a burrito. The bar is pretty nice about letting you bring outside food since they don't have a food menu. Just be a good customer and keep ordering those punches.
author: Ruby C.

description:
I took myself on a tour of San Fran while visiting a couple weeks ago. I asked a random person where I could find an eclectic neighborhood and possibly have a midday drink with locals. They pointed me to the Haight neighborhood and I stumbled across this bar and copped a squat at the bar. 

It has a divey yet welcoming vibe so it was comfortable. I'm not usually a rum drinker but I'm sucker for bars with old charm who also serve drinks from antique punch bowls. I can definitely see this being a fun place for a group of friends.

I was served immediately, mostly because there were 6 of us there, including the bartender. However, he was friendly so it's probably the case all the time. I tried the House Punch which has an orange/mango base and the Victorian Punch which has a cranberry/coconut base. Both were tasty and had kick but I preferred the Victorian as I found it less thick than the House version. Regardless, they paired well with the random conversation I had with the bartender and a patron...which is precisely what I was seeking. 

If back in that area, I'd definitely go back to see what it's like on a busier day/night.
author: Kristin A.

description:
Come here for some awesome rum punch bowls! There are 3 flavors in 2 sizes- my favorite being the Victorian Punch made with silver, coconut, and pineapple rums. 
A small bowl is good for 2-4 people. 
The large bowl is good for 4-6. 

I like going upstairs when it's available... you have almost an entire wing of the house to yourself with a large table and a flat screen TV. Fits a group of about 6-10 friends for happy hour (good deals!)

Now, I would also like to acknowledge the recent 1 star reviews about what happens at the end of the night.... It's true. I've seen it and I've experienced it. So I would avoid this place about 30 minutes before closing time since the staff suddenly flips- becoming excessively aggressive and rude in telling people to finish their drinks and get out. They act like they're talking to a bunch of drunk teenagers raiding a liquor cabinet instead of addressing their paying customers with respect, especially women. 
I seriously hope they work on this bit.
author: Mitzi G.

description: Well, what can I say... My husband and I met at Hobson's (after one week of online chat). It happened to stand in the middle of our two dwellings in 2012. I will of course never forget that magical, rainy evening. Not too much more to add... but yes, I am a fan.
author: Camille L.

description:
What a cool, fun yet mellow place on Haight! Came across this place after searching for: day drinking...and I'm glad we found it! The "go" for me was that they offer three different kinds of punches! Punch? How awesome!

The bartender saw that my friend and I were having difficulty deciding which to go with...so he gave us samples. Boom - decision made. The vibe was super cool in the place and the windows make for great people watching too. No frills, but awesome people watching and yummy punch at 2pm in the afternoon. Winning! Who knew that options were limited for drinking during the day? Now I know... Hobsons is the place to be!

I'll definitely be back to try their other drink specials. Such a cool place to land and explore the scene on Haight.
author: Crystal C.

description: My husband and I are visiting from Phoenix and decided to pop into this place-best decision ever!!! It is cleverly quaint and soulfully energized. The staff is beyond wonderful - caring, engaged, and fun! The beer, wine, and spirit options are diverse and while they do not prepare food, their street taco vendor is superb! (Best burrito ever). We are currently wondering how we get this exact establishment transported to our hometown. It's a must - enjoy!!!
author: Teffanie T.

description:
Slightly divey bar with two floors known for their massive punch bowls. The first floor has lots of space to chill with friends. You can hang out in the large booths and grab drinks and chill. There is also a small area near the bottom of the stairs to sit with friends. 

They make different flavors of punch that they scoop in to a large punch bowl for you. Prices are pretty reasonable for the quantity. But the taste is just okay. So so sweet. You'll definitely get a hangover. It's unavoidable. 

Overall, fun time for a punchbowl and a good time.
author: Courtney O.

description: Bloody Mary Review - Building a truly great bloody mary requires patience, skill and above all, practice. This makes build-your-own bloody mary bars highly risky for the untrained mixologist. Thankfully, Hobson's Choice has got you covered. At this Sunday only BYO bar, you could fill your glass with clamato or tomato juice and then take a stab at the array of spices, hot sauces and garnishes available for the taking. Or you could use the deliciously peppery house mix and quickly move on to building that leaning tower of garnish. The choice is yours. Why go? Build your own bloody marys. | Price $5.75+
author: Shelley B.

description: great place to stop in for a drink during the day while we strolled around haight and ashbury. bartender was super nice. drinks weren't over priced either. no one was in here as it was fairly early.
author: Havalah W.

description:
Came during an ultra fast three bar hop in the Haight at about 12:00AM

I must say given the amount of people who arrived with me, the single bartender was awesome in providing pricing as well as drinks.  He was definitely nice enough to ask IDs in addition to orders simultaneously.  

As for the decor, many of the bars in haight are as un-pretentious as they come.  Much of the specials are posted on the wall above the bar.  Not the most upscale place, but definitely a down to earth place to grab a quick drink.  The value here is great.  Most shots under 10 and beers hover around 5.

I recommend this spot after a walk through the Haight or Golden Gate Park.  A definite must if you come with a bunch of out of towners who want a quick drink/barhop at 12AM
author: Joel Christian A.

description: This place is a bit dangerous. Those punch bowls can get you quickly. However, I will say I do really like it here. I've been here a couple times and the bartenders are great. I recommend this place if you're looking for a rum bar. It's kinda divey, but it's a very relaxed atmosphere. However, I have seen this place pretty crowded and it's a mess. Good place for a group of friends who want to catch up.
author: Julie L.

description: Great place for spiked punch or bloody Mary's when they have their bloody bar set up. Many good sundays spent here
author: Mike S.

description:
Ok, myself and my boyfriend came to Hobsons on the advice of recent visitors from New Orleans.
Loved the many Rum Conconcoctions as recommended by the hot bartender and we spent an evening here loving every minute of Hobsons, Haight and Hailey. We will be back,  thank you.
author: Paula M.

description:
Cool bar in the Haight.  Very relaxed and casual atmosphere with great deals on good beer.

History and old style heritage fill the climate and vibe.  The architecture and design of 1900s building is on full display.

A nice place to watch a Giants game.  All in all my favorite bar to visit, and somewhere I look forward to going to again.
author: Michael K.

description: My friend and I stopped in as we were walking by because the boozy punch drinks sounded amazing. Plus, how often can you get an entire bowl of an alcoholic beverage to share?! We got the ginger lemonade punch (small bowl) for $19. The punch is pre-made.. and sadly, it didn't pack much punch. We didn't even feel a buzz from it. Other than that, the bar was just a bar.. nothing special. They do have a build your own Bloody Mary bar if that's your thing.
author: Caitlin R.

description: Ok! Brian is the shit!!!! Before all the bouncers were not nice people. So glad you hired Brian!!!!
author: Fatima Zahra E.

description:
LADIES STAY CLEAR. seriously, for real for real. decided to take my friends that were visiting from NYC here. we stayed a few hours and spent quite a few dollars. once closing time came we were hustled out to the point of abuse. "enough - give me your drinks. we're closing -  dump your drinks. who the fuck are you BITCH dump your drink." AWFUL AWFUL AWFUL. and this was at 1:40! i have NEVER been called a bitch at an establishment before, especially after giving them my business. INSANITY. i wanted to give them a piece of my mind but my girlfriend rushed in and told me it wasn't with the fight. " who the ^*+# are you bit** - I'll never forget it. 

i plan on calling you guys in the morning and giving you an earful. best of luck coming up with a good excuse boys :)
author: Christine N.

description: Ben the door guy and Brian the bartender were absolutely awesome!  For someone who frequents these bars I am absolutely going to tel you this place is a must. They have tacos brought to you from next door and I had no idea until Brian Ben the door guy told me about it. Great customer service guys. I can't wait to be back!
author: Steven T.

description:
It was 1:40 am. We had a lot of our "bowl" left in the glasses. "Bitch who are you?" - your employees said to my wife when she was justifying finishing her drink. Believe me we weren't alone or drunk. Just hanging out at a local bar.
We will never spend our money at a place like that.
author: Ievgenii B.

description: Want to have a great drinking experience?  Come here. Sit at the bar and order a punch. They are great, as is the jukebox. I'd make the trek from across town, even if I didn't live 3 blocks away.
author: Christina G.

description: Pretty decent happy hour.... Whole different scene then some of the other glorious watering holes of Upper Haight. It can get weird later so make sure u at least stop bye. I mean its the Haight..... Its always fun and weird.
author: Ryan N.

description:
Nice little bar in the Haight-Ashbury neighborhood. It caught our eye as we walked by because of the sign outside that said over 100 rums ... that's my liquor of choice. Unfortunately, they did not have any of my favorite brand, Cruzan. Specifically, I was looking for Cruzan 151, a dark rum. They didn't even have Bacardi 151 so I tried something new to me, Plantation. I do prefer runs that are sugar-based and not molasses-based so didn't care for Plantation. 

Ambiance of the bar was cool though. Only rating a three star because of the limited dark rum options.
author: Rika W.

description:
In an era when craft cocktails are resurgent and David Wondrich is publishing well-researched books about punch recipes of yore, why would anyone settle for an eighth-class rum bar? I don't know either, but every time I walk by Hobson's Choice, it's filled with people nonetheless.

If it's fine punch you're after, go to Smuggler's Cove, Pagan Idol, Rickhouse, or some other high-class establishment that serves liquor by the bowlful. If you just want a good cocktail, well, San Francisco is an embarrassment of riches, but you can hit the Alembic if you're already in the Haight for some reason.

On the other hand, if you want sickly sweet adult beverages by the gallon, and you want to drink them while surrounded by loud, annoying douchebags, Hobson's Choice is the place to be.
author: Jeff W.

description: Great staff, great ambiance, great Fernet!!!! Neighborhood vibe, safe, fun. Great music.
author: Terry B.

description:
Just a fun, neighborhood place to hang out.
I only go in there maybe once every couple months, and the bartender remembers my name!
It's rare to get that kind of high quality employee these days.
I make sure to bring friends from out of town to Hobson's and we're always treated well. 

parking sucks...
author: C J.

description:
I use to love this place but nope not anymore. They might as well just give you water instead of disguising it as a punch bowl..... but that's for a different story.

My issue is that I came in on a chill Saturday afternoon with my puppy. Before we even walked in the bartender gave us dirty looks. My friend asked if the place was dog friendly. The bartender replied no and went along with his day. I understand my 8lb Maltipoo would caused havoc to your precious little bar (kidding) but just yesterday the same friend I went with on Saturday told me there were 3 dogs inside the bar. Is it special treatment, privilege or he just did not want us there? If you read reviews online the bar says "dog friendly" but just not to me

Carry on
author: Kay B.

description: I came of a long fight from UK. Brian my bar tender made me feel very relaxed and comfortable. I like this bar has all different people. Thanks again Brian
author: Phil W.

description: I've been to this bar several times and NEVER had any bad attitude from anybody working here, the bouncer and the bartenders were perfectly friendly despite the fact that many of the times I was here it was really crowded. I like the rum fruit punch drinks a lot and they also have a pretty good selection of beers if you don't feel like drinking anything that sweet. They also play good music.
author: Nina L.

description: The absolute worst place I have ever been to. Horrible service. Horrible cocktails. I would recommend you skip this one and keep going
author: Cody M.

description:
Stopped by here for happy hour (5-7PM) a couple times. Prices have gone up a little -- Beer for $3.50 and Punch/Margaritas/Well drinks for $3.50-$4. I usually go and get one of each type of punch and leave in a pleasantly buzzed state. Not too strong, more like stealth juice. 

They have a featured cocktail ($5) for the happy hour each day, definitely worth checking out because their cocktails are STRONG. Got the Blue Hawaiian ($8) once and was nursing it all night. One and done! 

Credit card limit is $10. They let you bring in food from the Street Taco next door. Great place for unwinding after work!
author: Abby W.

description: Had a great night here with friends! The drinks aren't priced too high, the music is great, and there is plenty of seating. I highly recommend coming here.
author: Victoria L.

description:
I need to have a look at some other Hobson's Choice reviews to see if anyone else has had a bad time with that miserable barman with the grey goatee who wears the beret. He's basically the rudest guy you're ever going to meet. He must own the place because nobody in their right minds would employ someone with such spectaculary shitty people skills. Honestly, you'll think you've just walked into a SNL sketch. He's like that all the time so I'm guessing he sees it as a "style". The first time he served me I was laughing because I thought he was doing it for a joke but then he stayed in character. This is such an SF problem. Places like that get a lot of tourists and bar staff like him have long since decided to treat all customers like clueless assholes. Yelp have to start allowing no stars.

So, I Just had a close look at the other reviews and it turns out that my experiences pale in comparison! This bar is clearly encouraging bad behavior in their staff like it's some kind of feature. I live in SF, have done for years and work hard for the crazy rent. We're not all wide-eyed tourists. Still we have to put up with the "Too cool for school" malcontent who's done nothing else for the past 20 odd years. Enjoy the next ten and good luck with the tourists because that's all you're going to end up with.
author: Derry D.

description: Good drinks. Bouncer is a rude jerkoff though. Who talks shit about someone drivers license photo? Lmao. Bruh, you're a career bouncer... stop talking.
author: Michael T.

description:
What a delightful establishment!

I happened upon it after a bleary-eyed afternoon shopping at the various vintage/secondhand stores nearby. Small bowl of House punch was $16 and generously portioned for three of us, easy to share among four or five, too, depending how much each of you wants to drink. 

Strength-wise, it's not going to knock you off your feet the way a scorpion bowl at Smuggler's Cove would, but a) that's more expensive anyway, and b) punch generally depends a bit on the person making it, so your mileage may vary. 

I don't always love the fruity drinks, but it's a novel, fun, and comfortable spot for a drink and there are other options if punch isn't really your thing.
author: Krista L.

description:
Stopped in to get a drink and check it out. It's right in the hub of Haight street and corner of Clayton. If you get there early enough you can get a seat by the windows and enjoy all the colorful people watching! There is plenty to go around! They are known for their punches, but beware they are premade and are super sugary! I can only handle one because I don't want a massive headache from the sugar crash later. HAPPY HOUR is 5-7pm
They have a different special every day and feature weekly drinks also.
Also**tip, you can sit wherever you want but order at the bar...they will not come to you ;)
author: Kimberly P.

description: Our bowl was really good! Not to over powering.would had liked it to be a tad bit stronger but overall I would go back for sure!
author: Noemi D.

description:
I was staying right around the corner while visiting SF for a conference. When it came time to checkout of my place at noon, I still had a few hours to kill before heading to the airport. 

Enter Hobson's Choice. And what a nice choice it was. 

Waddled in here with baggage in tow and sat at the bar. The bartender, Chris, was exceptionally polite, professional, and served up a mean Dark and Stormy (this is coming from someone who is normally a whiskey neat guy). 

The bar definitely has that cozy old living room feel. Glancing around at the patrons, it was easy to see that many people treated it as such. It definitely served the purpose for me.
author: Rex F.

description:
We passed by and saw some cool bowls that people were using to fill their cups with. Is it alcohol? Is it good? We stopped at the front and read their menu and blackboard. How fun! Punch bowls!!!! We stood at the front eager to be seated, greeted, and have our orders taken. But with no avail. 

After standing there for a couple minutes, We awkwardly walked to the bar because it seemed like he was the only one working. It took him some time after helping some people already sitting at the bar to even notice us. He angrily asked for our IDS and carelessly asked us what we wanted. I felt as if his demeanor changed when he was serving us. It didn't seem like he was treating other people rudely. However, he wasn't lively at all. We told him we changed our mind and left utterly disappointed.
author: Lynn C.

description:
Typical dive bar on haight st with awesome happy hour specials

$3 draft beers!! You can choose from lagunitas, 21st, anchor and even more popular brands

Wow!

The sweet bartender even topped my 21st watermelon beer with a mini slice of watermelon. Refreshing and cheap!

My hour was definitely happy :)
author: Carol Y.

description: Absolutely the best bar in town and all because of the bartenders Meghan and Leath (?sp)
author: Elena N.

description: This place had amazing customer service, chill vibes and was a fun atmosphere overall. It was fun sitting by the window and watching the hustle and bustle outside. I gave this place only 4 stars because part of the bar smelled like pee, the ladies room really smelled like pee and had the window completely open, which is potentially a peeping tom's dream come true. If the pee on the floors were mopped up the window wouldn't have to be so open that it exposes the occupant's bits to the world. With that being said I would still go back because of the customer service, the drinks and because the energy in there was so awesome.
author: Emilia B.

description:
I was tired after a long day at work and decided to stop in here for a quick drink before heading home. It was about 6PM on a Friday and it was already crowded because of the baseball game, but my usual dark haunt (Zam Zam's) was too crowded for me to have a quiet seat at the bar. 

The guy checking ID's at the door really liked my earrings and felt compelled to grab my eat lobes (both of them) to better check them out. For me, this wasn't a huge deal, just mildly irritating but I just went with it, he was just trying to be nice. I think most other women would have been offended or upset that a stranger would take liberties with just grabbing her earlobes like that. So, don't do that anymore. Especially without asking first. He was lucky I was too tired to lecture him. 

I ordered a well Greyhound since my best friend told me Gordon's is okay. It was very cheap! Only $3.50, so I'm guessing it was happy hour. It wasn't grapefruit juice though, it was like disgustingly sweet pink "grapefruit drink". Whatever, it was three bucks. This place seems cool if you're some kind of a person who doesn't give a crap about anything but being Chad's and Becky's. Today I was feeling specially apathetic, so the bar patrons having a good time watching sports and stuff didn't really annoy me as much as they normally would. 

Meh. I bet it would have been funner with my crew... But where would we all sit? It was fine for what it was. I'll probably go back again eventually.
author: Vanessa B.

description: This five star rating is for having one of the most complete happy hour drink menu.  In addition to a daily drink special they also have (from 5-7pm) $3-$5 beers, punches, cocktails, well drinks, and the day I was there they had $5 glenlivet.  Spent the entire 2 hours trying different beers, wells, liquor, and punches.
author: Dan O.

description:
Drinks: this place does not disappoint!  Their mixed drinks are strong and does the job!  Don't be fooled by the cute names for their punches, one too many and you'll be walking out stumbling on your feet and landed on your face!

Services: the bartenders are all nice, fast, and attentive.  The times I've been here, dead or busy, I never had to wait more than a minute for my drinks.  

Atmosphere: it's a bit funky, especially the bathroom lol but it adds a cool flavor to the place. 

Crowds: you get a mix of everything, young/old/pot head sometimes. 

Overall, one of my fave places to hit up when I'm in the Haight ;D
author: Katie N.

description: The owner reached out yesterday to apologize for our bad experience which was cool of him.  It also told me that it was not the owner that we came into contact with.  I'll give them an extra star for that and for not trying to make up a lame excuse for their doorman's bad behavior.
author: Sophia G.

description: I base my reviews on 4 things. Service, product, cleanliness,and atmosphere. I really wanted to like this joint, seriously! From the outside it seemed like a cool ass steampunk class A joint that serves punch for all that are thirsty...hooray what a find! We walk in and encounter the doorman and bartender, both were surly and not very nice. Second, the product...I felt more of a rush at my sixth grade punch bowl because at least I got a sugar high...this punch was weak AF and it cost us nearly $40. Third cleanliness...the girls rest room was a house of horrors with gook flowing towards the drain in the middle.lastly the atmosphere, imagine the NY subway line when people start going fucking bonkers and you find yourself looking at your phone as if it's going to virtually take you away from everything that's going down surrounding you. I would've liked it more if the first impression was correct..a cool ass steampunk joint with drinks that made you relaxed and an  atmosphere that showed the workers cared.
author: Grace F.

description: This bar is right around the corner from my house. I love the bartenders and general decor and environment, but every time I go to this bar some creepy dude (usually someone who seems like a street kid) gets WAY too into my personal space and the bouncer doesn't seem to notice until I'm driven into having a disruptive confrontation with the drunkard. This is a fairly common occurrence anywhere around Haight but it seems to happen even more often here than usual -- maybe they should start kicking out the creepy men, it's definitely driving my business away :(
author: Emily S.

description: Nice and casual. Got the house punch bowl last night and the regular size can serve about 8 cups or so. It was really sweet, easy to drink but not very strong. There were also maraschino cherries in them, ew.
author: Juliana P.

description:
LOVE this place!!!!
Happen to be in Haight during happy hour? RUN to Hobson's for a Go Go punch! 
The first time I went, I had a margarita. Terrible lol. Then I had one of their punches, and I will never look back.
THe place is cute. Love the little tables by the windows. Bartenders are super nice. 
Now every time the old man says we have some errands to run in the city, I make sure to add Hobson's to the list :)
author: Kat R.

description:
The happy hour is an awesome deal!

After going to OTG just a couple blocks away, we decided to grab a few drinks and I came across this bar on Yelp!

The only thing I wasn't too fond of was the way the bartender checked our IDs. 3/4 of us have Florida licenses (yes...still haven't found myself able to fully convert to a Cali one!), and he was almost accusing us of having fakes...Idk, I just didn't appreciate the attitude. But luckily he didn't give us too hard of a time.

Now on to the happy hour, $3 for beers and house punch, and $3.50 for Victorian and Go Go punch!! I believe wells were included somewhere in there..but I can't quite remember. BUT DON'T WORRY ABOUT THAT AND GET THE PUNCH! I was a little hesitant about how these would taste, but I was surprised how refreshing they were! But be careful, while they may not taste that strong, you can definitely feel it. 

Overall, this place is great for the happy hour. SO CHEAP!!!

Oh, and $20 min on credit cards.
author: Noelle H.

description: This is probably the best bar I have ever been to sf.  I love the drinks they serve here. It good if you came with your friends.
author: Surya R.

description:
Hobson's is a fun choice in the Haight, perfect for a bit of day-drinking or even a nightcap. Hobson's specializes in "Victorian Punch Bowls" which are delicious, sugary-fruity rum mixtures, perfect for sharing. They offer three varieties, but my personal favorite is the Victorian, which is a blend of three rums (silver, coconut and pineapple) + Cranberry/Pineapple juice. It reminds me of a naughty pink lemonade in color and flavor. 

A small bowl is perfect for two people-- at $18, it makes it a steal. I'm not quite sure how strong a bowl is-- considering that they have three super large bowls of pre-made punches that they use to serve customers. I suppose it depends on whoever made it. Regardless, you feel like you're getting a good deal as it's easy to keep refilling your own glass. 

The space itself is spacious in the front, with large windows, perfect for people-watching. Or, you could find yourself tucked in the back corners or upstairs for something more quiet. That being said, it's more of a dive bar environment, lest you think its name as a "Victorian Punch Bar" would produce something more quaint. Plus, they have plenty of TVs, meaning those looking for a sports game will probably find it on here.
author: Bryan B.

description: I've actually never needed to leave a rating,nor complain online but I recently went here and ran into a friend of mine having a drink alone. I was leaving after buying a few beers before I saw her and so I sat down. It was pretty empty as well. We talked for about 15 mins before a bartender,differ from the one I closed my tab with,told me I needed to "leave the seat" and from my friend, pretty much telling me to leave her, it seemed like a misunderstanding because the bartender asked me aggressively only once ... and not needed I'm a paid customer,other then that they had good beer and nice themed place  but the short bartender with glasses motivated me to give this review. Don't talk to customers like that I'm never going back.
author: Mike L.

description:
Hobson's Choice is an always fun, casual, homey bar. It's a great place for groups. Try snagging the somewhat-hidden/under-the-radar upstairs portion if you're looking to hang out with a group of friends. 

The notorious punch bowls are fun to order but not very strong which makes them a bit hard to drink. (Read: you'll get a stomachache from sugar before a buzz from the alc) Fortunately, it's a bar. Bars serve LOTS of alcohol. So, opt for your usual drink of choice.
author: Caroline L.

description:
I don't know why this place smells like a dirty bar rag and I don't care. They serve $5 tall glasses ($3 during happy hour) of potent punch and that's all I need. 

I walked in stone-cold sober (okay, I was a little hungover) and I left... well, I don't really know how to describe it. I wasn't drunk. I might have been tipsy. I was definitely happy. I think the drinks here legit made me a better person. Or at least a buzzed person... which might be the same thing. 

I also learned a valuable lesson in cultural differences when I got suspicious of what I thought were grifters at the bar trying to talk to my only friend and I. We aren't really people persons and we certainly don't give off the, 'I want to be talked to by strangers.' vibe, so I could only assume that they wanted to kill, rob, and rape us (in that order, if we had to pick), but then I realized the true meaning of being in The Haight: Strange people talking to you for largely no reason, but a little because they want some change. 

Here's a graph in case that helps"
________________________________________________
Why strange people talk to you in The Haight:           
                                                                                      
                    90%                                                           
                  _______
                 |             |
                 |             |
                 |             |
                 |             |
                 |             |
                 |             |
                 |             |                              10%
                 |             |                           _______
                 |             |                          |             |        
_________________________________________________
(Peace, love, & just because)    (they want your money)
__________________________________________________

I was super impressed with how good the 3 different kinds of punch we had were considering they were scooped out of totally unhygienic open-air punch bowls that were straight chillin' on the back of the kinda stinky bar. It reminded me of a my family's very lower-middle class bridal showers in a church basement where we pretend like one of the punch bowls isn't spiked with Skol Vodka we got on sale for 99 cents a gallon... only this punch was the real deal, with actual ingredients that didn't consist of melted sherbert ice cream and mountain dew (which, I sh*t you not, was actually served at a distant relative of mine's baby shower). 

And I know I poked a bit of fun about this place's smell, but after the first few sips you just kind of forget about it. And let's be real, this is San Francisco... there are far worse smells than dirty bar rag that we could be smelling. 

My girl Dana G and I had a blast getting lubed up here before letting loose in The Haight and honestly, I totally prefer the punch here to the cocktails at Alembic.
author: Candice G.

description:
Rum punches in an old Victorian house-turned-bar. They're all pretty sweet (too sweet for me), though with questionable strength. Great for happy hour, a little refreshment while strolling the Haight.

The bartender was a sweetheart. No food, but you can BYO. I think he may have mentioned chips/popcorn but we didn't see any.

Patrons range from girls in their early 20's to white-haired men. Everyone likes rum punch!
author: Vivian H.

description: Great place to have low price rum during happy hour. Music is a little high to have a talk. Order the pitcher is a high recommend to spend time in there.
author: Juan Camilo C.

description:
Love this neighborhood hangout! The vibe is homey, lively, and non-pretentious. I came with a couple friends from out of town and together we tried to finish off a large punch bowl. Synopsis? Delicious, juicy and much stronger than it tastes! Must be all the mixed rums they put in it. 

There's a juke box and and upstairs/ under the stairs seating area if you're looking for something more private. Otherwise street seating is great for people watching. I'll be back for those bloody marys for some day drinking!
author: Ruth M.

description: Very bad experience with waitress, rude and awful customer service. Apart from that prices are pretty high, the bar itself is nice and clean, security guy should smile at people, he is too serious. I am a really respectull person and I expect the same thing from others. I feel really disapointed, will not go back again.
author: Bob B.

description: Waitstaff is BEYOND RUDE!!! Other places where thier staff SMILES & GREETS you 2, these girls here at this place act like youre bothering them!!! But coffee is good honestly speaking.
author: Julia N.

description:
Decent punch bowls if your alcohol standards aren't too high.

Pleasant bartender.
author: Inigo M.

description:
Such an awesome bar to sit and enjoy a drink in. An all glass shop front offers prime people watching at the 43 bus stop. This is definitely a place for rum-aholics. Nice bartenders, good prices, and an awesome happy hour. It also seems immune to the San Francisco bar funk smell. 

I would definitely bring people back here. As of 02/2014 if you download the ScoutMob app you can receive 50% off of your first visit's bill.
author: Jack A.

description:
Came on a game day and the TV's were all on and SUPER loud...it was just awful! All I could hear was the most annoying loud screeching of the basketball players shoes. You couldn't hear or speak to anyone and all the people in there were zombies glued to the TV. 

The punch drinks are basically juice. I don't think they have any alcohol in them and are way too sweet. Stick to the beers! 

Prices are good though and so is the happy hour. Nice that you can bring your own food into their bar. 

Probably a much nicer spot on non-game days but we had to leave right away it was just too much for our ears to handle. 

Also, bouncer was ID'ing everyone...which I thought was kinda funny. Like people that were clearly 50+ were getting ID'd.
author: Lina K.

description: GREAT rums and even better bartenders! Wow did my wife and I have a good time here. I'll definitely be back.
author: Jeff G.

description:
This place is one of my favorite bars in the US. The bowls of liquor laden punch are amazing and just add to the general awesomeness. Service as well as the clientele are super friendly. You will meet people here and have conversations that you just wouldn't be able to anywhere else. 

Share a punch bowl with an old hippie, talk literature with a drunk old professor, take a shot with some tourists - you get it all here.

Absolutely the quintessential definition of what makes a great drinking establishment!
author: Tom L.

description:
I am sure that this bar has a valid reputation in the community, but my experience was atrocious. The bartenders (there was a man and a woman) were rude to us from the start. Everybody in my group was respectful and friendly, and yet our requests were received with contempt. I'm not sure if somebody was just having a bad evening, but bickering with your customers is a really poor representation of your business. 
We had a couple drinks, but stopped ordering because we no longer wanted to spend money at a bar where we felt unwelcome.

Also, please list that there is pineapple in the "go go" punch on your wall. We intentionally ordered the punch "without pineapple" only to receive a drink that had an overwhelming pineapple flavor. I know it doesn't seem like a big deal, but paired with bad service, it wasn't a great experience.
author: Mina Z.

description:
When you're on the Haight and want to stop for a cozy drink, this is not a bad choice. I've been here twice now, and won't turn away a Blue Hawaiian. Their Victorian Punch is also decent.

Multiple televisions run on the walls, so whether you want to view sports or Cartoon Network, you're bound to be hooked somewhere. There is a 2nd floor, perhaps closed off (because I haven't seen anyone up there yet), assumedly for parties -- might be fun to test out.

One thing: various bartenders will leave different fruits in your cocktails. I think a pineapple slice tastes better than a lemon.
author: Garett T.

description:
My little sis decided to take me here, and I must say I had an awesome time.  
Nice size bar
Great bartenders
Decently priced
Juke Box
Clean Bathrooms
Fun Atmosphere
We had a blast... well I know I definitely did :)  I would come back for sure.
author: Bryanna P.

description:
Been coming here on and off over the years for as long as I can remember.  

Megan behind the bar here has always been my favorite...she totally rocks and makes a good place even better.  She has a sweet personality and a wonderful rapport with all her patrons...regardless of whether you are a first-timer or a crusty old regular, she always makes everyone feel welcome and comfortable.  Naturally, there is a full bar, but in addition, there are also three kinds of house punch here...House, Go Go, and Victorian.  Surprisingly, all three are good and way better than you might expect for any pre-made punch.  Victorian is my favorite with House a close second, followed by the Go Go.  Way stronger than you might expect and if you come during happy hour, only $3.50...what a deal!

A corner bar with plenty of glass area for people watching, Hobson's Choice has always retained a fun, lively vibe.  An ecelectic crowd hangs in this haunt...a little of everything in here with locals rubbing elbows with tourists and everything else in-between.   A nice cross-section of humanity with whom to interact and imbibe. 

I was going to make this review a four, but because of Megan and the outstanding service from all the staff, reasonable Happy Hour pricing, plus all the fun times I always seem to have in here, I'll bump it up a star.  Definitely in the top three of my favorite bars to drink at in the upper Haight.

Enjoying a rum punch and engaging in lively banter is a decades old tradition here at Hobson's in the Haight...long may it last so that future generations can enjoy it for decades to come!
author: Roy N.

description:
Looking for a cool, 21 + place to drink in the Haight? Look no further, this place is awesome! They have great drinks, great drink prices, and a very cool vintage/westerner vibe. I loved how spacious it was, and think it is a great spot for groups. They had lots of outlets to charge up your devices (which I know is a godsend when you are on vacation in the city and constantly checking into places and taking photos and using all the juice in your phone). The staff were funny and friendly and I definitely will be back!

Also, their drinks that utilize punch are cool because they have huge punch bowls made fresh daily with yummy juices!

YUM!
author: Amanda C.

description: This place is great.  I will definitely come again.  The owner was behind the bar and was so friendly, the other customers were really nice too.  My sister and I were trying to take a picture of us with our punch glasses, and the man beside us offered to take it for us under the sign.  We had a fantastic time and the punch was great.  They are really easy to drink so watch out!
author: Colleen M.

description:
After searching San Francisco for a nice hip place that wasn't completely empty and full of older people, my friends and I stumbled upon Hobson's choice.  

As soon as you walk in you will be carded, so be prepared.  There are couches to the left when you walk in, a bar to the right, there are more tables in the middle and far end, and I also noticed an upstairs.  The place was pretty lively, playing a wide variety of music.  The bartenders were very nice and helpful.  They have alcoholic punch here, and I have to say that it pals one hell of a punch.  It's pretty good, but free a few a those you might be good for the night.  The drinks aren't ricoculously priced, which was a plus, but you need a minimum of $20 to pay with credit or debit.  I seriously cannot wait to be back in San Francisco so I can come back to this place again.
author: Jesus H.

description:
Hobson's Choice is never my first choice, but I've only had good experiences in the dozens of time I've been here. 

I usually stick to some type of house punch.

I'd classify this as a mellow low key bar. Even when it's slammed on a Saturday night you can usually find a quietish corner to drink your rum.
author: Justin S.

description:
If you are looking for a bar to sit and waste the day away at, I would highly recommend this place. Man, I LOVE Hobson's. Their punches are fun and so yummy! And yes, they can get you drunk. If you have a friend in town and want to reminisce about old times and not have to go to the bar every 20 minutes, get the bowl of punch, choose an hours worth of music from the digital juke box and BS the day away. I say "day" because it might be hard to have a conversation or get a seat on a Friday or Saturday night. But that's how it is at most bars in the city on the weekend. 

The bathrooms have always been clean when I went, and the bartenders have always been nice. Unfortunately, they do not serve food here, BUT you are allowed to bring in outside food, so that's cool. The area the bar is located in is a little annoying, Super touristy on the weekends and there are always young adult bums on the sidewalks asking for money and that gets annoying. But that isn't Hobson's fault. If you haven't already been, give it a try. I think you'll have fun!
author: Liz M.

description:
Really a 3.5, but can't quite go to a 4...I didn't try enough of their drinks to vouch for anything other than the punch.

My stars:  (5=epic "best of") (4=really tasty and want to go again and again) (3=good and will go back once in a while) (2=fair, might return for a visit if there was some glimmer of hope) (1=avoid at all costs)

Go or No?  Go.

Tease:   An old time quasi-dive bar in the Haight -Ashbury area.

Why I went:  My wife and her friend wanted to try their punch bowl!

When:  5/31/13

Food:  We got one of their punch bowls.  I honestly can't remember what was in it.  It was sweet, but not disgustingly so.  The bowl was pretty big, and took all 4 in our group to knock it down.  Thankfully we cabbed!  It was about $35 for the bowl.  We went upstairs and enjoyed the retro décor.

Service:  Good.  The bartender was efficient and nice.

Hints/Final thoughts:  It's a fun bar.  It didn't seem like anything too different or amazing.  But, it did the trick.  The punch was fun, but not to the level of something at the Roosevelt in Los Angeles.  We went in the late afternoon, so there wasn't much vibe.  You may need a n evening trek to fully get what the place is about.
author: Andy R.

description: Enjoyed this bar immensely. Bartender actually explained prices and how things work, which for a person who doesn't drink in bars all the time, is amazing. Got a great Happy hour deal on punch bowls. Thank you for your respectful help to a bar wimp.
author: Ian H.

description: This place was walking distance from the place we were staying at. This place had a definite college feel to it. Nice looking bar that specializes in rum. The drink I had was pretty strong and fruity. You can do a rum flight, if you really want to learn about the different flavors of rum. The boyfriend ordered one and couldn't finish it because rum is not his forte. He did enjoy each sip of each rum! The service could have been a little better. We could tell that the bartender was a bit impatient and was eager was us to order our drinks. Overall, the place was decent.
author: Angelie D.

description: Fun bar for casual drinks. Super nice bartenders and cozy place to day drink when it's rainy out. Good location with nearby shops
author: Kelly R.

description: I LOVE the rum cocktails here. I usually have a great time. However how can you give more than 2 stars to a place where the bartender is so awful to you? He was grumpy and got really mad when we ordered 3 drinks...You work in a rum bar dude. I ordered a pint of sidecar beer from the other bartender then when we came back up this guy I ordered again a pint of sidecar. He gave me a sidecar cocktail and i said im sorry sorry I meant a pint of the sidecar beer and he told me it did not exist. He said we have 10 beers. What one do you want? I said sidecar...and pointed at the tap saying SIDECAR. He got really angry and said that ORANGE BEER NOT SIDECAR. He was awful. In SF there are plenty of nice bars. I wouldn't send you here no matter how nice the rum is!
author: Bla B.

description:
Bartender/ owner is BLACK no he isn't racist (and I am not White either)...

great place, especially off hours and mid week, SUPER chill is the scene....
author: C... D.

description: The prices are great and the punch drinks are a good idea but the bartender was pretty moody, seemed to be frustrated with those who took time to order, and he adamantly hates the Giants. He said he is a Mets fan so I guess his pissiness makes sense. As a bartender, you dont want to publicly announce that in SF. No bueno.
author: Eric B.

description:
We only got the small Bowl of House Punch. It was just about enough for 2 people (or 3-4 if your party doesn't drink that much). While it was tasty, it wasn't too strong, but I guess it was because I was feeling it through the night. I didn't try the other punches but I thought I'd go with the House Punch since it's their own personal basic concoction. 

We got the El Grande Nachos as well which are cooked next door at Asqew Grill and delivered to our spot at the bar. The nachos were pretty yummy. We asked if we could get beef/chicken on the side but they couldn't accommodate that. It's like the line cooks are only allowed to do what's written on a piece of paper. I expect that from a chain restaurant.

I'd come back anytime for a drink here especially if I'm hanging around Upper Haight. I want to try their Hemp Ale. I would say this one of many other bars worth checking out if you're in the area (like Alembic or Magnolia).

Only 21 and up are allowed to enter.
author: Marlon T.

description:
I went here for a quick Thursday Happy Hour and it was a great choice. They had a good rum drinks for 3.50 and 3 beers. A nice place to stop in when strolling through the Haight.

Also the bartender was friendly and conversational.
author: Marcus T.

description:
Hobson's Choice is never my first choice, but when Alembic and Magnolia and Zam Zam are bursting at the seams, Hobsons becomes my only choice. Which is better than no choice at all!

Punches are fun, no doubt about it. The smell of spilled punch marinating in the carpeted floor over the past who-knows-how-many-years? Not so fun. We sipped our extra-tart mojito and pineapple punch on the saggy bench seat, and quickly scurried along our way. The same scenario as the last time. 

If you simply need a drink - which we certainly did - Hobson's will hook you up. It's just not my fave spot to linger too long. They're cash only, with an ATM inside. Take note!
author: Nique F.

description:
Fairly priced drinks and not too crowded and has a decent number of seats. During the weekends I usually could find some seats and could have a conversation without screaming over the music. I haven't met all the bar tenders but the ones I have met are good.

I go there with mixed company quite a bit and the female friends don't feel like they are constantly being stared upon and people there seem to be a bit more down to earth compared to other bars.
author: Moses L.

description:
Still loving this place. Monday through Friday 5PM-7PM Happy Hour, with $3 and $3.50 Punch, Daiquiri and Well specials. 
Downstairs is the sports spot, where people grabbing a beer, hanging out at the bar, watching sports sit, where as upstairs is more for small intimate groups, I usually sit alone, near the window looking out on the side street checking out the people. 
The drinks are not overly strong, but still have enough alcohol in them to make the price a deal. Service is fast, friendly, and I was flattered I was asked for ID, being 35 years old. This place is a staple in SF.
author: William D.

description:
I've been to Hobson's choice several times, but never did I go on Bloody Mary Sunday. They set up a Bloody Mary bar with all the fixings and you can make your own. 

I am a huge fan of Bloody Mary's and luckily so was my date. Bonus! He and I hung out at the bar, enjoyed watching multiple football games while chatting and drinking our Bloody Mary's. 

I noticed that they delivered food to the bar, so we ordered an order of Nachos which they delivered from Askew next door. They were pretty interesting with a BBQ kind of sauce on them, not bad - just different.
author: Rebekah T.

description:
Went here with friends one night and the experience was OK. The drinks are a little pricey and the "tropical" ones didnt taste like alcohol. 

The place has a nice mellow look to it but the bathroom is horrendous. Smells horribly and is dirty reminds me of a club bathroom.


The bartender was nice however he/she would take a while to get over to you cause he/she would be focused on talking to a customer or be outside smoking and leave the bar empty.
author: Nina M.

description:
So this is what Cheers would look like in real life! Great for a weekday get together with a small group of friends. 

Relaxed vibe, friendly local patrons, fast/friendly service, cozy 70s/80s wooden SF furnishings. One of my new favorite hangouts!
author: Fiona Y.

description:
Really cool bar in the Haight with some local flair and really helpful bartenders. The atmosphere's laid back and definitely inviting.

Great for:
*Groups
*Girly drinks - PUNCH! (Rum and some fruity greatness)
      ^On that note, a punch bowl -which will serve a large group- is $35. Just. do it.
*Meeting someone up over a beer or two.
author: Colleen M.

description: The al pastor tacos make it... carved from the spit. I was so excited about it, I went right on down on them and didn't even think to snap a photo. Pleasant atmosphere. Lackluster staff.
author: Mark E.

description:
Casual bar in the heart of Haight.  We decided to come here after work for happy hour on a Thursday evening.  It was pretty relaxed and most of the patrons kept to themselves.  There were a few people at the bar talking to one another, a small group intently watching a game, some other people here and there.. and then there was our group.  I honestly thought it would be a bit more lively.. come on people!!  It's a Thursday night and there's an awesome happy hour.. WAKE UP!!!

Rum seems to be their specialty here.  They are famous for their rum punch.  The House punch is a blend of silver rum, mango, orange and pineapple juices, and the Victorian punch is a silver, coconut, and pineapple rums blended with a cranberry-pineapple juice.  I kept asking my friends whether or not they tasted alcohol in my drink because I couldn't taste it at all!  It was awesome!  But after a while, I started to feel a bit warmer..  DANGEROUS!  It's like drinking jungle juice at a frat party..  you just don't know until it hits you like a train later on!  

I was also quite please to see Carlsberg on their beer list.  I don't think I've seen that beer on tap in the U.S.  I first fell in love with it in Scotland, and I have missed it ever so much.  I also heard their tangerine beer is pretty awesome, so I'll have to try it out next time.

Overall, it's a pretty chill place to grab a drink.  You can definitely strike up a conversation here since it's not too loud.  By the same token, it would be nice if it was a little more festive and energetic.... 3.5
author: Cecilia S.

description: The Victorian punch bowl is delicious, amazing, and SO worth the headache it'll give you later.
author: Hannah H.

description:
A great little bar that everyone must visit. We had the regular punch bowl and it was delicious! You have to buy the punch bowl here.

The bartender was drunk but a lot of fun.
author: Karthik K.

description:
I've always been a fan of Hobsons.

Some of my favorite mash-ups were given to me by one of their bartenders, I've spend many a sunny day in San Francisco (not a oxymoron as I've spread them over several years) sipping infused drinks and people watching at the window, and many nights there when nothing else was going on in the Haight with locals and lost tourists.

Best part about it, you can tell whether it's full from a distance without a direct drive by or a jump out.

Worst part, it doesn't get the draw it should losing people to Haight Street Faigh-kes that have no business being there. 

As a "Victorian Punch House" it could only succeed more if it decked itself out in more Victorian chairs and couches (which almost certainly would be ruined by those imbibing the amazing punch). So that's understandable.
author: Mike V.

description: Walking around the area and I came upon a Victorian punch house.  What the heck is that? I was definitely intrigued and convinced the rest of my party to come inside.  It was early afternoon on a Saturday so the place wasn't too busy at all.  I liked the menu, lots of drink choices.  The atmosphere was just okay I think the only special part of this place is their punch.  Some of us got the raspberry ginger lemonade punch, the coconut cranberry punch, and the zombie.  I liked them all but the zombie.  One thing I appreciate is that the punch is not too obnoxiously sweet.  It was sweet but not over powering.  And they were good!  I like the idea of buying an entire punch bowl and enjoying it with friends, if I come back I will do that.  Interesting place!
author: Kate F.

description:
Walked here from Castro in the rain with my brother. He told me about the spiked punch bowls. We sat at the bar. It's a very nice and cozy Victorian style bar with a friendly crowd. We ordered a bowl. The bartender asked if we were sure because it's a commitment. We weren't so he gave us a taste test and decided to go with the girly glass instead. Very delicious but a bit much for two people (there are two sizes of bowls). I'd say order one if your party consist of 3 or more. 

They had a "dark and stormy" special. So we ordered that next. Also very good. After that we had a couple pbr's because apparently it's big with the hipster crowd up here. (Don't get me wrong. I didn't get the impression it was a hipster bar.)

The bartender was very nice and knowledgable. We asked him where the name came from and he gave us a cool history lesson. 

We were on a bit of a budget so we didn't stay all night. But long enough to have a great time and a good buzz before we went back into the rain. 

I recommend checking it out. 
I rec
author: Joseph K.

description:
First couple of times I went here was more randomly than planned. I like that they serve food (from Asqew next door), although the wait usually seems long and food often comes out cold (not sure who to blame on this one though). 

After that I started hanging out with a friend who lives in the neighborhood and I kind of became a more frequent visitor. Now I go out of my way to go here and bring new friends here.

It's a fun bar, good drinks for a decent price. Some people say the staff has attitude but I feel like you get what you put into this place. If you have attitude, don't tip or don't have patience, then don't expect excellent customer service. If you're friendly, tip and have patience the bartenders will go out of their way to make sure you have a good time here.

I think the only thing they could improve is to make sure the food you order from Asqew is served warm. I also feel like the food is better when you order directly from Asqew, as if they don't like it when Hobson's Choice customers order from them. My appetizer was burned and cold. But again, not sure who is to blame for this.
author: Helen D.

description: Great dive bar; classic SF. Decent beer selection, awesome bartenders, if you like punch, thumbs up. Props for being allowed to bring in outside food. We chilled here all night, got guac and chips from the taco place next door, later ordered burgers to be delivered (which were baller). Cool joint for a chill night.
author: Zara S.

description:
I visited this bar for the first time. I ordered the small bowl of rum punch. The bartender, "Tom" (grey goatee), was quite rude. He rushed us in ordering, and this when he wasn't really busy. Asking for water resulted in water coming, but he wasn't friendly about it. When he later came to clear the glasses from our table, he didn't greet us or ask us how it was -- even though we were the only customers in the entire bar at that point. I don't know what his deal was. I didn't get the feeling he was just having a bad day.

Asking for the ratio of alcohol to non-alcohol in the punch (so I'd know how much I can drink and drive safely) was answered with "about 3 to 1". He confirmed that was 3 parts alcohol to 1 part non-alcohol. Have you ever had 3 ounces of rum with 1 ounce of juice? It would taste horrible. I estimate the ratio was more akin to 1:4 or 1:5 -- i.e. it was weak. We each had 4 glasses of this punch. It tasted fine, but we didn't feel much.

The music was good -- 80's rock. Lots of The Police.

But rude service and weak drink? No more visits from us.
author: Rebecca M.

description:
If you're visiting San Francisco, you need to go to the Haight. If you go to the Haight, you need to go to Hobson's Choice. In addition to a full bar, they have some amazing rum punches which you can order by the glass, small bowl, or large bowl (meant for 3 or 4 people.)

Happy hour starts at 5, there's awesome burgers right across the street, and the staff is attentive without being obnoxious. Even when the bar is crowded getting drinks quickly is rarely an issue. 

Decor-wise this place is old school SF, which is exactly what works in the Haight. Upstairs area has a TON of vintage seating, the regulars are friendly as hell. You could easily come in here by yourself and leave with a few new friends, if you're the type to approach strangers at a bar.
author: Taylor S.

description: My favorite after work, hang out spot. This place is great for catching a drink and socializing. The space is comfortable and they have a cool selection of really strong punch they make in house. If you are going to go for one, try the orange one, it's the least sweet tasting. I like this place because the hipster ratio is pretty low and the vibe is chill. It's also right on the corner where 33, 43 and 71 bus stops so you can have a as many drinks as you want and you can still home safe.
author: Horace G.

description:
Came here to celebrate a friend's birthday get-together. Arrived late and thinking "sh**, I won't find parking." Oh wait, there's plenty! +1 star the parking availability. Went inside and noticed my friend and a small group upstairs. I don't know how early they got there, but we had a huge table to ourselves. Someone bought a pineapple punch bowl and brought many cups. The bowl was huge and not to mention tasty. I had two cups because of the sweet deliciousness until maybe 20 minutes after the second cup when my face began feeling hot, "oh those sneaky little..." That's how they get you.
Enjoyable experience. The punch bowl, which I recommend, definitely brings an element of camaraderie since there is a lot of sharing involved.
author: Lily Z.

description:
I want to start this by saying that I love this bar. Whenever I am feeling particularly fruity, I head here for some terribly strong rum drink that tastes great and rocks my world. Last night I went here with a group of friends for a long awaited Mai Tai. My Mai Tai was stellar. My second drink was also great, BUT:

The door guy / guy clearing glasses grabbed my half-full $8.00 drink and threw a napkin in it. I checked with my table mates to see if I was crazy, and they all confirmed that I had plenty of drink left. When I asked him if I could have my drink back, he spilled some of what was left onto the table and immediately went on the defensive. He asked me if I really wanted my "lemons and alcohol back." I did, since I ordered a Caipirinha, which is sugar, rum, and lime. I politely told him I did not want his free drink, and this is where things got bat crap crazy.

He brought me a cup of sweet and sour mix with limes lining the rim of the glass. Lame. Hobson's Choice, you're always so good to me, but this time was terrible. The three people I brought to the bar were horrified by the way this guy acted. He was unbelievably rude to us and mean-mugged me the whole time. GET RID OF PEOPLE WHO CAN'T HANDLE SERVING OTHER PEOPLE! I worked at bars, clearing tables, and etc. for a long time, and it is not hard to be a decent human being to them. Particularly since you are basically being bribed by the establishment to be pleasant. Be nice to your customers. So disappointed with this employee's behavior. 

Now that I've gotten that off my chest...

Bottom line: the door guy (at least on Thursdays) isn't a very nice dude. The rest of the staff is great! The place is great! But don't let the rotten egg of the joint ruin your experience like he did mine.

----

Yep, this is my first Yelp review, but this dude mean-mugged me so hard I had to post something. One day, all of us will be sitting in hell drinking Mai Tai's and talking about the good ol' days, when the bad guy was just a door man having a bad night instead of Satan himself as our Overlord in the depths of the lake of fire. See you guys there.
author: Taylor H.

description: What a great bar right in the middle of Haight-Ashbury. Hubs and I wanted to check out the seen and stumbled upon Hobson's Choice. I was starving and quickly reassured by the bartender that the bartender could order burgers for us from Burger Urge next door and they would be delivered directly to our seats. We saddled up to the bar, ordered our beers and chatted with the friendly bartender. In about 15 minutes, our tasty burgers were delivered hot to our seats. We had more drinks and enjoyed the seen. Hobson's Choice was a great, relaxing bar to hang out and watch a game and just chat. Staff was friendly and accommodating - we would definitely return!
author: Lisa S.

description: I love that place ! Really Good music , good drinks ( my favorite punch go go ), friendly people
author: Andrea G.

description:
The perfect place to round up your friends for a celebratory punch bowl. Hell, round up your friends for a just-for-the-hell-of-it punch bowl.

Delicious rum punches. I'm typically a Scotch kinda gal. I'll have Irish whiskey more often than I'll have a mixed drink; there's something about a mixed drink that's always cloying or unpleasant. But these rum punches are so tasty.

+House Punch: silver rum with mango, orange, and pineapple juices
+Victorian Punch: silver, coconut, and pineapple rums with cranberry-pineapple juice

Perhaps it's the simplicity that makes these such tasty cocktails. 

Also: It's always slammed when I'm in here, but well worth the wait.
author: Adena B.

description: A fun 'old school' bar in the middle of the Haight.  Catch Happy Hour for the best deals.  The various rum based punches are the reason to go!  My GF and I switch up our choices on each visit.  The bartenders are great, the punch is the reason to be there!  They have a food deal set up with the taco place next door as well, though I haven't had them yet!
author: Jim P.

description:
My friends and I went to check out this place last night after seeing good reviews on yelp -- it lived up to the reviews! 

Its right on Haight and parking wasn't a problem, but it was a weeknight, so your mileage may vary on a weekend. 

It wasn't too crowded, but there were just enough people to keep it lively. This place has an upstairs as well as the first level seating. There are benches, tables, the bar, etc... lots of places to settle in for a fun night!

They had a great beer selection, but it was the punch bowls that won the night. 15 bucks for a bowl of punch - and it was *delicious* --- and dangerous! Surprisingly hard-hitting. 

The bathrooms are large too, so thats always a bonus! I'll totally be going back!
author: Kate D.

description: Stopped in for a drink last Friday, which was delicious. Felt bad for the bartender when a "local" diva came in with outside food and drink. He asked her politely to dispose of it or leave. At that point she got on her self entitled high horse and pitched a downright hissy fit. He handled the situation with grace, which is more than I would have done. Maybe the princess just doesn't belong in that part of town. I'm sure her parents must be tired of supporting her and her bad attitude. Kudos to the bar keep for doing a fantastic job and keeping his cool.
author: Melanie L.

description:
Hobson's Choice is a mixed bag, depending on when you go and who is tending the bar. I usually go for happy hour and sometimes stay later.

On Monday I went and got the rudest service I've had since...I don't remember when. I came in, sat down at the bar and waited for the bartender (male, maybe in his 20's) to come over. And waited. And waited. I tried waving to get his attention. Nothing. I tried making eye contact with him, everytime he came anywhere near. He would not even look at me. Now, I know people get busy, but they can just say "I'll be with you in a minute" or something similar. None of that. Just completely ignored me.

Just when I was about to leave, a couple sat down in the seats next to me. Well, what do you know--the bartender could see this end of the bar after all! He came over maybe a minute after they sat down, took my order and took theirs. I was annoyed because, if he'd come over before it still would have been happy hour.

Contrast this with the service I've had before. The bartender (female) was friendly, very attentive and quick to refill my drink. The difference was like night and day. I tipped her very well. I left no tip for the jackass who ignored me for nearly 10 minutes.
author: Sue C.

description: I love this bar! anyday anytime. the wheat beer with watermelon on the side is my favorite! they have tv's, restroom's, and your choice of window or bar seating.
author: Love C.

description:
What a great place! This was our last stop during our visit to San Francisco. That saying "save the best for last" is true in this case. 

What a gem! We just happened to walk up upon this place. The sign on the front claiming to be the home of the famous punch bowl sold us despite us being beer drinekrs. We tried the punches. They were good! Wanted to try the bloody mary but switched to beer. They had a bloody mary bar where you could make your own with lots of choices, which I thought was cool! 

This place has something for everyone and the food is good too! Also, great place to chill and people watch!!!! Next time I'm in SF I will for sure head back to this place!
author: Jenifer N.

description: Came here on a weeknight with some of my coworkers. Wasn't too busy, so I'm not sure how this place on weekends... I can only imagine they get pretty packed though based on their punch bowls! We got the regular sized victorian punch bowl.... and it was goooooood. $35 does seem a bit pricey... but you get a good amount of refills from that bowl... I think we got about 16-20 glasses (the glasses they provide) from one bowl. The victorian reminded me of a pina colada or a lava flow... but I like those drinks, so it was excellent for me! Definitely worth giving this place a try!
author: Johnson S.

description: Close to my home and heart. Come here when I want to sit with a Victorian punch with a rum floater and watch the Haight Street folks float by the all glass walls.
author: Matthew T.

description:
After spending the day surrounded by thousands of drunken santas during santacon, my group just wanted a mellow drinking spot after dinner. Ended up on Haight street at Hobson's choice. It was a nice neighborhood bar. A great place to chill and socialize with friends over a huge alcoholic punch bowl. There were 8 of us and each was able to have 3-4 glasses of punch each.

The security/doorman was very friendly and offered to get us extra chairs for our group with out asking which I thought was nice.
author: Jocelyn B.

description: Yummy rum punch bowl, too bad the place smelled of rotten milk and was dirty. I got a groupon for a large bowl of punch for $15..cant say it would be worth it at full price. 2 people drank the whole bowl and we were barely feeling the booze.  The location was amazing, we had the whole top half of the bar to ourselves! Will we go back? Probably not with all the other cool choices in SF. But it was certainly a fun visit.
author: Prescila B.

description: This is fun spot for a drink on Haight Street. There were three choices of fresh punch, and they also had a special on Mai Tai's (Mai Tai Monday). I really liked the vibe, and loved that there was a patron allowed to have their dog inside.
author: Heather G.

description: Rudest bartender ever. So many nice places to have a drink with nice people elsewhere.
author: Melissa D.

description:
We went with a Living Social for a large punch bowl.  Super awesome vibe! 
Word to the wise: Large punch bowls are VERY LARGE.  There were three of us drinking the bowl and I am fairly certain I was more than a little shnockered at the end. :)
author: Allie B.

description:
Yeah...probably not ever again. One of the  bar tenders was physically and verbally abusing an employee in front of everyone and it was more than awkward to say the least. We go to bars to hang out with friends and have a good time. Not deal with the establishment's personal drama. Thanks, but no thanks. 

One star for lots of seating and places to hang out. And one just to be nice.
author: Sabreen S.

description:
We went in for mid-afternoon beer and stood by the bar. And waited. And waited. 

It was busy, that's fine. My companion politely got the bartender's attention. He smiled and said he'd be right with us.

But then we watched him serve customers who came in after us. He served a guy who just walked up to the bar and got his attention. At this point, the people standing next to us started to notice. We returned their puzzled looks.  

Then we hit the 10 minute mark. That's too long to wait for beer on a saturday afternoon. It looks like a nice establishment. Lots of seating. Seems like it would be a nice place for a beer, if you can get one.
author: Rob R.

description: Friendly helpful staff, decent prices.
author: Kylissa M.

description:
A chill saloon style bar in the Haight. They are pretty slow until 11pm at night when the crowd starts pouring in. They have a bunch of sofas, stools and even some space upstairs. I feel like I'm in the south when I go here, and there's a southern hospitality minus when you get that semi mean bartender girl who walks away when you take more than 15 seconds to decide what you want.

If you want a chill night hanging out, playing drinking games and talking to your friends it's a good place to be.
author: Christine B.

description: I love this place. First time I went stuck to the beer on tap. The second time we met a large group there and two friends and I ordered 3 $30/$35 punch bowls one after the other for a great night. No hangover. No BS staff, helpful, and the rum is really flavorful. the House punch was my favorite. Definitely more fun than Martin Mack's, great corner spot, great tunes, and a must if visiting upper haight.
author: Marty J.

description:
This Haight Street Dive called Hobson's Choice has allowed me to walk in and stumble out several times.
There's a pool table, a jukebox and sometimes a lively lot of drinking people. The interior is nothing to get too curious about. This is kind of one of the most average bars I've experinced.

Bonus is Golden Gate Park is just next door so if you feel the need to run free in a meadow you are in luck!
author: Alexander R.

description:
Sunday Bloody Mary bar! Meow. Or, woof, is probably more appropriate. Hearts of palm, pickles galore, artichoke hearts, and more horseradish than you can shake a celery stick at.

I needed to use their facilities and decided to stay and play a while. A great spot to people watch from upstairs or down and right near Golden Gate park. This place packs a punch - quite literally. I spotted several mega-sized bowls of boozy punch served up in lovely pilsner glasses.
author: Lori A.

description:
This is a great stop for a group looking for a break while wandering Haight.  I am not a fan of rum, but I found the house punch to still be tasty.  Overall it's a fun setup for a group.  The place is pleasantly casual.  

I was somewhat surprised that they trusted patrons to carry their punch bowls to their own table.
author: Ben M.

description:
Awesome place and cozy, spacious atmosphere. Friendly people and bartenders were decent.

 I saw a ton of people getting the punch. I'll have to come back on a weekend night where I can really dedicate the time and effort this looks like it requires and update my review!
author: Lauren C.

description:
3.5 stars...

Hobson's Choice is in the center of the main stretch of Haight St. It's a spacious bar/grill that also has a cool little second floor balcony that has a little bit of a lounge feel to it. Where I think they stand out a little bit from the rest of the run of the mill bars is that they have 3 delicious punches available for a believe $6.50ea. What they gained with the tasty punch they certainly lost with the bartender with the piss poor attitude who was there when I was on Saturday afternoon. I certainly wouldn't go out of my way to go back to Hobson's but if you're in the Haight area and want a cold one it's a decent bar.
author: Matt E.

description:
Rum punch plus the stink of piss equals no please.

The bar focuses on rum and overly sweet rum punches which seems fun in New Orleans sort of way, but when you can't get over the smell of urine, it kills the experience.

Hobson's was fairly full for a Sunday night. Also fairly full was an old guy's pants who was sitting on a bar stool and exposing his plumbers crack. Yikes!
author: Brian U.

description: It's the bomb!!!!! Can't wait to go there during football season, to talk smack with the gang
author: Kevin R.

description: Strange fru-fru drinks with canned whipped cream, loud crazy 94.9 style radio rap music followed by some other mismatch junk. Young crowd, guessing around 21-25. I like Belgian/amber ales the bartender was clueless, thankfully I found something up on the shelf, that was indeed Belgian (she had no clue).
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
Surprisingly comfortable on a Friday evening - after being carded at the door by a rather friendly guy ( who later reminded us to make sure we had our credit card as we left ), we even found seats at the bar.

This is a place for two things: a *huge* list of rum, and their surprisingly sweet and fruity rum punches, available by the glass or by the bowl.  Now - the rum punches are not really my thing, but we had to try them, and they were quite good for what they are.  My companion liked the Victorian Punch a little better than my perhaps too sweet House Punch.

Hopped up on sugar and despairing of the beer list ( they have an okay set of taps - Anchor, SN, and even Humboldt, but it's not a niche microbrew place ) we thought to ask for their drinks menu ... and found Rum flights.  Not just *one* rum flight, but a rather large selection of flights, attractively priced.  My companion opted for a nice and amazingly quickly poured Dark and Stormy.  I asked for the Martinique rum flight.

The bartender, who had previously been nice but abrupt, suddenly because solicitous and effusive in her explanation of the various rums in the flight.  Helpful and informative lists were produced.  Three very different rums from French colonies were produced and consumed, bottles set in front of us.  And a somewhat sketchy-looking Haight street bar suddenly transformed itself ... for just a moment ... into a rum aficionado's tasting room.

So yeah - past your slightly over 21 groups getting drunk on rum punch, past your guys drinking light lager and watching the game, what you have here is a surprisingly good bar with folks who are actually interested in and passionate about their craft.
author: Albert H.

description:
Hobson's Choice: Hobson's Choice is located in the Haight/Ashbury District, right on the corner of Haight & Clayton.  Hobson's Choice is a Victorian Rum House, and although there is nothing immediately Victorian about it, it is spectacular.  Allegedly, they have the largest selection of this elixir of the Gods of any bar in the country, and I believe it!  I started counting, but when I reached #110 and was only on the letter 'M', I decided to just accept the truth of the statement and have some rum.  The rums are assorted by country of origin, and change weekly.

In the true tradition of the dive bar, they don't scrimp on the alcohol.  During their Happy Hour, which runs from 5p.m.-7p.m., Monday through Friday, they have $3.00 rum punch drinks, served up in pint sized glasses.  A new addition is that they now serve food and bar treats from the Asquew Grill, also on Haight Street.

Venture upstairs. Here you will find shabby, frayed couches, oversized chairs, chandeliers, dining room tables, and a television.
