The room itself is cozy with lots of windows and walls that have been painted and patched a few too many times. It's a mish-mash of eclectic vibes and aromas from decades past. Hobson's Choice is a must see and must drink in the Haight. For pictures and more information, check out my blog: http://thenoisebeneaththeapple.com/
author: Heather J.

description: Two words: Happy Hour. $3 drinks from the punch bowl are the best! From my profile pic, my obvious choice from the bowls was the Victorian. Bewarned: you can't taste the alcohol in the punches.
author: Kristyn W.

description:
Punches are pretty okay (warning: they're really, really really sweet, not sure if I'm a huge fan of that). 

Decor is nice--the carpet could use some cleaning though. Overall, it's a hip place booming with energy, but I think there are other fun bars in the city.
author: Samuel H.

description:
LOUD!!! TOO LOUD!

This place is loud. But seriously, the drinks are strong. And on the pricier side.
author: Rachel G.

description: This review is for Ben and Laith. Ben showed spectacular service to my roommate and I. Made sure we liked our drinks and had enough ice a little later when laith was on break and it all melted when another bartender wouldn't give us the time of day. Ben was fantastic and definitely deserves some sort of promotion. I was offended to hear he was only a bar back when his service was a hundred times better than the other guy. Laith came back and checked in on is which was definitely appreciated and we relayed our comments to him.
author: Erica L.

description: It's a fun place with a divey-yet-classy atmosphere. I'm a bit of a rum-snob, frequenting Smuggler's Cove and the like, and I can safely admit that the ridonkulous punch bowls are both tasty and great to share.
author: Marcus L.

description:
If I didn't live near the Upper Haight, I would not frequent this place. But I do. It's easy to take pot shots at the bartenders, but Haight & Clayton is one of the most high-conflict intersections in SF, and the bar is known as a place for customers (not bartenders, but CUSTOMERS) to come and ask too many questions and summarily show off their scraps of knowledge of rum and beyond. 

Sometimes the customer is not always right. That's why I head back to Hobson's again and again.
author: Todd G.

description:
My boyfriend came here once with some friends and said that they had these awesome punch bowls so he suggested that we come here for my birthday celebration - the evening event. 

They have an upstairs area so my boyfriend wanted to see if he could reserve it for the event. They said there were two options: 1) pay a flat $100 reservation fee or 2) rack up a $100 bill per hour for at least 2 hours. We were going to go with option 2 since we felt we could hit that no problem with about 20-30 people going. However, here comes the real AWESOME part. When they found out the number of people we had, they said that we would have no problem hitting that minimum so we could just have the room for free! No pressure of any minimums, etc. He said to just let him know when we were there and he could clear out the upstairs area if it was occupied. How sweet! Good customer service really goes a long way. We got there super early...probably the earliest I've ever been out in SF lol...around 9pm and they had all these signs around the upstairs area saying the room was reserved for a private event. Awww!

The punch was really good and hit the spot. Plus, there was plenty of parking so everyone who came was able to park without stress. I will be back. Only thing is they only have 1 bathroom stall so there was always a line for the ladies room (and men's room at that hehe).
author: Jennifer T.

description: bartenders seem to be more focused on doing shots and smoking cigs than pouring drinks. I want to like this place but it takes me 15 minutes to get a drink on a slow night!! awesome rum selection for rum lovers though.
author: Lenny K.

description: This place is nothing special, been here a few times had some beers, mingled, usual bar stuff.  I will never be returning due to my experience with a pony tailed, middle aged, very unattractive bartender. He was one of those "oh this is my bar" types. He indirectly and very rudely cut my buddy off after maybe 4 beers because he said he was mumbling. Maybe he was, but I give the benefit of the doubt to my friend due to his thick Russian accent. Mind you he never said said the words "I'm cutting you off". The night continues, this particular bartender spends his time between the back of the bar and on the other side of the bar dancing with a trio of drunken white girls. During this time my friend orders a beer from the other bartender with no problem. A little while later the jackass comes from behind the bar and gets in my friends face saying I just cut you off why are you still drinking"? "This is my bar, and I cut you off", he says. I tried to tell him the other bartender served him so that is an issue he should be taking up with him. He tells me he isn't going to argue with me and repeats his previous statements. ( all while raising his voice) He forces my friend to chug his beer then snatches it out of his hand. This was the most unprofessional thing I've experienced at a small bar like this when our group was causing absolutely no problem. I will never spend another dollar here, plenty of great spots around the haight. I don't care if you have punch bowls.
author: Ryan S.

description:
The punch is tasty! Its basically just like drinking juice.
sweet. delicious. No alcohol taste whatsoever.

While we were there:
1. one seriously drunk girl left with her boyfriend/guy friend-- who knows?
She could barely walk, at 9:30pm on a wednesday. We heard this huge bang outside and we looked and saw the girl as she was sliding down the glass window after falling back and smacking her head.
Ouch.
Probably shouldnt have served her so much....

2. Crazy man screaming at mannequins in the shop window across the street.

3. crazy drunk lady running around, she stopped by the front of the bar maybe 3 times in 30 minutes.

Weird crowd, mainly the passersby though.
Weird vibe.
author: Ash R.

description: What a great place for after work drinks.  Easy to get to, OK parking, cheap drinks and friendly service.  And very pet friendly.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
To take a break from our shopping up in the Haight, we stopped at Hobson's since we heard there was punch to be had! Three options of juicy rum-laden punch, we each chose one and relaxed at a table near the front.

This stuff could be dangerous for your health! It's like drinking juice and I could easily see chugging them without thinking twice of the consequences.

There's a lot of interesting drink options, cocktails, and over 100 varieties of rum! A bunch of happy hour evenings are available if any type of drink catches your fancy.

I'd love to come up here for an evening of $3.50 punch drinks.
author: Cassandra J.

description: Never have I had better service than tonight from BEN and LAITH these two have constantly been engaging in conversation with me and have provided the best service by far. I will definitely be back when they work. Absolutely awesome.
author: Autume S.

description:
This is the first place I visited in the Haight.  We landed a spot right at the bar after about 2 minutes of walking in.  Awesome!

I ordered my usual drink and then noticed very large bowls of punch on the back bar.  I asked the bartender, Laith, about them and he pointed out the signs above the bar with the descriptions of each.  A few moments later, he brought me a sample of each kind of punch.  They were all yummy and you can get not only a glass, but a whole punch bowl for your party.

Laith was a really nice and attentive bartender and the drinks were great.  I highly recommend stopping in for some fun!
author: Nicole M.

description: Got given a lot of attitude today. I had been drinking beers at happy hour prices when the new bartender came. He gave me attitude and said that there is no happy hour on saturday. So if the lousy prices and warm beer weren't enough,  this happens. The bartender on Mondays and Wednesdays is great, but other than that, I probably won't frequent this bar...
author: Daniel M.

description:
Dear Hobson's,

We are officially done.

I wish I could take back all the money I've spent on you. 

I've always disliked the attitude of your bar staff (bouncer / ID checker guy included) but your cheap drinks and large booth like couch areas kept me coming back.

After my last experience with you though, I can safely say I will not be returning to you! One Friday night, I brought to you a group of close to 20 of my friends for to celebrate a 30th birthday.

Instead of showing us a good time, we were talked to condescendingly, and then ignored and cussed at by your bartender.  It seemed as though, ordering copious drinks (and tipping well on them) were not enough for you.

Apparently making up for most of your clientele for the night wasn't impressive enough for you either, so you felt the need to purposely dismiss anyone in our group and make us feel unwelcome.  If that wasn't enough, you continued to harass us in the street after we left you.

If it hadn't been for my poor decision making skills that night, and for the lack of large spaced bars in close proximity, I would have turned away from you in a heart beat.

Lesson learned. 


PS your punch bowls really suck.
author: Roxane W.

description:
Came here with a group of fantastic people and my "sista-friends" to enjoy ourselves after a long crazy week of nursing school. It was mofo-packed and getting to the second floor was a pain because the stairs were almost impossible to reach with people sitting around. The punch bowls were so fun to look at and drink from. The cherries were a plus! I was probably like the only one who failed to tie a knot with a stem. Meh. Whatever.

I give this place a high rating because..

My friends and I had an awesome time
I'm not sure how much everything came out to be...
We got good seating for all 9 of us
Drinks were good
and I'm sorry for the liquidy pool of "pad see ewwww" you found on the floor by the bathroom LOL. That was me.. haha.

I would definitely come again- The punch bowls were so good I lost count and didn't even feel it til hours later.
Good place to bring a group of friends! Recommend it.
author: Lisa L.

description: delicious punch! i wish we had finished our bowl but at 3 -4 cups each we made good headway and definitely got our moneys worth (the house punch at $30) not the fanciest of places but a nice neighborhood place to get your pregame on. i did feel like an idiot for sitting at the table instead of going straight to the bar with my order so for future reference order at the bar then sit and enjoy. Im not sure why i thought there was wait service!?
author: Moussia K.

description: Love this place. They have house punch a sort of jungle juice. I get wasted almost every time I come here I don't know if I should be admitting they but hey this is a bar review and if I was sayin I leave sober than ever then there'd be issues. The bartenders dare really chill and serve up some really good drinks. Happy hour is awesome in this place I love the feel. Definitely a recommendation of you plan on doing some drinking in Haight.
author: Krishna V.

description:
Our group stopped by after a really good  4 mile run.  While most of the people chose beer, I tried the highly recommended punch. A single serving is gigantic for $6 and super sweet. 

Overall, a fun drink and better when you order a bowl to share since the single serving glass was too frosty to hold in your hand. Chill neighborhood bar to chat, watch basketball, and enjoy the music.
author: Sophie C.

description: My night last night went something like this: After getting dressed up as a panda and heading to my friends place for a facebook photo session, my friends and I rolled here for an animal themed bar crawl that really only started and ended here. It was good. They make a good washington apple. No cell phone service.
author: Emily D.

description:
This is a great spot for daytime drinking! The barstaff is super laid back and down to earth, and tends to customers fantastically. I always appreciate when customers are served in the order they arrive at the bar, and having someone remember what you're drinking is always a plus.

I'm not usually much of a rum puncher, but there's usually specials on a variety of punches here, and they're a knockout. I just learned about the Bloody Mary bar on Sundays and anticipate checking this out soon!
author: Ting S.

description:
Whatever positives I can say about this bar (which there are a few of, but you can read the other reviews for that) were canceled out by the completely unacceptable behavior of the staff here, on several levels.

A large group of us (15 or so) rolled in here for a friend's 30th birthday. Lots of shots were ordered. Lots of drinks were ordered. We were given attitude every step of the way. Some of the girls were hit on by one of the male bartenders. Inappropriate. But what really irked me was how they dealt with kicking us all out at closing time -- which, by the way, happened at 1:41am... lame. It's not like "Okay, please leave". It's like "Get the fuck out". Literally. That's what they said to us.

So, again, it's a large group of us, so after we exit the bar, we're still outside trying to catch cabs, say goodbyes, whatever. I'm not really sure if the sidewalk is their property, if we were loitering, or whatever technicalities there are, but in my book what we were doing was completely normal. Well, one of the staff comes out, and is like "Hey! It's 2am so shut the fuck up." 

No one should be treated that way, but especially not your paying customers. I was just shocked. I can't come back here simply out of principle.
author: Richa A.

description:
I've been here once before and had a pretty good time, but after yesterday (Sunday, 7/10 approx 6 pm), I will avoid this place. We were deciding which punch bowl to get so I ask the dark haired girl bartender at the bar what the difference was between the two, (which I had seen on the bar menu with no descriptions) and all she says is "orange and cran" so I ask which is which? and she goes "the house is orange, orange is orange and the victorian is cran" in a "so obvious tone." 

SO SORRY I don't live at this bar like you obviously do deadbeat! you are obviously are soo much cooler than be since you work at a bar! if I had paid, I wouldn't have tipped because even if one thinks someone is asking a stupid question, you don't give them attitude. The "punch" was exactly that, tasted like cool-aid with no alcohol in it. glad I didn't pay!

now, reading over the reviews, I see that I'm not the only one who has received this kind of behavior from the bartenders.
author: Melody T.

description: I've always loved coming to Hobson's to relax and watch all the interesting characters of SF. This is the perfect place to grab an afternoon drink. Their house punch taste SO good, just like pineapple juice, but I'm not sure how much alcohol they put. I've been able to have a couple cups of punch and still felt fine.
author: Cindy A.

description:
When in Upper Haight, there is no better bang for buck. In fact, this ranks as one of the best places to drink in the west side of San Francisco. $5 for the excellent house punch is a solid deal, and bartenders are quick and professional. I've never had a bad experience at Hobsons and the crowd has always been cool (not overly hipster/douchey, nice people, etc.). I've gone here with friends, on dates, and hell, even did a big craigslist sale! It works well for anything and they play good music.

I also think this is one of the better spots around to drink on weeknights. Obviously it's good on weekends, but it doesn't drop off as much during the week as other bars in SF. Overall, you can't go wrong with this place.

*The bathroom is above reproach, so bonus points for that.
author: Calvin A.

description: I love this place. If you're a rummy like me, they have a great selection from all over the world. Good tunes, food available next door and a great space in the Haight!
author: Steve G.

description: I think some of the staff at this joint are racist.  There was no one ordering anything at the bar and the bartender openly ignored my friend and me, he did not acknowledge us.  He was not even doing anything, twisting and untwisting bottle caps to pass the time and not serve us.  If you are not Caucasian, don't even think about coming here, unless you want to be reminded of that.
author: Moni K.

description: bartenders are "too cool", ignores you as they chat it up with the women clientele.  don't blame them for trying.  yawn.  i used to live in this neighborhood and avoided it then.  some things never change.
author: Bombo V.

description: This place is awesome. A great happy hour and Chris G. Is the best, super nice and friendly, spent a great afternoon here with friends and will be back.
author: Andrea A.

description: Gotta love the Hobson's Choice, the bouncer was nice answering all our dumb questions like what's the difference between this punch and that punch...umm oops the description was right in our face on a huge sign above the bar. My favorite was the Victorian punch, slight hint of coconut I'm guessing they use malibu rum in it. Then they had a random raffle, fun times! I didn't win but someone won a $50 giftcard to Foreign Cinema.
author: Karen T.

description:
Hobson's Choice vs. Martin Macks

Drinks:
Martin Macks has about 50 different kinds of lagers.  Thing is, one lager is much like another.  Hobson's has a better selection of ales, and makes a better bloody mary.
Winner - Hobson's Choice

Food:
Martin Mack's has a pizza oven, but for the most part the food there is frozen and deep fried - the kind of stuff that Gordon Ramsey screams at people for.  Hobson's has kabab, really good wings, ribs, and other tasty treats.(although to be fair, they bring it in from Askew Grill next door).
Winner - Hobson's Choice by a wide margin 

Seating:
Martin Macks has hard chairs and hard stools. Hobson's Choice has hard charis and nice soft upholstered banquettes.
Winner - Hobson's Choice.

TV:
Both advertise the NFL Sunday Ticket - meaning that they show every NFL game, ostensibly.  Martin Macks has more TVs, and bigger TVs, it is true.  That doesn't do you any good, however, if the bartender won't put your game on any of them.
Winner - Hobson's Choice

Hobson's Choice would stand on its own as a fine place to hang on a Sunday even without the comparison.  But in light of the comparison, it's even more compelling.
author: Joe C.

description:
I've always been a fan of this bar.  Pretty decent tap with about 10 beers or so, and great happy hour.  But beyond that it's a good sized bar, friendly people, and usually plenty friendly pups as well.  I've recently had one bartender say dogs aren't allowed anymore, but on another night there were 2 groups with a dog in there so... hmmm.  I am guessing it's the health dept since you can order in food from Askew Grill, but depends on if the bartender is enforcing or not.  
Aside from that, the only reason I'm not giving this place 5 stars is the street urchin collective sometimes gathers out front and makes me not want to go in, and the one or two times the bartender put on gangster rap the second happy hour ended...
author: Ben S.

description:
Came here on a Friday night. It was 11PM and basically empty. Their punch tasted great.. and after around 5 gulps and $6 it was gone. There was NO ALCOHOL in their punch! 

The only cool thing about this place is that it's on Haight. 

Note: Make sure they mix the punch before serving you. I swear either that drink had no alcohol in it or the alcohol wasn't blended in :(
author: Kathy S.

description:
Definitely my favorite neighborhood bar. The punch bowls are delicious and they're a great bargain. Grab one of those (or a couple if you know what's good fer ya), take a seat upstairs with some friends and you are set for a great night.

And a tip to those who may need it: Don't try to pull any fast ones with your ID. Even if it's simply expired, you're getting the boot. These guys run a tight ship.
author: Katie S.

description:
After Alembic, my friends decided to go to a different bar.  I'm definitely down to try a new bar since I'm new to the area!!  This place had the Vodka of my choice along with the mixers that Alembic did not have.  I was tempted to try the punches but I stuck with my Grey Goose Vodka and Cranberry since I was deprived of it at the previous bar.   

The bar was not as packed and we were able to sit upstairs.  The service was good and the prices of the drinks were reasonable.   

I guess this place is known for their rum since several individuals were ordering the different types of rum punches!  I guess I'll be coming back to try the PUNCHES!  =)
author: Lulu W.

description:
"Morton's Fork," a scenario where you must choose between two undesirable options, would be a more accurate name for this bar than "Hobson's Choice" (a scenario where you choose what is offered or nothing). 

I wouldn't choose to come here on my own, but have ended up here several times for birthday parties. Hence the Morton's Fork: either bail on a friend's birthday, or end of shelling out $40+ for some punch bowl I could make for cheaper at home--but of course, you come here for the atmosphere, camaraderie, and the yummy punch, not necessarily the great deals (although there are sometimes great deals to be had here from Groupon).

The drinks are sweet and yummy, but a bit overpriced for the quality and the venue. There are some nice places to sit upstairs if you're with a group, but the night I was there we got conflicting messages from two bartenders of whether or not the area was "closed," even though the bar wasn't that busy and there were 10+ people in our party.

I like that you can order food from next door (Sqewers?) to be delivered here. The food is decent, but sort of pricey for what you get, and they add on a 10% "delivery" charge, which they didn't tell me about before I ordered, it just showed up on the bill.

Oh, and I know that the Haight's reputation is getting shit on with the whole sit/lie law fiasco, but I've never seen more aggressive panhandlers than outside Hobson's Choice, to the point of being threatening. Not entirely pleasant.
author: Umilia M.

description:
We ordered two bowls of punch and then another bowl of punch about 15-20 minutes before last call. It was hubris, and the bartender only reinforced that by making this last bowl pretty much equal parts bacardi 151 and V8 Splash. I think I had 4 cups.

I have been sufficiently destroyed by drinking in SF now. I will not question the constitutions or livers of your fair city again. Thank you for a good night with strangers.
author: Michael F.

description: Chill place to come w/ a group of friends and share one of their punch bowls for $35.  We went w/ the Go Go Punch which was a ginger lemonade w/ rum and I'm not ashamed to say that it was good.  All guys like some girly drinks at some point but have too much man-pride to admit it.
author: Derrick C.

description:
I went to this place maybe 10 times before I made up my mind how I felt about it.  Ultimately, I decided that I'd NEVER go back.

PROS
1.  Cheap punch at happy hour
2.  Get there early enough and you can find prime seating upstairs
3.  Your out of town guests will love this place
4.  Food is pretty good for bar food
Uhh.......

CONS
1.  THE SMELL.  The odor goes above and beyond the normal stale beer stink of most bars.  A hellish combination of mildew, hot vomit, and potpourri.
2.  Way too loud.
3.  $20 minimum on cards and $2 ATM surcharge.
4.  Sure, the punch is cheap at happy hour but I'm pretty sure there's no rum in it.  I was never even able to obtain a substantial buzz from it.  It's sickeningly sweet too, so I might as well just make some Kool-Aid.
5.  If it's not happy hour, the drinks are pretty pricey.
6.  Filthy, filthy bathrooms.
7.  NASTY attitude from the staff. 

WHY I'LL NEVER RETURN
On my last visit, I opened a tab and put all of my drinks and food on it.  Nothing unusual there.  When I closed my tab, my card was charged and before I signed the draft, I looked over my receipts.  My food order was charged tax, and the total amount (incl tax) was added to my alcohol bill, which was then taxed again - including the alcohol.  So I pointed this out to the bartender, who said he'd take care of it.  He said he had to get his manager to fix it, since my card had already been charged, and here is where things got ugly.

The bartender went to find the manager, told me it would be a minute, and went to help someone else.  While I'm waiting, I hear a man yelling.  There's a huge black dude sitting at the end of the bar, yelling at the cracked out lookin' lady next to him.  I assumed he was yelling AT the lady, because he's yelling things like, "CHEAP BITCH!......DAMN!......OVER THREE DOLLARS!!!!" and then he'd laugh in disbelief a couple times and say "DAMN" a few times and then things like "THAT'S A CHEAP ASS BITCH!.....DON'T WANNA PAY THREE DOLLARS."  

....crackhead lady ordered a three dollar drink and didn't have any money, right?

WRONG!  I was MORTIFIED when this man got up and I saw he was wearing a Hobson's t-shirt.  Turns out he was the "manager."  He walked over to me, THREW five dollar bills on the bar, laughed in my face and said "You wanna argue about three dollars? Well here's five!" and walked away.  He was still laughing when he sat down next to his crackhead friend about the "CHEAP BITCH......DOESN'T WANNA PAY THREE DOLLARS."

So, Hobson's Choice, you overcharged my credit card and rather than fix YOUR mistake, your "manager" calls me a cheap ass bitch to the other customers at the bar!  That's GREAT!
author: Elmer C.

description:
I enjoy coming here every once in a while, and I usually drink the punch. The house punch is great, and there is another one (the raspberry ginger?) that is also delicious. I would recommend trying to get the two combined if possible.  We tried to last night, but apparently the bartender doesn't "mix drinks." (I found it hilarious that the person who ordered after us got a rum and coke - I guess he's selective with the things he mixes.)

Definitely give it a shot, hope you get a good bartender (the guy that looks like Jason Segel is pretty awesome) and check out the upstairs area! Definitely going to try it again, and hopefully get the mixed punches! (seriously, it's AWESOME.)
author: T M.

description:
One of my favorite causal bars in the haight.  Actually, there is nothing super fancy in the haight.  Everything here is pretty relax and causal.  It's nice for me to break out of the financial/soma/marina yuppy scene once in a while and just grab a beer with a few of my co workers for a causal night. 

This bar is located in the middle of haight and has a great bar set up.  They serve this huge bowl of jungle juice.  Back in my college days (ages ago), jungle juice was made out of fruit punch and everclear. One red cup of jungle juice and you're knocked out for the night.  This sneaky juice you to creep up on even the heaviest drinkers I know.

Now the version Hobson's choice is pretty similar but no everclear (thank goodness!).  Still has that effect where you can't taste the alcohol and you feel its ok to keep drinking this "fruit punch."  After a few cups, its hits you all at once! A great drink for a group.  I promise if you have a group, one bowl is not enough :)
author: Ying F.

description:
PUNCH BOWL! PUNCH BOWL!

Oh man, you sure know what a girl needs. Came here with 4 friends and super cute (Irish-ish) bartender tells us we should just get a bowl instead for 5 more dollars. You are talking to a Chinese girl here, and what I hear is a bargain! Sold baby! Gimme my punch! 

Delicious and fun times ensued. 

Morning after hurt my brain. But that's what I get for not having self control. 

Oh the choice of Hobson. You do me so good.
author: Melissa T.

description:
Yay for happy hour punch! ($2.5-$3.5)

Orange mango flavor is the best!
I also tried lemonade flavor, it was pretty good too.
Their drinks are fairly strong and pretty cheap even after happy hour:)
Adios was $8 n grayhound was $5
This place gets crowded during happy hour!!
Nice ambience.
Would go back there again when I visit SF!
author: Kate S.

description:
I love this bar.  It has a great atmosphere.

When you sit by a window there is excellent people watching along Haight.

The drinks are legit.
author: Simon S.

description:
fun little cave- i don't know whether i'm rating the bar or how much fun i had with my girl but i do know the bartenders were attentive and funny and let us squeeze in on happy hour even tho were were a minute or 2 late :)

GET THE RED PUNCH! and whatever u take for heartburn lol (i actually used a yellow mustard packet which the bar tender so helpfully found for me--  yea that actually works)

i'll be back on my next haight street crawl!!
author: Jenna D.

description:
Stopped in on Sunday November 13th, 2011 around 2:00 PM while walking down the street - and noticed there make your own bloody mary bar.

After walking in we were immediately greeted by an energetic bartender - african american, in his 30's - who quickly took my order and pointed me in the right direction. Might have been one of the nicest bartenders I have met in SF so far.

The bloody mary was $5.50 which is a great deal - and i liked how i could create it the way i enjoyed. In the future, I realize I am best leaving it to the professionals. Will be back.
author: Brian D.

description:
5 stars for Laith (bartender), 4 stars for cheap, sugary booze (house punch), and 4 stars for location. The 43 or 33 will take you right there, which is great when you're already drunk on your way into Hobson's.

It's a good mix of people - 20s, 30s, lots of older plaid-wearing dudes and younger plaid-wearing girls. Generally, my kind of scene. It's laid-back, especially for Haight, and it's rare to encounter anyone too awful.

I mean, everyone leaves Hobson's completely trashed anyway. I've seen the lights come on at 1:45 in the morning more times than I care to count. And that gives you 15 minutes to get pizza down the block. It's a win-win.
author: Jiordan C.

description:
This was the second bar i vistied as a 21 year old, and WOW! what fun. I went in the middle of the day and it was so chill. I stuck to the punches and that's enough reason to go back! Make sure you try every single one! Get a "floater" (an extra shot of rum on top!). Gets you fucked up and you can't even tell. I could probably down 4 in an hour they're so tasty!

The bartender was really sweet, she hooked it up since it was my 21st birthday. 

Overall vibe of the bar was plenty enjoyable!

Cant wait to go back!!!
author: Adrianna H.

description: Crazy rum bar in upper Haight. The punches are really good but don't spend to much time on them. The secret here is they have like twenty different rums. Get a few flight of rum. so worth it.
author: Matt H.

description:
I adore Hobson's Choice.

Grab a couch or table in the front, buy their yellow punch (or if you're feeling adventurous try their combo punch) and just relax.

Their off the hook juke box,cheap prices, and random diverse crowd have never failed me - for mellow nights of girly gossip.
author: Jessica T.

description:
My friend and I stopped in here today (Monday) on a midday bike ride. The place was pretty empty, which was great because it allowed us to sit at the table in the corner window. This has got to be one of the best places in the city to people watch! Comfy seating, big floor to ceiling windows and right on the corner of Haight and Clayton.

I hadn't been here before and the bar tender was nice enough to let us sample all three of the punches which are in big glass bowls behind the bar. We both got the Victorian punch which was super yummy and served in a tall hurricane glass for only $5.50 each. 

I thought about giving my experience 5 stars for tasty drinks and great people watching venue, but they have a $20 minimum on debit or credit cards. Really? Come on! I am so tired of every bar in this city either being cash only or having steep limitations on credit card use. Join the 21st century people!
author: Casey S.

description: So I don't typically make out to the Haight area. To be perfectly honest, not the biggest fan. But it was my friends going away party so had to go. Got to say, as bars in that neighborhood, not bad. Drinks were made well. Good amount of space. Not overly crowded. Drinks were very cheap, which is always surprising in the city. And the bartender, Roshelle, was in point the entire night. Not sure how often I will make it there. Mainly because my group doesn't really go to that area, but it's a nice bar.
author: Robert F.

description: This was our fourth stop after our jog around the city so we were already pretty blitzed. Let's see if I remember...We sampled two of their spiked punches, rasbery lemonade and ginger i think and mango orange pineapple. So good and the bartender was cool!
author: April Rose D.

description:
"EXCUSSSSSSEEEEE ME!!!" 

"EXCUSSSSEEEEE ME!!"

This is basically the one thing that I will remember from this bar, which being called Hobson's Choice, I would not choose to come back here probably. I went here to meet some friends with Frances S. and we were only there with maybe 6 people total. We were standing, talking, trying to order from the bar, when over the loud obnoxious music that eventually ended up given my friend a throbbing headache, we heard an even more obnoxious sound----the sound of a screamingly painful waitress who claimed we were blocking her walkway. 

Ummmmm...I'm sorry, isn't it your JOB to push your way through bar patrons??? Why would you work at an overly crowded bar in the first place, if you weren't going to be willing to push through people every now and then????? AND you really lose tips by yelling at people like that, just a little FYI. People tell me it is hard to be a waitress, but I think it may be harder to act like you hate your job and everyone around you your entire shift!!! BLAH

Her aside, the decor was like every other bar I have been in. Thanks to the owner for clarifying, there is a small cornell university flag that seems to be sitting on its own, but I was told that it was actually in honor of a man who passed away recently and this bar was really more his bar, so it adds a nice personal touch you don't often see in bars like this. It isn't every day that you see a bar with that type of personal tribute.

They do have these summer punch specials which are premade punches in three flavors that you get in fun hurricane glasses which always makes you feel fancy, and it especially does in a place like this.

Basically you need to be drunk to be here....And if you are really drunk, and I mean you can barely walk drunk, they don't care. This girl was practically being carried into this bar while we were leaving, and the bouncer didn't even blink an eye!

Hobson's Choice....make another one before you go here
author: Sarah G.

description:
Awesome rum drinks - especially the Zombie (it definitely eats your brains). This is a good bar for groups - I've taken advantage of their bloomspot punchbowl specials a few times and they've always been good times. This bar is walking distance from my house, so of course I love it. :)
Minus one star for the awful bathroom lines. And for occasionally being too crowded. Still a fan though!
author: Sofia T.

description:
I like punch. They have nice punch here and the people are nice. If you're not into punch, they have other things as well- including a respectable amount of things on tap. 

The other night, the featured drink was a mojito and I got the heebie-jeebies just thinking of the time I went through a week-long phase of making my own mojitos. I swore it would be a long time before I drank another mojito but here I was ordering one. It was good. I would certainly recommend ordering one from here over drinking one made by me.
author: Loli L.

description: The bar itself is cool and had a great selection of rums... However, this review is about the "Barbados Punch". Emphasis in on the quotations because this is FAR from the Barbados Punch that I know. At least use a Bajan rum. Mount Gay is sitting there all lonely and you "can't sub" the non-Bajan Bacardi. And where is the nutmeg? Good drink. Just stop kidding yourself and call it something different.
author: Shane L.

description:
Great place to go when you want to chill and just catch up with friends. It's a nice little neighborhood bar that gives generous portions with their drinks. Always a good thing!

I loved the chill atmosphere that this neighborhood bar gives and I think that their upstairs area is pretty cool. We ordered a punch bowl which was a cool $35. The bartender let us sample all three of the punches before we decided which one to get in the bowl - we opted for the ginger lemonade. All the punches are rum based, but didn't taste like it at all - probably kind of dangerous. 

Cool little find - will definitely be back when in need of a change of scenery from our usual hang outs.
author: Julia K.

description:
NEVER GO TO THIS BAR!!!!
I am a local who lives in the neighborhood and have gone here many times and had fun, but tonight was one of the most uncomfortable nights of my life. I was with a group of about 10 people who bought numerous punch bowls, shots and beers...needless to say, we provided good business to this bar tonight!  We were having a great time until out LIVES WERE THREATENED by a group of street people who were also drinking in the bar. They had left a cell phone charging  next to the table we were at and a few people looked to see what the deal was with the phone and the street people came over and threatened our safety on Haight street. We told them that we didn't want any trouble and definitely were not trying to steal their phone, but they continued to verbally threaten our safety. They complained to the bouncers about us and the staff came over and were extremely rude to us and threatened to kick us out! We felt so uncomfortable that we left the bar, of course complaining to the manager and explaining the situation. We made sure that we all walked home together and that no one followed us. I am not a person who often feels threatened by others or uncomfortable in the city, but I legitimately was nervous to walk home because the people were so aggressive towards us and the bar staff was so unsupportive of its patrons who were obviously there to enjoy themselves and not cause any trouble. I will NEVER go to this bar again and think that they should make their patrons feel comfortable and safe in their environment.  Do not support a bar that invites aggressive street people into their bar and lets them harass their patrons! this is not the kind of community that the upper haight should support!
author: Chelsea S.

description:
Eh. The handful of times I've been here, it's been with co-workers and one co-worker in particular who LOVES coming here, especially for the punch.

The bartenders have always been competent with me but there have been a few times when my friends complained about rude treatment and inattententive service.

The thing that gets me is the crowd. Even when I came here years ago, I still felt like an old guy hanging out with the kiddies. Maybe that's why I always tended to go to the Gold Cane instead.

It's a place to check out if you're hopping around the Haight but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here.
author: Art O.

description: I thought hobson's choice was badass. I forgot that rum used to be my liquor of choice and hobson's, as a rum bar, reminded me why I used to like it so much more. Get their bermuda triangle. It really is special, the nutmeg and whatnot seem like a weird choice but it works really well.
author: Misha T.

description:
A GREAT 'Dive' Bar in the Haight with lots of room, crappy restrooms, great drinks, wonderful music, friendly strangers, and a name that makes you think.  

Hobson's Choice is basically: you can choose whatever you want out of these ONE (1) options.   I think it is aptly named because it's like "you can have our bar the way it is or you can piss off"... but you will like the bar.   Except the bathrooms... but it was as should be expected so that didn't even turn me off.  Luckily, I am a man, and do not need to sit.... I digress.  

I see someone else posted about getting the punch.  I don't know how much it cost, as my brother paid for it, but it is worth it.  You get a HUUUUUUGE bowl (we got orange) and you share it with four people.  We had enough that we had three guests (two invited, one self invited wasted girl from AZ that I think was trying to pick up both my brother AND his girlfriend) imbibe from our bowl and still had left overs.  And there were a million cherries to try and do the stem thing with...

As an aside, my original comment had a negative comment here.  I received a very nice note from the owner of the establishment after offering an apology.  It is neat to know that in a huge city like San Francisco, there is a bar where the people care about the clientelle, and not just the business.
author: Tim M.

description: Enjoyable Saturday afternoon spent at Hobson's Choice.  The nachos from next door were delicious.  We tried the three different punches and they were very tasty.  There was a nacho stealing incident, but that wasn't the bartender's fault...greedy patrons were the culprits.
author: Marian P.

description: A great, underrated dive bar on the Haight. Drinks are strong, and the bartenders are always great. Recommend for a group of friends trying to have a low-key night out.
author: Amanda F.

description:
I loveeee this bar.  What a wonderful place.  I came here for the first time with a groupon, and enjoyed it so much I was back last weekend.  The punches themselves are pretty good, and it's just a cool place.

The manager (I assume?) was at the bar both times, and gave us free "Liquid Gummy Bear" shots the first time we were there.  Very tasty!  The second time I came, I had a group of 4, so we got one of the bowls of punch.  Make sure to order a bowl if your group is large enough!  It was $35 for a bowl, which was actually a really good deal.  The glasses it comes with were small, but each of us filled our glass like... 5 or 6 times?

We sat upstairs where it's relatively quiet, and found out that they have CARDS on hand at the bar, so we had an evening of playing Bullshit and improvised Scattergories.  How many bars can you do that at, huh?!

Win.
author: David W.

description: It did the job.  I drank the punch and I got waaaaassttteeeeeddd!  I split a small bowl with a friend and by the end, I was so over punch.  I don't really have much desire to drink more punch because it was so good yet sugary.  There are stupid anti-social morons who go here to show off how cool they are.    I offered a chair to this guy who threw it to the ground because he thought he was so cool because he's probably not coding like he usually does.  The bouncer is nice.  I'm hungover---THREE STARS!!!
author: Sam K.

description:
This is such a tough place to review.  They claim to have the best rum selection in the country.  I do not believe that is true, but it is pretty decent.  The bartenders and staff are pretty friendly, and you can assemble a tasting flight to your specifications pretty easily.  As a big rum afficionado, I really love this aspect of the place.

And then, as i am sitting drinking rum with my fellow pirates, They start blasting hip hop way too lound.  Now, I love hip hop.  I even like loud hip hop.  But why would i want to do a rum tasting flight with my friends if I can't hear them speaking?

Totally ridiculous Hobson's Choice.  If you want to do rum tastings, lose the overloud music.  You totally lost yourselves a star here,
author: Steve S.

description:
I love coming in on a chilly night and getting wasted so badly I have to call in sick the next day.

It's loud and can get really crowded some nights but the drinks are awesome. Try the punch, it's like you're not even drinking alcohol.

My other favorite drink it get is the Cuban Special. 

They have a bunch of different drinks available and I've never had a drink there I didn't like.

But then that could be my alcoholism showing through....
author: Vicky C.

description: I just really like the aura of this place (and I really like rum). It's a relaxing, unpretentious spot that has a wide range of clientele. Plus the bartenders are super chill and they've got tons of great rum options and concoctions.
author: Rowena L.

description:
Came here for the Happy Hour yesterday.  First of all those punches are just sickly sweet and you can barely taste the alcohol. They tasted like Kool-Aid with an extra cup of sugar dumped into it.  Definitely not my thing...

Service was slow & surly so after one drink (which I didn't even finish), we bounced.
author: Preethi C.

description: This review doesn't need lots of words it's simple. The drinks are good and the people are rad and chill. There lots of good seating and places to stand. all good things, but the smell is terrible the whole place reeks of a high school's gym locker room, mixed with chlorine. Also there r big TV's playing. Sports like 24/7. Wtf on the haight?? Idk pretty avg bar not divey not high end either. Recommend for the affordable taps and the good seating.
author: Harrison M.

description: The punch bowls are awesome. Tried all three of the punch bowls and they were all good. Great place to go with friends and have a good time. Atmosphere was cool too.
author: Anthony K.

description:
Just felt I needed to update after going here many times.  This is the chillest place ever.

The bartenders are fuckin awesome! The drinks are SO GOOD! GET THE MAI TAI.  Not only is it bomb it is friggen potent.  The jukebox is so good you may drain your wallet.  But its worth it.
author: T R S.

description:
Here's the deal. I'm cute. I'm funny. I have dreams! But, I don't have friends in San Francisco. Well, I have one- but bitch needs a break. The point is I've been here twice for A DRINK,* by myself after thrift shopping in the Haight. The bartender, a ginger- is a complete charmer. That personality would work hard in NYC, too bad. He flirts, but not to the point where your eyeballs roll up. He also pours a strong drink. This is a great place for post-work drinks or a night out. Plus, I hear they have a Bloody Mary bar on SUNDAY. Hot. 

*We all know it wasn't just ONE.
author: Lianne S.

description:
This bar is still killin' it on the Haight. The punch is still prevalent, and the beer still comes in funky little mugs. Bartender is busy, so take your time and know what you want before he gets to you.

The front area is perfect for people watching. You can grab a table with some friends, or even a spot on the couch, and just sit back, chat and watch the weird street carnival that is Haight Street these days. When I was here last, we saw a man get ejected for being too drunk, then he passed out in front of the bar by the tree and ended up being taken away on a stretcher by the medics. This was all at 2PM.

If you get hungry, there is food available delivered from next door. Skewers, even!
author: Wes T.

description: A hidden gem in the upper Haight.  I was pleasantly surprised by the overall experience, the crowd, and the service.  Parking is easy - wow!
author: Vadim N.

description: Great bar in Haight- Ashbury, it's Victorian Punch bar, with super cool inside. Great people watching, and awesome happy hour specials that you can't beat ! Definitely try the Victorian punch , reminds me of "pirate punch" at Capt Tonys in Key West ! During happy hour the punches are 3 dollars as well as the draft beers, and that have a great selection of local northern Cali brews! If you like me when you come SF, and your staying the Nob Hill, Union Square area do yourself a favor and check this place out, and walk around the Haight it's so much fun !
author: Steven C.

description:
I've been here a couple of times. First time I had a great time. This last time...not so great. And I was the one who even recommended we go to this spot with a group of people. This place is cool for the cheap beers on tap ($2.50) but I had an awful experience with one of the bartenders who was just straight up rude, so now I'm not sure if I ever want to return again. 

Just goes to show how one bad employee can really change your perception of a place.
author: L M.

description:
Mystery punch that will leave you and your friends in a sweeter state of mind??? Count me in!!!

This is also a great spot to stop by in the afternoon after all that shopping on Haight.
author: Lisa R.

description: Punch bowls are delicious. Very relaxed atmosphere and great bartenders. Fun jukebox that's easy to get going and generally a sweet place!
author: Julia W.

description: I enjoyed my punch bowl and the crowd was fun.  But the place is filthy and I think they get away with it cause it goes with the Haight-ness of it.  But the bathroom was not acceptable.  Bartender was really nice.
author: Jean C.

description:
Nice little spot on Haight street to hang out and get your drink on! They have a smaller upstairs in addition to the seating on the main floor. Rocking chairs, couches, juke box, and best of all, giant punch bowls!

Punch bowls are good, sweet, and creepers! So pace yourself even though it doesn't even taste like alcohol, it will soon hit you all at once later. These bowls are great for sharing with a large groups! They also have great beers on tap, but I highly recommend trying the punch bowls.
author: Linda C.

description:
Although I have always had good service here, this is the bar I least often go to on all of Haight Street. The reason is, the crowd here is usually rowdy, young, and kinda thuggish. There always seems to be at least one table with 6 dudes, drinking, not talking, and staring everyone else down. Sometimes there are multiple groups like this, staring each other down. I don't know if I just had a few isolated bad experiences, but I always feel like somebody is staring at somebody when I'm in here.

Which is a shame, because I really enjoy the fruity drinks they serve here.
author: Rachel H.

description:
I've been looking for a good local bar, now that I am a resident of the Haight-Ashbury neighborhood. You know, a bar where every one knows my name (and my favorite drink) and where I can easily stumble home from after a Tuesday night binge fest.

Hobson's Choice is a strong candidate for my favorite local bars in the Haight-Ashbury. This place has everything I want in a regular hang out spot, not too dingy or too dive-y, but also not too douche-y and pretentious.  

Hobson's is known for their famous punch bowls. It reminds me of the spiked punched served at my junior prom, oh the memories. The punch bowl is the perfect drink to get if you have a large group of people. It is also good drink to start your night off with. It is also the perfect drink to get if you want to play Macho Mug, arguably the world's best drinking game (Google it my friends).

The punch is very sweet and not too harsh, so even the lightest of drinkers can down ladles and ladles of this stuff. Be careful because this is a creeper drink. The drink is pretty sweet and doesn't taste like alcohol at all, so you think you can drink a lot of it and then BAM you are blacked out on a sidewalk with 20 missed calls. 

If you are more of beer drinker then you are pleased to know that they have a variety of beers on tap, including one of my all time favorites, the Tangerine Wheat made by Lost Coast Brewery. 

Overall, Hobson's Choice is cool low key bar, definitely one of my favorite local hang out spots. I especially love sitting upstairs in their giant throne size chairs, it makes me feel oh so regal!
author: Allan Y.

description:
Came here on a Sunday night. I've always passed by when I was underage and thought "How cool!! You can share a whole bowl with a bunch of your friends."

Now that I'm well of age to drink. I came here ordered the Victorian Punch but saw the gogo ginger!!! ahh it's ok i'll definitely come back to try that one! 

Victorian Punch ($35) wasn't that sweet or strong at the initial sip. I had who knows maybe 3-4 glasses since my friend kept refilling the glass. My bf claimed the drink to be really sweet with all the kinds of rum in it. At first we thought dang $35 that's a lot and then when you break it down the average drink there is about $8-9 so mind as well! We definitely got our $35 dollars worth.

We sat at the corner, bought some pizza from Escape from New York and just chatted it up. ALSO great view of a chick's lame attempt to run away from the cops. 

Bartender that night was very friendly =D
author: Connie M.

description: One of my fav neighborhood bars. They have daily rum punch specials, a full bar and a decent selection of beers available. What I like most about this place is the atmosphere. It's not too loud, people are friendly and it really feels like a neighborhood bar. They also let you bring in your own food, which is really nice!
author: Angie L.

description: Came in here from San Diego. This place was uncommonly friendly to out-of-towners like me. Considering the Padres were playing the Giants as I was sipping my beer, this scored points with me. The unpretentious vibe made me feel welcome. I suppose thats true for a lot of places in SF that I didn't grasp before. Very every day working class bar but not too divey either. 40s decor but not sophisticated. Bartender Chris was cool and had some Dazz Band blasting on the jukebox. That and the assortment of red, brown, and orange rum-punches in iced punch bowls on the bar was ALL I needed to say yes to Hobsons. This will be the 1st place I hit up next time I'm in the Haight.
author: Chris A.

description:
Great place to kick off a pub crawl on a hot Friday afternoon.

I just had the Go Go Punch, which was like a lemonade with a hint of ginger. Matter of fact, try everything they make in house! Great bartenders, friendly people hang out here, and just a good place as far as prices for happy hour! Would definitely come again!
author: Jerald B.

description:
Alcohol = good.  
Punch = great.
People watching = brillant!
Seating = choices!

Yeah, I like this place, when it's not too overly crowded.  They have a small bar, but they have good service, and they make great drinks.  I'm a fan of their punches though...especially when there are more 'lite' drinkers...lol   ;-) But it'll hit the spot too.  

It's a nice cozy look, with a small upstairs...and there's a bouncer outside, just hangin' out!
author: Fannie S.

description:
A great basic bar. Fun place to hang out unless it's super-crowded.

Pros: Dog-friendly on weeknights, cheap happy hour specials, you can order food from Asqew next door and they'll deliver.
Cons: rum punch causes a SERIOUS hangover, can be too college-y, loud and crowded
author: Kim C.

description:
Came into this bar randomly after walking around Haight from my friends apartment...glad we found this one!

It was a pretty chill Thursday night, good amount of people but not too crowded (or deserted) at all.  I saw there are a couple reviews saying this place was loud...didn't experience that when I was there.  There were a lot of groups of people, but none that I saw that were causing havoc or noise violations.

The bartenders there that night, Laith and Megan, were super nice and were very welcoming.  They hooked up my friend and I with a few drinks since 1) I was from out of town and 2) it was my friend's birthday.   I didn't think their prices were expensive and I do agree that they did make them a little strong, which is always a plus.

I'd love to come back here next time I am in the neighborhood!
author: Nicola V.

description: Your typical local pub, nothing too special about it, but it's good.Be sure not to miss out their happy hour from 5pm to 7pm, because their punch is very good.
author: Nicolas S.

description:
I LOOOOOVE their happy hour; it's become a 2- or 3-day a week stomping grounds.  
Here's what sold me on the place from the moment I walked in:  

1) the bartenders are friendly.  ALL of them.  At most bars, you find one bartender that you really like, and the rest are either "meh" or terrible.  At Hobson's, they're all knowledgeable and smiling, and downright NICE to you.  I dig it.
2) They have a decent microbrew selection, and drafts are only $2.50!  My friend gets the rum punch (also $2.50!) and has to be carried home after just two drinks.  For those who are crazy/brave/alcoholic enough to need an extra kick to their punch - you can get a rum "floater" for an additional dollar.
3) The windows are fantastic for people-watching and it's at a prime location on Haight to laugh at the people waiting for the bus or walking by.

Every once in a while the music is BLARING (not cool for happy hour conversation time with your friends), but they're great at turning it down if you ask.
author: Renee R.

description:
You better be prepared to show your ID cause these cats ain't messin around.  Which I appreciate because there's very little worse than having to drink next to a group of giggling kids pooling their change to buy two beers.  So ID's out and you're in!

I love the punch.  Love it.  Want to marry it and have a lot of punch sex and carry pictures of it in my wallet and pillow talk it until it leaves me because I'm smothering it.  It's pretty tasty and damn drinkable.  However, I hate that I can't go in here without getting hit on by like 7 different couch surfing suburbian tourists telling me how progressive the city is and how they plan on moving here.  Can they have my phone number to "hit me up " later, and if I get invited to one more rave while at Hobson's someone is getting hurt.  

Just once can we have locals only night?  Oh God, please?  I'd pay extra.
author: Boots B.

description: I like it here and would personally consider it the best bar in upper Haight.  It has a comfortable atmosphere and a great orange punch.  Prices are fair and the upstairs is very quaint.  A good place to go with friends I would say especially if you wanna go for a punchbowl all to yourselves.  Cheers!!
author: Sin F.

description: Very cool bar.  69 cent shot specials on Valentines Day.  Attentive and friendly bartender and a laid back crowd.  Cheap drinks.  Can't get much better than that.  It is located in the heart of the Haight District near Haight and Ashbury.
author: Zach P.

description:
Choice of what, I wonder?  

After reading their web site, I'll have to let you in on a little secret:  Yes, you do have a choice.  

Sunday afternoon they feature bloody marys, despite all the punch promotion.  Make your own bloody marys it appears.  For about $8 the bartender was pouring almost 2 oz. of vodka into tall tumblers of ice, and which patrons then used to mix their own to taste, with a huge layout of options that made me wonder how many ways one could make a bloody mary.  

This turned out to be a small bar, with a few tables out front, a small lounge in the back, and another small seating area upstairs.  Traffic was low, it being Sunday afternoon, but the bartender was rushing around like it was 5pm on Friday.  Phoning the "kitchen" for orders, pouring punch, pouring vodka.  Rush, rush, rush.  

Phoning the kitchen?  Yes.  Customers placed orders for food through the bartender, who would grab a cell phone and call some mysterious delivery service.  He'd then hand the customer a table number and tell him to pay the server when the food appeared.  And by the way, they were out of hamburgers.  What?  Oh, I read in another review that the "kitchen" is Asqew Grill.  

It's a little bizarre, it all is.  But the room has the usual bar smell, born of 100 years of spilled beer, and you know you're in a bar.  There's an internet jukebox on one wall.  And yes, they do have red wine, cab or merlot, if you want it.
author: David D.

description:
I kind of wanted to write off Hobson's as a bro bar, or claim it was douchey to come here, but I really can't. This place is just plain fun.

They have one of those digital jukeboxes with thousands of songs, which makes for a fun time. So on Saturday, I slowly got drunk on Victorian Punch (a rum-filled Jungle Juice of sorts) and bullied the jukebox with some mid-'90s ska tunes.

I've been to Hobson's a couple times now on weekends, and it was never too loud talk to someone, the bartenders were always amicable, and the crowd seemed fairly decent.

Oh, but nuts to it being cash only. $2.00 surcharge to use the in-bar ATM.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
This is a fun place.  It's got enough space for the amount of people that show up.  They've got unique happy hour type stuff going on in the form of their punches.  And they've got a ridiculous rum list.

Most places don't have even 1 decent rum.  This place has a boatload, and the people behind the bar know all about them.  To top it off my friend and I tried 5 different rums on one trip and it wasn't even a gut-wrenching bill.
author: John S.

description:
How did it take me so long to find this gem?  Great atmosphere, friendly service and an amazing rum list.  The house punches are deadly in that you cannot taste the alcohol.  I need to go back and investigate the make your own bloody mary bar - it looks amazing.
The food looks really good - grilled asparagus, yummy nachos and more.  I'll be back.
author: She-Ra ..

description:
I'm not in college anymore, but I sure do like this little home (with alcohol) away from home.

Cozy and intimate amid hip hop tunes played not so soft that it's weird (this is very possible - happened to me at a party down in LA a few years back...still brings shivers down my spine...so....weird...), and not too loud so you can clearly hear your friends telling tales of modern day scurvy and some good 'ole old world international gift exchanging.  If you like girly drinks, try their house punch - it's way better than kool aid, and much, much better than a kick in the pants.
author: Shinny L.

description: Didn't love it here.  I came with two girlfriends and we ordered a punch bowl to split.  We also ordered a rum flight and I think the bartender just canceled that on us, probably thinking he was doing us a favor.  Fine.  The punch bowl was huge and mostly sugary fruit juice.  I mean I guess that's to be expected but boy did it give me a headache.  The environment itself was fine, nothing special.  I guess I've been spoiled by Smugglers Cove, which does fruity rum drinks right, so I just don't see myself coming back to Hobson's Choice to fill that void.
author: Shauna L.

description:
The 2-star rating description of, "Meh. I've experienced better," aptly describes my first (and possibly last) impression of this place. The music was too loud for what I was looking for on a Wednesday night- not really a chill experience. Whoever wrote that the crowd is half hipster, half gangster is spot on; and it's kinda strange walking in on that.

Bars aren't supposed to smell particularly peachy, but this bar gets a D on the hypothetical smell-rating scale. Not a good choice for someone who just wants to sit around and have a couple drinks with friends. Yet, a good choice for someone who wants to be hit on by 40 year-old men who DJ hip-hop/rap. I actually didn't even get around to ordering a drink, but hey, they could be good.
author: Ashley M.

description: Why do my reviews disappear?! Or... Am I developing a bad memory? Well anyways, here's a distance memory of what I remember from my night at Hobson's. I remember a packed place, and it was a little bit late- and it was kind of hard to get the bartender's attention since I'm so short. Thankfully me and a friend that I had just met got a table upstairs, and ordered some rum punch for us both. I guess this is what they're known for because they definitely do punch right. I'm not sure how reasonable drinks here are, but I can tell you that its definitely worth it since the punch packs a punch. Again, the place is crowded, but the seating upstairs is great, and a nice place to chill with friends and talk amongst the music. It's not my favorite bar, but it's probably my favorite punch- drink wise... not physically. ;)
author: Monina C.

description:
5 dollars for a glass of yumminess? Count me in! They have 3 punches to choose from as well as a whole bunch of beer choices, mojitos, and everything else! 

I have only been here twice and both times on a Thursday. The first time the place was really busy! We got a seat at the bar, but the whole thing was really packed for this being such a low key bar. The 2nd time, it was fairly empty. We were there for a couple of hours and at its peak there was about 20 people there. 

The bartenders are super friendly and even though it took my friend and I an hour to drink one glass of punch, they didn't mind. They made conversation with us, asked if we wanted extra ice for our drinks, etc. The bar was actually empty enough that around midnight, they went down to 1 bartender instead of 2. 

The place has great drinks at great prices ($20 credit card minimum), fairly clean bathrooms (compared to some on haight street that I have been to *cough* peoples cafe *cough cough*), and I would definitely stop here every time I go to haight!

Oh, and the 43 and 33 busses stop right out front!  Fantastic for me!
author: M M.

description:
I guess I'm giving them their 98th five star review.

I love this bar and it's a must every time in the Haight.  The ambiance is great, the music isn't too loud, bartenders are pretty attentive and it's always got a good crowd.

The drinks are solid and they have great choices of beer on tap.  The rum punch is great, the Ginger lemonade one...freaking delicious a must.  Also, make your own bloodies on Sunday are a nice treat.
author: J. S.

description:
their drinks are tasty
I had the dark and stormy and then some of their rum drinks.
although through the night they became stingier about the cherries.

One of the female bartenders was bitchy to someone, but since I didn't know the situation I won't judge.  She was nice to me.  You can order food from next door here, which ended up being pretty perfect.

The food was surprisingly good too.  I'd recommend the wings but pass on the ribs.
author: Van W.

description: My favorite Happy Hour place! Great atmosphere. You can either sit in the front and watch all the interesting things that happen on Haight or sit in the back and enjoy your draft beer or house punch in a little more private atmosphere.
author: David G.

description:
Here we go Hobson's, Here we go, woot woot!  As you can tell I like Hobson's.  They have a killer happy hour, $2-$3 rum punches.  I like the red one, I think, maybe its the orange one.  Shoot, you got me but one is definitely better than the other and towards the end of the night they both taste the same.  They have a killer Ipod on every time I'm there and I love the old mismatched furniture with the brass accents.  Even though its not the biggest space its designed well.  A front area, smaller back couches and then an upstairs.  This is a super chill bar and you can bring in anything you want; as in games and what not, maybe not a crack addict but within reason.

On to the BEST part of Hobson's, their affiliation with Asqew.  BBQ MAKES ME HAPPY.  Their chicken, corn and mashed potatoes bbq can change your whole day around.  One second you just went on the worst date of your life and you're holding band-aids outside of Alembic and the next second you're eating skewered Asqew meat at Ace's laughing about the A-hole who gave you those band-aids.  Now at Hobson's you don't even need to walk next door to get it, they will bring it over.  Heaven on earth.  

By the way even though its a rum bar with infused rums they serve a decent amount of Fernet, which always equals a good time.
author: Kristin Marie S.

description:
Something of a combination between comfy neighborhood dive and tourist trap, cleverly dressed in a drapery of Victorian furnishings. Nothing particularly outstanding in the three specialty punches. But if you know me, you know I appreciate a dedicated specialist - and this is perhaps the widest and deepest collection of Caribbean rums I've ever seen.

Decent staff, lots of seating, fantastic for groups.
author: Alex B.

description:
WARNING! THEY RIPPED ME OFF!!! they have a 20 dollar minimum for credit card charges. My friend and i had 15 dollars worth of drinks and then had to leave (the place was absolutely dead on a Friday night) I asked the waitress if she could just charge me 20 on the card because there was no way we were having more drinks. she added a 5 dollar punch (which she never brought out because i assumed it was just to settle the bill) making are total 22.17. perfect right. 
anyway i signed the receipt and we left. 
Checking my bank account later and they charged my card 27.17 THAT LITTLE SKEEZY ADDED 5 MORE DOLLARS TO MY TAB FOR NO F-ING REASON!!! be careful and use cash. 
bath rooms sucked and i watched ghetto people snort coke right outside the window. shady place. will never return for this bulls***

THEY OFFERED NO RESOLUTION FOR THE OVERCHARGE
i have called the bar and they said the only thing i could do was dispute the charges with my bank.
My bank wants to shut down my Card.
 too much trouble for 5 dollars but i guess that's how Hobson's choice makes their money.

THIS PLACE WAS LOUD AND EMPTY.
just tourists with a corporate group and old nerdy guys. everyone who looked cool and local was leaving around 11pm looking for a more populated place.  
their specialty is the mojito. it's okay but really small. at other places i frequent, it's served in a tall glass. not at Hobson's. short and FULL of ice. 

STEER CLEAR.
author: Jenn C.

description: I must have graduated too long ago. If you want to revert back to school days where you can sloppy drunk on a spiked punch, this is the place to be. Loud ghetto dance music blasting even when its not hopping on a weekday, but attempting to recreate the overcrowded weekend scene. Dirty carpet saturated with years worth of spilled drinks and puke. Single unstalled bathrooms means huge lineup on a busy day. Big open bowls of neon color punch line the back of the bar, wafting of sweetened cheap alcohol. The Mojito was the safest way to go. Not bad, small cup, mint was decently fresh, but limes were on the verge of disposal. Staff was ok, let the $20 minimum slide since it was such a slow night.
author: Naomi K.

description: Aka The Punch House. I love the Victorian punch. Good boozy fun! 2 large TVs and actually I wish they didn't have them... It takes aways from the classic vibe. If you can ignore them, the atmosphere is great. Attentive but not overbearing staff. Next time I'll have to get a bowl!
author: Alex L.

description: Be careful with the special punch.  It's really delicious.  And it will make you act really special.
author: Audrey K.

description:
Love.Love.Love. 

The best part of this bar is the service! The bartenders are always a good time. I've been here when its been crazy on a Friday or Saturday night, but also on a random Monday when you can just sit back and enjoy a nice cold beer. The one thing that's a must-get here is the punch! have a big group with you?! No problem. 3 different kinds of Punch, all good, all strong, all go down real nice! :)
author: Vanessa A.

description:
I may like this place a bit more if the upstairs area didn't reek like a rat crawled up someone's ass and died... 

Other than that unfortunate circumstance, I kinda dig this place... punch bowls full of innocuous looking liquid, lots of (but not too many) people just hanging out, and some grub to help soak up that punch.
author: Kara B.

description:
Local bar ... with a doorman that really really checks your ID.  So much for using my fake ID that says I'm over 30 ... sheesh, who would believe that?!!

Came here with a bunch of friends as a 3rd stop of a night of drinking.  After seeing the 2 giant punch bowls, ones that looked a bit too ornate to belong in such a bar, we decided to partake in the orange and pink libations.  The drinks were pretty yummy - come on now, how can you go wrong with rum and a crap load of fruit juices??!

On Fridays, they have bartender shots ... the one that my friend ordered for me - which was pink (because that's how I roll) was a bit too sweet and heavy.  Otherwise, cool place, friendly crowd.
author: Kathleen W.

description:
Fantastic drinks, great location, and most of all, an extremely knowledgeable and friendly bar tending staff.

Also, the music they played was a perfect mix of classic rock.
author: Stephanie P.

description:
Solid ass BAR
The bartenders even when super busy are very fast and attentive.
Crowded bar has a decent e-cast jukebox.
My friends and I blew up the juke-box this saturday night. The highlight of the night was singing word by word "Today was a good Day" by Ice Cube
Although in retrospect My friends and I had one of the most disruptive, shitty nights in our adult life, but coming to Hobsons we kinda put all that crap behind us as we drank and listened to good music.

Chill atmosphere and for sure be back soon.
author: Andrew Z.

description:
This bar has my favorite jukebox in the city.  It's one of those fancy digital ones.  I used this to my advantage on my last visit to take over the music with a mix of 90s ska and punk.  

The Victorian Punch is pretty good. There, I said it.

The crowd is a nice mix for the area, and the bar itself is a decent place with a good selection of drinks and cool staff.
author: Charles R.

description:
Warning: after enough punch, you may ask your +1 if you can body-slam him to see if you will bounce off his puffy parka.  (If your sober +1 says yes, continue to date him, but try not to laugh loudly enough to wake the dead.)

Hello, Hobson's Choice, aka newest way to waste a few hours in a bar!

$30-$40 gets you a large bowl of punch/booze juice, which serves 3-6 people.  I preferred the Victorian punch out of all of them, but the other one we had (some sort of peachy-orange combination with a mass of maraschino cherries) was also delicious.  The Victorian punch is, according to their website, "Silver, Coconut, and Pineapple Rums blended with a Cranberry-Pineapple base."  It comes with a bunch of lemon slices floating on top.  Sober +1 said that the alcohol was detectable, but to me it was sweet sweet fruity nectar, reminiscent of the 4th of July my "friend" gave me a glass of pineapple juice that he swore was virgin but actually had a significant amount of pineapple rum in it, oh god, that was a bad night.

Inside the Victorian building, it's a nice-but-divey atmosphere, with plenty of seating, two levels, and a big bar.  I hear that if you ask nicely (or if you are a beautiful 5'10 blonde, which I am not), you can sample all the punch bowls before you make a decision.

This is definitely a place to go with a group of friends (if you're planning on having a punch bowl).  I could see this place being packed on one of the hotter SF days, but even in the December chill, that punch warmed us all up right quick.
author: Jennie K.

description:
Stacked with rum punch selections galore! 

This place is equipped with a vast selection of rums from Barbados, Jamaica, Martinique, DR, Brazil, etc...

The diversity of selections speaks for itself - and the concoctions complement the rum exceptionally well.

Vibe is laid back and on the night we arrived with a large group, the music was infectious with sounds from the 80's mixed with other surprises including Thievery Corporation & Kool Keith. My ears bled with pleasure.

Bartenders = attentive & awesome. Crowd = diversity reigns supreme.

I highly recommend this spot...
author: Chris D.

description: Love this place! ! Chris the bartender is fantastic! We will definitely the next time we're in San Francisco
author: Michelle B.

description: This has been one of my favorites bars in the city since moving here! I love this place, I've gone back four times so far. It's so perfect for large groups, so I always take people who are visiting here! I also love their long selection of cocktails! No matter what day or time I go we always find seating and get served quickly!
author: Dianna C.

description: Love this place. Solid rum selection and great Victorian Punch... esp at happy hour prices!
author: Andrew N.

description:
Don't let the name fool you.  You actually have plenty of choices here.

That said, this place is horrible.  Horribly cheap and convenient!!!  Too many times have I come here for happy hour to "start" my weekly fade only to finish there from the creeper punch they serve.  

$3.50 for their awesome Victorian Punch at happy hour is excellent.  My other favorite is their potent Dark & Stormy--high quality dark rum mixed with ginger beer (not ginger ale).  Delicious.

The downside is that this place is on the bike ride home from the gym, so I end up undoing everything I tried to gain.
author: Jeryl C.

description:
I was in San Francisco last weekend for my birthday, and decided to go to Hobson's Choice.  When I lived in San Francisco, this used to be one of my favorite bars.  I've only been away fro 2 1/2 years, it shouldn't change that much!  Here are the points of interest:

1.  The service is mediocre at best.  It is kind of a red flag when your waitress stands outside with the bouncer, talking and socializing, when she should be inside, doing her job.  Especially when I can't get her attention through the window...not cool.  

2.  Their drinks are pretty small.  Their signature drink is supposed to be a mojito, and it was served to my friend in a small glass.  Mojitos are supposed to be served in a tall glass.  This reminds me of businesses trying to cut costs at the expense of product quality.

3.  The bathrooms are FILTHY!  I know its a bar, but it isn't a dive!  I can expect the bathrooms to be that way at other places, but here?  No way!

So, why does Hobson's Choice deserve only 1 start?  Simple...They ripped my friend off.  From the $20 minimum (which restaurants technically can't do) to the fact that they charged extra $ onto her card without her authorization.  This is a really bad business practice.  Needless to say, I will NEVER go back to this place again, and I don't suggest you do either.
author: Traci L.

description:
pics added:
1. the house punch is just as exquisite as i remember it.
2. go go punch is just aiiiiiight. too sweet imho.
3. mojito tuesdays! don't sleep!
4. double happy hours: 4-7 and 10pm-closing.
5. wii is available upstairs. they make you sign a waiver first-- it's treacherous. you'll see why.
6. bar menu by askew grill next door.
author: Vanessa D.

description:
Go during happy hour (5-7 M-F I think...) and try one of the punches. Hell, for $3 each, try all 3! Three, rum-based punches (one red, one blue, and I think one orange) served tall over ice in a funky glass straight out of a freshly-mixed "victorian" punch bowl.
