The only downside to this place is, like most SF bars it is cash only (maybe a $30 min?) but there are plenty of ATMs all over Haight and probably one right in the bar.

Really cool, corner, dive-y bar on a busy, touristy street. Check it out!
author: christine c.

description:
Hobson's used to be a favorite among me and my friends. Great punch in great big punch bowls. Added bonus: you can order yumminess from Askew Grill next door. They even have a special menu item for Hobson's: bbq chicken nachos. Killer! 

So why am i giving 2 stars you ask? Well, the other day I talked a few friends into going there, only to find that they were out of punch bowls and not only that--the bartenders don't even like serving them so they have no intention of getting more. Something about people tipping them poorly on the punch bowls. HELLO?! It's a punch bowl bar- if you aren't going to have punch bowls, it kind of defeats the purpose! Couple that with an over an hour long wait for food due to a mix up on the food order, and I will have a hard time going back. Hobson's - a word of advice - you have a good thing going, so make it work!
author: Kelly M.

description:
This has become a Sunday ritual: BLOODY SUNDAY!! How can anyone refuse a bloody mary bar?! I love condiments of every shape, flavor and color!! i end up putting more veggies in that drink than tomato juice!!

We always get there and sit upstairs on the balcony and sip on our bloodies enjoying the view of the bar. 
And once you've had your fill on the bloodies, move on over to their punches! I believe my favorite is the Victorian punch. 

The service has always been fast and courteous!
Hobson's choice is the perfect bar to sit with your friends and talk and drink the day away!!
author: Susanna B.

description:
This place is nothing but bad news... they get a new "door man" every couple of months. Most are obnoxious, cocky, rude, sarcastic, drug users and always on the lookout for a confrontation. The current guy, "Moon" is probably who the other poster here was referring to (in February).  

As for the long long history of fights, knife attacks, and general chaos and skank and sloppiness  that this place attracts, is well known..which is why staff turn over is so rampant.

What else would you expect from a place on the corner of Haight & Clayton, with rap and hiphop blaring out of the door, with skanky women and frat boys and gold-chain wearing thugs go to get hammered, and indulge in pot around the corner on Clayton, and to score some drugs.

Stay away, unless you like thugs, skank, drugs, and fights
author: Ted K.

description:
Got my first legal drink here.

Sex on the beach. Pretty good. However, it was a Monday night, and I had to wait awhile, despite the low influx of customers, hence the lower rating.

However, me and my beau got free birthday shots-- sweet tea lemonade, which was sweet indeed. 

So that made up for the lack of interest the bartender portrayed toward me as I excitedly awaited my first legal alcoholic beverage.
author: Crystal S.

description: Nice neighborhood bar with popular rum punch.  I attended a party here, and they have an excellent upstairs area suitable for groups.  The prices were reasonable but the bartenders were less-than attentive.
author: Kim K.

description: Cool place in a slightly ghetto location on Haight.  Got a great selection of beers and they are known for their punches.  If you got a good size group you can get a whole punch bowl for everyone to drink out of.  Nice laid back place to chill.  Always got a bunch of interesting characters walking outside too.  C'mon, it's in the middle of Haight!
author: Jason Y.

description: A really great cool place to hang out on a Sunday!  They have bloody mary Sundays!  Full bloody bar!  But I think what they're known for is their punch.  I had the house punch which was mango and pineapple flavored and the victorian punch which was pineapple and coconut flavored.  I liked the victorian punch better.  But boy are those potent!  I only had 4 glasses and I was feeling a little bit woozy!  Maybe because I'm not used to drinking rum drinks?  Who knows but who cares....they were tasty!  Great place to hang out definitely, but I think they need bigger tv screens if they're going to show sports games.  I know its not a sports bar, but everyone was hanging there watching the game!  And I love the music they're playing! Lots of oldies but goodies like PM DAWN! YeS!
author: Gina S.

description:
The punch bowl is beyond brilliant. Old school idea: let's get a giant bowl of booze and split it like 5-6 ways for only $30. It's sweet and delicious and you will find your glass empty without even realizing you were drinking your beverage in the first place. 

Great week -night spot. Tables in the back, friendly bar tenders. Get the punch bowl!
author: Theresa T.

description:
Reasonably priced BOWLS of punch?!  And they don't even look at you oddly if it's only you and one other person and you're ordering bowl # 2?  That's awesome.

Go to this place on a Saturday afternoon, and hit up the balcony area.  Awesome place to just chill out, but I'm sure it's probably a bit much when it gets overly packed on weekend evenings.

Catching the weekday happy hour deal is definitely on my to-do list.
author: Michael S.

description:
Great punch!  Decent prices.  Not shady with alcohol.

I love this place.  I used to come here a lot after work for a few of their signature punches coworkers, but after getting blamed for making a comment about a bartender's lack of a "tipping shirt," and then accidentally although looking totally on purpose spilling a drink on that same bartender, I stopped going so often.  However, I went yesterday, and it was just as I remembered.

Sadly we got here a little before 1pm, only to find they didn't open until 2.  We went to Murio's down the street for a while, and then came back.

They have a range of different specialty alcoholic punches that change daily, but their daily staple is the victorian, which I can't get enough of.  It has cranberry juice and coconut rum, and I'm not sure what else, along with a rum floater I add for mine.  Delicious stuff.   And at the end of the bar we usually sit at, theres some couches along the window, and that whole little area is perfect for people watching.  All kinds of people walk by and/or wait at the bus stop right outside.  Hours of free entertainment.

The punches with a rum floater are $8, which is totally worth it.  Unfortunately their happy hour doesnt start until 5pm, but after that, I think the price drops to only $4 or $5-- a steal!  

This time I actually ended up getting a little bit of food, an order of mac n cheese, which actually comes from a place a couple doors down, something Askew I think.  It was nothing compared to the mac n cheese I had at The Tee Off the day before (although it was also $10 cheaper.)  It was alright for $4 though.  And I cant really judge Hobson's on it, its the place next door.

I think it's been long enough that my previous embarassment has been forgotten.  I've gotta start coming more often again.
author: Jon B.

description:
Cool place. Nice bartenders. Nothing too special

Funny transient outside playing the keyboard and later gets hauled off for "bothering the patrons" i.e. the bouncer. Poor guy! I almost brought HIM a punch!

Extra points for yummy rum punch (jungle juice) and late night happy hour! 11-closing?
author: Molly W.

description:
They let dogs in! A super friendly cocker spaniel and a bull dog were the treat for the night on Christmas. 

Their egg nog got us ripped. I soon forgot about the cocker spaniel.
author: Alfred Y.

description: This is one wonderfully laidback dive bar with a twist! The three regular rum punches evoke beachy getaways, and they're wallet-friendly, too (especially at happy hour). But don't skip the raspberry truffletini. It packs a whollop of a punch. Get it?
author: Bee H.

description:
nice place to stumble into on a lazy sunday afternoon if your watching the game on tv. chill atmosphere of the olderish football crowd. This bar has the best house punches ever. From victorian, to ginger lemonade, its tropical and weird mixes mask the alcohol pretty well hehehe. By the time we got the infamous "make-your-own" bloody mary, i was already buzzin in broad daylight w my glow. SO, i advise coming in on Sundays where they supply you with grey goose for your bloody mary, and its a DO-IT-YOURSELF mixx of how much tomato juice, or bloody mary house mix (highly recommended for a kick in your mouth) you prefer. Along with that are all the condiments and garnishes ont he side to deck out the mary to your desire. From celery, to jalapenos, to beets and red peppers, this drink is truely BOMB! haha highly recommend those who are around haight and need a pit stop 

oh yea, they also have hemp ale there :)
author: Shirley L.

description:
Went there for the World Cup - USA v. Ghana game.  We camped out upstairs where we were told we'd actually be able to hear the game, or more accurately the vuvuzelas.  All was well, drinks were flowing, crowd was friendly and jovial - then we started hearing fans in the back portion of the lower bar cheering or moaning about ten seconds before a huge play.  Are they that good at predicting what was going to happen, you ask?  No.  Turns out one crappy non-flat screen t.v. had a signal about 7-9 seconds ahead of the rest of the t.v.'s.  That really, really sucks when you are watching "live" sports.   We devised a plan where if anything remotely exciting happened, we'd yell real loud to try and drown out the dozens of fans down below who would be reacting to the excitement before the other 75% of the people in the bar.  

Long and short - nice bar, slightly rude pretentious bartenders, good fish bowl booze.   They aren't really a sports bar, so this is probably not a major issue for them- but its the World Cup - and every bar becomes a sports bar in SF.   The lack of attention to detail left me with an unpleasant opinion of this public house.
author: Adam D.

description:
This could have easily been a 3 star review, but the staff is amazing.  Can we say accommodating?? 

I'm constantly searching for chill places to nurse my hangover.  When I walked in on a Sunday, struggling. BFF wanted to drink and watch the Giants game.  I wanted to eat and survive.  We compromised.

Stumbled into Hobson's.  I had been there once or twice for a drink... or three....

4 TVs, no Giants game?  No problem.  The bartender was happy to turn it on.  Food?  They had a menu, though no kitchen.  Asqew grill delivers to them. 

As we leave, BFF forgets his phone (AGAIN).  Only, he had no idea it was missing.  Until his phone (aka the bartender) texted me and told me where it was.  Then, Hobson's was kind enough to hold onto the damn thing for FOUR DAYS until BFF got his broke ass back over there to retrieve it.

Thanks!

P.S.  Punch bowl is really good.
author: Lauren R.

description:
From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia:

A Hobson's choice is a free choice in which only one option is offered, and one may refuse to take that option. The choice is therefore between taking the option or not; "take it or leave it."

I would chose Hobson's every time.  Great drinks, service, and people!!
author: Catie I.

description:
I don't normally go out drinking when i have work the next morning (im not as young as i use to be) but i make an exception for special occasions.  Well, that and a girlfriend of mine threatened that if i didn't come out to have birthday drinks with her, she would repeatedly drunk dial me all night and leave angry voicemails.  I thought peer pressure ended in high school? 

Why she decided on Hobson's Choice is beyond me, but this is where everyone met up.  For a Tuesday night it was surprisingly crowded.  When i got here the birthday girl looked as if she had already hit her alcohol limit...and before i could even give her a birthday hug, she shoved a bowl in front of my face and told me to drink up.  I had a few sips but mixed drinks aren't really my thing.  Good punch, but i stuck with a couple pints for the rest of my time here.  

Honestly, i stayed for a little over an hour and then wanted to head out to a different bar, one less crowded and loud.  Hobson's Choice seemed like a cool place, lots of people, everyone seemed friendly having a good time.....but didn't feel like my scene.  So i hopped over to another bar across town, leaving the birthday girl with her face buried in her bowl of fun.   If you like bars that serve alcohol in a bowl with loud music and lively people, this place would be a cool spot for you to hit up.
author: Juv C.

description: I used to live upstairs from this place and would come in mostly for happy hour or to preparty with friends while waiting for the bus (which you can see and catch right outside the front door, score). Sit by the window with a cheap yummy house punch for haight street people watching at it's best. Only problem I have is the tables are ALWAYS HELLA sticky!
author: Amanda L.

description: Been by here a few times while out for a walk, glad I stopped in!  Great bartenders (Chris) and great Bloody Mary Bar!  Good prices too.  Definitely will be back for Sunday football.
author: Maureen R.

description:
After enduring 7 hours on a airplane flight to SF from Philly and having gotten 3 hours of sleep the night before, the plan was to crash at Stan the Man's apt after the Giants game.

However, the need to eat attracted me to "Escape from NY" pizzeria and then I made the mistake of walking by you, Hobsons. You had those different rum punches that I had missed so much, and I was lured in.

Stan K and I additionally found two attractive ladies to strike up conversation with, while we continued to consume our orange run punches.

It was a good way to cap a long day/night and visit one of my SF favs.
author: Shaun O.

description: Pretty good neighborhood bar to go to if you want to relax, watch a game and have a drink.  Fair amount of space and seating.  I haven't tried the rum punch bowls, but everyone else seems to love them, so they are at the top of my to-drink list.
author: Chad T.

description:
I'm not sure I can exactly put my finger on why I like this place so much... but I really do like it. When I was in SF a couple of weeks ago, my friends and I headed over to the Haight for an evening of debauchery. As soon as we got there I headed to the bar to buy the first round. Get this... TWO cranberry and vodkas (kettle one), a pint of some trendy beer, and a bloody mary for $24!!!!! And this wasn't happy hour, this was at 10pm on a Saturday night! I love a deal... and i love a deal on alcohol even more!

After about 15 minutes the corner window bench and couches opened up and we plopped down there. What a great people watching spot! The juke box has an amazing variety of music to choose from which made it fun. Our waitress, also by the name of Amanda, was awesome! She checked in on us often and was quite friendly!! Hobson's is known for their punch and while it is quite tasty, I'm more of a vodka kind of girl. So I kept the vodka coming.

The vibe here is very relaxed and non-pretentious and you get a great mix of people. Definitely will visit again.
author: Amanda F.

description:
My friends took here for my 24th b-day. This place is pretty awesome!

Taking a punchbowl and spiking it with God knows how much alcohol.  The thing is, you barely taste it!  It definitely creeps up on you.  That's what's so great about this place.  You can split it with a group of 5 or more.  Seems perfect for 5 you get a really good buzz going.  I had a great 24th b-day.  I was here once midnight hit on my bday. Tons of laughs, and ton's of memories. 

The interior is pretty oldschool--wooden bar and small chandeliers..nothing too fancy..but is reminiscent of what bars used to look like before modernism. -- doesn't seem like they changed much, but it definitely adds to the character of the bar.  

I look forward to coming back here with my friends.
author: Hazel A.

description:
I have only been here twice for promotions (I work for fernet.. yes.. fernet branca you know you love it)

However I have to give a shout out to all the employees.. they are absolutely amazing.. Doc is always there when we promote on Wednesday nights... I have to admit I have a lil bartender crush on her!

The place has tons of seating room, and the crowd is always a diverse mix which really makes for an interesting night!

I hear they have 2 dollar fernet shots on sundays ( I will be back to experience this for myself.. follow up review to come!)
author: Hailey P.

description:
Spiked punch? Outgoing bar staff that randomly motorboat your friend's boobies? Sitting around in a common area that looks part-vintage, part-run down? Watching people almost hit your friend's car while trying to get out of a parking space? Hobson's Choice it is!

This place is a great alternate to bar hopping or clubbing, when that type of scene doesn't strike the mood. What a better way to enjoy your friends' company in one place than here while sipping on some house special punch. $30 gets you a delicious bowl of this goodness that doesn't even taste like there's alcohol. But beware! It creeps up on you! 

I like how the bartender threw in a bunch of cherries to drink with each glassful. When we went on Friday night, it was kinda busy in here, but no too busy where a group of 5 can't sit down. We were able to find a nice area upstairs where all 5 of us can sit in a circle and rant about nonsense. 

It's been awhile since I've been on Haight Street, but coming here rekindled my love for the bum-infested trendy area. Last time I was in the area at night was for Milk down the street. Hypebeast central out there. Anyway, one of the female bartenders was super cool to hook us up with a punch bowl when they didn't have any upon our arrival. Yep, motorboated one of my friends too. Cool I guess haha. 

If you're looking for a place to chill and drink in one spot, think of Hobson's as a new place to hang out. Honestly, I can't tell if there was enough alcohol to get us buzzed, but maybe the fact we were all just having a good time and laughing contributed to it. Good times. thanks Hobson's.
author: Loren John B.

description:
Not in the mood for beer tonight? Get some PUNCH! The best place to go for that is Hobson's Choice. 

I've never had punch in a bar before I went to HC but if more bars served it, I would definitely be drinking it. Their Happy Hour is the best: $3 glasses of punch. Usually 3 different mixes on hand to choose from. Or, if you're with a group of people, you can get your own punch bowl and split it amongst your (drunk) selves. Genius!

HC is laid back, bartenders are cheerful and attentive and, like I mentioned before, prices won't hurt your wallet. Seems like a win-win situation to me.
author: Laura L.

description: This is an awesome bar with awesome peoples here. All their special was really great. Tried their "watermelon jolly rancher" with fresh watermelon aside. This is WOWWWWW... That's the way I like it!
author: Unyo N.

description:
My favorite drink in all the world is a good dark n stormy, and for that I go to Hobson's. Trust me, I've tried them all over, and this place serves the best.  Too many places use substitutes, or the wrong proportions, or worst of all, try to put their own spin on the tried and true recipe...NEIN! It never works. It's just not that kind of drink. It ain't that hard...Gosling's and ginger beer over ice with a lime. Hobson's uses Cock and Bull ginger beer, which I like best, but Barritt's works good too. OK, enough ranting about the dark n stormy...

Other than that, it's an overall great place for a drink. I love it most during a weekday (what better time to have a dark n stormy?).  It gets minus one star because weekend nights (Thur-Sat) it can become a bit of a frat party atmosphere, loud and crowded and sometimes altercations. It also lost points with me when it took out the old jukebox (it had the best selection in the city!) and put in one of those new internet ones...I guess I'm old school like that. But all in all, there's no better place for a drink on the Haight...
author: Joe S.

description:
It smells weird in here, like old barf or something.

One of their specialties is punch with booze in it. What is this, a high school dance from a movie about the '50s? If jungle juice or nothing is my "Hobson's choice", you can fuck right off. 

Conveniently located right next to a bus stop, and you can eat food from Asqew in here but you'll have to battle the barfstink while you do.
author: Trav W.

description: ALL of their rum punches are tasty! The bartender was super cool and gave me 3 very generous samples my first time at the bar. Planning to have my birthday drinkathon there
author: Roxanne W.

description: Loved it.  Punch (all flavors) were VERY tasty/refreshing.  Mojito was good too. The wife had too much tasty so we had to retire a bit early- didn't get to really "do" the Haight as Mommy was more than a bit faded.  Bartender was awesome- chatty and loved my music selections (I dumped $30 in the juke box and maybe heard $10-15.)  Hope to get back out to SF in life and I will be visiting Hobson's.  Bar food was good, though I can't remember what we had...
author: Cedric T.

description: Very nice place to chill out and watch the game. You get a nice mix of people coming here from the city as well as a few tourists. The place next door cooks the food and it's a relative bargain for SF. A stayed the whole Sunday, starting with their bloody Mary bar for breakfast and then making it through a few beers during the games and then finished off with a diner. There was a steady stream of people coming in and out. It's a bit small for the amount of people that want in, so get there early if you want to spend any amount of time there. My next visit to the city will definitely include Hobson's Choice.
author: Joel F.

description:
If your spirit of choice is rum, then you'll love Hobson's Choice. They've got over 100 different rums lining the wall!

Hobson's is a great spot to start your night. Happy hour is M-F from 5-7pm. $2.50 beer and punch can't be beat. It's all about the Victorian Punch (Silver, Coconut, and Pineapple Rums blended with a Cranberry-Pineapple juice)! Plus, you can order food from Asqew Grill there and have it delivered. Love the juke box too!

While the crew loitering outside late night makes the bar look sketch, you'll definitely feel the punch-drunk love from the other patrons there.
author: Connie C.

description:
Three Reasons to Go here:
1) excellent music selection
2) fun and friendly atmosphere with lots of seating
3) $35 punch bowl of bliss (ask for extra maraschino cherries - if you dare)
author: Laura G.

description:
This used to be one of my favorite haunts back in the day, and I reconnected with some old friends there last night. Here's why I like this place:

* This place makes me feel absolutely gangsta (for a  white boy). The jukebox played "Ain't Nothin' But a Gangsta Party" and "Big Poppa" as I walked in last night, and though I didn't quite drink a 40, I did have a pint bottle of Newcastle and a ginormous bottle of Chimay. If there's a gang that wears orange turtlenecks, I was its leader.

* Speaking of the jukebox, it's one of my favorites in the city. Though someone kept playing "No Woman No Cry" on Valentine's Day last night, which was a bit much.

* They have an upstairs level that no one seems to know about, and it's way less crowded up there. I love looking down on the sweaty masses from my table. 

* An unpretentious crowd of locals.

One minus for the restroom situation. I find myself waiting in line there much longer than I'd like.
author: Greg K.

description:
I get confused when I walk in here, Not the sort of confused that comes after 4 shots, where I am walking into walls, grabbing strangers asses and stumbling into the mens restroom. I NEVER get that sort of confused, at least not here.....yet. 

I get confused as to why a place specializing in rum has a Victorian theme. I know the British Navy captured Jamaica and drank a lot of rum in the 1600s, but it seems that you would want to go for a more Caribbean/pirate theme if you wanted to be historically correct. Or, maybe, you could serve us up some absinthe since that was so popular in the Victorian era. How about that Mr. Hobson? 

Oh, and while you are changing legislature to make that happen could you also whip up some cleaning solution for your furniture and rugs? I am not sure "historically correct" needs to include stains and dirt accumulated since the Victorian era. But, hey, after a few rum cocktails I will just slink upstairs and forget that this is a Victorian themed bar anyhow. Upstairs feels decidedly more old west, or um, Midwest, well, anyhow it doesn't feel Victorian. 

But that is okay. Usually things seem less clear when you drink. I believe after a few drinks here everything makes perfect sense.
author: Drue C.

description:
I love this bar!  Great service, delicious punch, fun clientele.  

I've actually only been here twice with my mom but we had so much fun and lots of great drinks (pretty good beer selection) and met new friends both times!  Definitely brought back stories from this place.  Plus, the service has been spectacular when we've been there.  Most recently, our bartender (Ian, I think?) had a full bar and was the only one working it and NEVER lost his cool.  Our drinks were never empty for long and he even plugged in my iphone for me when it died because I was waiting on a birth announcement.  :)

I would definitely recommend this place if you like casual, friendly, no fuss bars to tip a few back and make new buddies.
author: Elizabeth I.

description:
This place was described to me as "a Victorian punch parlor". It sounded interesting but not really my kind of place. I pictured Top hats, lace collars, dainty little punch glasses that you can't quite get your finger through, and people sipping punch with their pinkies out.

A friend wanted to go there on her birthday and I was a little intrigued so I hauled my ass all the way to upper Haight. We decided to get a bowl of the house punch for $25. It was Orange colored and tasted of Mango's. The funny thing is that after the first two cups I started feeling a little drunk but after that the more I drank the more I sobered up. I think the Ice melting watered down the punch. They also have a couple other types of punch and an assortment of other specialty drinks.

If I'm ever hanging out with someone in the mood for sugary punch I'll know where to take them.
author: Manny F.

description:
You like rum?
I like rum!
Hobson's choice has rum!  Lots of it too.
Rum punches
Rum neat
Rum and cokes
Rum kabobs
Rum sandwiches....

Alright I'm getting off topic.  It's a bar.  They have a pretty killer selection of rums, as well as two special punches.  
They have couches and a cute upstairs that most people don't know about.
They have great window seats for snuggling with your honey
They have generous bartenders
They have a local Haight Street feel without feeling dirty
They have an Ecast Internet juke box .  Use it...Play some Phish on it...that would be awesome.

PS...they have other libations other than rum...it's a bar silly!
author: Lauren F.

description:
Everyone knows that I do not like hanging out in "The Haight".  I just don't.  It's not me.

But on a lazy Sunday, wanting to go out to brunch with one of my favorite friends "B" -  we decided on Pork Store, and though my preferred Pork Store is the one in the Mission,  Haight was closer, so off we went.

It was a late brunch, and stepping outside, we found ourselves completely unaware of what we could do on a Sunday at 4 pm.  Frozen yogurt again?  Should we go to the park?  A game of tennis?  Boat around the bay?

Who are we kidding, it's me and B.  We be drinkin' - - at 4 pm on the Holy Day.

We strolled down to find Hobson's and entered.
Three of us grabbed a table.

Hobson's has a really cool concept on Sundays.  Bloody Mary Specials -- you go buy the alcohol and go over to the Bloody Mary stand and pick your poison and condiments.  Awesome.

I didn't have any though.  I'm not sure why.  I felt like beer, and stuck to having a Guinness.  My friends had the wheat beer, and that was some good beer, though they thought it was too fruity.

The music is a BIT too loud to converse comfortably, but all in all, this is a pleasant hangout w/ all kinds of people and good seating.   

I do remember specifically banging my head into the table over and over again when my girlfriend announced that in her quest to become like me on her dates, she tried being direct and asked her date the following:

"Didn't your mother teach you to open car doors for ladies?"  
BANG.  BANG.  BANG.  
(For the record, I never said that, but this is just living proof that a LITTLE knowledge is a dangerous thing.  I said to be upfront, and if something is bothering you - - find the right time to bring it up if it really irks you.  How that got skewed to bringing up his MOTHA, I will never know.)

The bartender was really nice, but be forewarned:  while you will get in without a problem, he does ask for ID and doesn't serve you a drink until you show it.

I'll definitely head here for Sunday afternoon drinks from time to time.  Cool place!
author: Grace K.

description:
I love, love, love to get drunk and buy things. Or buy things and get drunk. I am not particular about the order of events. I just like the two activities to go hand-in-hand. If I can do a little drinking, a little shopping, then a little more drinking followed by a little more buying, that's the best! That's called maintenance. 

Hobson's Choice is the perfect bar to get drunk at during daylight hours in the Haight, in between trips to the nearby clothing and shoe shops. Hobson's proximity to Fluevog and Villain's means I'm gonna look damn fine come tonight. And it also guarantees I won't have any icky buyers' remorse until tomorrow when the drugs and alcohol wear off and I realize that I not only spent more than my life is worth on shoes but that I also managed to ring up a hefty bar tab at Hobson's. 

The theme is victorian and the bar is musty in all the right ways. The front gets crowded so get your eagle-eye on and nab a table/bar stool as soon as someone ups and goes. The back room is dark and feels haunted. The mezzanine upstairs is fine but then you can't scope out cute boys (not that I do...). The draw is the punch. Don't bother with anything else. RED. PUNCH. Skip the yellow. This stuff will get you buzzed enough to buy buy buy without a second thought. Bathrooms are awful and the lighting makes you look 80. So cover your eyes when you go in.
author: Autumn K.

description:
This bar is great if you love rum. They have a huge selection to choose from, I believe over a hundred. 

This place is great for large parties or with a few friends, they have a decent jukebox and OK bartenders, they aren't very sociable or entertaining, so you better have someone who does. It is a great place to chill and have a drink, it's not intimating at all. 

I don't hang out at the Haight anymore because all you see are bums and druggies. The street has gone down hill in the last five years. I'm not a hippy nor am I am druggy.
author: Stanley K.

description:
i had A drink here over the weekend. YES, ONE DRINK!!!!

well i was riding my crotch rocket, so safety first!!!

when the bouncer asked for my id, i had this fuzzy deja vu moment....

sitting in the corner near the window, i vaguely remembered throwing up outside.... on a muni bus?

meh, a lifetime ago... ok maybe not. three years ago.... but hey i can say that was in my 20s!!!!

its dangerous when you cant taste the alcohol. 

just saying. 

bloody mary bar? nice.
author: Euge L.

description:
Hobson's is an eclectic, fun San Francisco landmark bar that is fun to visit every once and a while, and a perfect spot to take out of towners.  During the week, the vibe is always great and the music is upbeat and young as well.

In addition, the people watching here cant be beat.  You're pretty much guaranteed to see one ludicrous act in front of the joint a night- whether it's someone defecating on the sidewalk or a homeless brawl, there's always some crazy ass shit going on outside.  Thats why I've always appreciated the stellar bouncers they have here- friendly to the patrons yet firm with the rif raf trying to panhandle.  Ask for Kyle behind the bar-he always hooks it up!  But, watch out for that famous punch- might as well be called "hangover in a bowl".

But, I have to take away one star for that horrendous bathroom-one time I think there was even feces smeared on the walls after a homeless person snuck in or something...I remember one of the employees telling me about it.  Not a regular spot for me, but one I enjoy every so often.

PS: I've just read some of the other reviews complaining about the prices: $5 for a pint of beer, $8 for a mojito.  What the hell, people.  Fucking cheap asses- tell me where you're going to find a $4 beer that isn't going to blow asschunks.  No really, I'd like to know.  And no, liquor stores do not count.
author: Genevieve M.

description:
A naked blond walks into a bar, with a poodle under one arm, and a two foot salami under the other. She lays the poodle on the table. Bartender says, "I suppose you won't be needing a drink." The naked lady says....

...I'll have another planters punch, or at least that's what I said.  Several times.  To the detriment of my liver.  On more than one occasion.

The latest occasion for using my liver as a playground came last night during the Yelp libs gathering.  Turns out I could have left my favorite 20, 10, 6, and 4 sided dice and my favorite deck of cards at home.  I guess I misunderstood the rules of the game.  How embarrassing.

No matter.  I had the house punch and the planters punch this time, several of each, which quelled any bad feelings or maybe all feeling  from my body and mind and tasted like the nectar of the gods, and at $2.50 each during happy hour I thought I had died and gone to heaven, or at least a really good bar in hell.

Besides three varieties of witches brew which I'm sure will be loaded with dry ice on Halloween like a bad prop in a 'B' rated horror film, they boast a full bar, several beers on tap and an upstairs lounge.  They also have a laminated bar menu that magically appears and disappears and by reading the incantation on the front before the great bar servants, will summon tasty foodstuffs from the restaurant two doors down.

This may be Hobson's Choice, but it's now my choice for a powerful and flavorful happy hour buzz which I will likely seek out tomorrow on that unholy of days, Halloween, and many other unholy happy hours to come.

"...Turnips! Turnips and Antifreeze!" 
Milo answers "Not with Donny Osmond, He Wont!"
author: Theron L.

description:
I came here one afternoon for a couple of beers and had the Balsamic Beef (from Askew Grill next door- their sister store) The dish was delish!!! Clay, our bartender, was really friendly and took great care of us. We actually  ended up here after walking out of another place across the street (wish i could remember the name so I could give a piece of my mind from that experience)
The bathroom is pretty nasty- so i'd suggest keeping it under 30 seconds in there. There's also a second floor with mismatched tables and chairs, good ambience. Bright windows up front. Glad we stumbled on this place.
author: Jina E.

description:
I'm an idiot.

Me: That mojito was damn good. Do you guys make any other special mojitos? Like mango ones? I lovvvvvvvvvvvvvve mango mojitos!

Bartender #1: We take our mojitos seriously around here. No fancy ones.

Me: Oh. Well, I'm not a fan of rum really, what else should I get?

Bartender #2: We have a menu, but it's totally wrong. This IS a rum bar, after all.

Me: Well, that's why I want a rum drink. Do you have anything that isn't too rummy?

Bartender #2: Uh..... (Defers to Bartender #1)

Bartender #1: ..... (Clearly both amazed and dumbfounded that I would utter such a statement.)

Me: Um, I guess I'll have another mojito.

As a way of qualifying that exchange, I would like to say that alcohol makes my IQ drop a good 20 points. Derrrr.

This place is a fun bar - the bartenders are amiable, funny, and great at picking out drinks. I had them make my friend the "strongest drink available" and they made him this intimidating concoction of rum, sugar, and limes. No mixer. Ballsy. Of course, he had two. 

The drinks were good and strong (I pretend to be a mojito connoisseur and they were awesome!), friendly atmosphere, the bathroom was an odd yet intriguing green, and the bartenders were able to handle the incredibly drunk/rude/ridiculous patrons a few feet away from us. 

And Bartender #1 also gets bonus points for supporting me in a bar debate. FYI for all you skeptics out there:

BLAZING SADDLES IS BETTER THAN SAVING PRIVATE RYAN
author: Devon S.

description:
I normally don't hang in the Haight, except perhaps on Saturdays for brunch...yeah, I'll definitely come down here for some good Pork Store grease, but for liquor?  I would never dream of coming here...I live too far (i.e.  need more than 2 buses to get here) and it's just easier to go downstairs or down the block if I ever need to get my drink on (I live very very close to A LOT of bars).  I came here today with the lovely Chloe C and had a blast.  

Great conversation and yummy punch rum.  The crowd wasn't of the douche variety I'm so used to seeing; lots of older I DON'T GIVE A SHIT folk there not to get drunk (what a concept), but to meet up with good friends and have some good times.  

However, the bathroom was disgusting and I felt like I was in some sort of 3D Alien movie when I went (the lights, decor...everything was green!), but that didn't take anything away from the experience.  As a matter of fact, it somehow kinda made sense.
author: Daniela L.

description: Excellent bar, great drinks. Bartender Dar was incredibly helpful to four out-of-town Brooklynites
author: Chris B.

description:
I walked in here this past Sunday to watch the football game. Found a seat pretty quickly, too. The crowd was a nice mixed group in good spirits. Everyone was here with friends. Good vibe.
I love bloody Mary bars! Unfortunately, I was still sick from the night before and didn't get to participate. But I'm coming back again for this Sunday tradition. I did get to peruse the selection of treats and flavors you can use to customization your bloody Mary. My mouth waters as I think about all the pickled stuff I'm gonna cram into that glass.
I love the idea of a punch bar. Everyone in the place had a glass of bright Orange punch. Including this drunk girl who clearly should have been cut off and sent home to shower. She was roaming around the place trying to get guys to talk to her and taking punch down her throat like a champ. Kudos to being hammered at 2 in the afternoon, alone. Other than this chick, I really am excited to go back. 
I was hopping to get some food here. I should have, considering the lunch I did choose was the worst meal I've had in the city. They get their food from next door at askew. I'm just not the biggest fan of askew and the flavors. But I'm kicking myself for it now. It seemed like pretty fast food service too. Someone from askew would walk in with your food minutes after ordering. Pretty smart concept.
author: Jena D.

description: I live in the hood so it's easy to get to.  They have huge punch bowls if you don't mind the slight headache manana.   I've never had a bad time but am definitely not a regular.  It's a good choice when on an upper Haight pub crawl.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
Shiver me timbers matey!!!  Over a 100 bottles of traditional pirate drink ready to be pillaged and is sauce-ly presented in ship shape fashion as the centerpiece of this victorian style bar.  They usually have two large bowls filled with their signature concoctions-- i went with the Victorian Punch which was perfectly mixed with silver, pineapple, coconut and other blends of rum =)  

After downing two chalices of the booty I openly yelled out ARRRR!!! in glee and an amused lad pointed out to me that September 19th (International Pirates Day) is still 6 months away... i responded as any seadog would and called out if he was "ready to man that gun?!?!!"  The cowardly swab drank down his landlubber drink (hoegaarden) and smartly avoided being fed to the fish.

The lasses that hold down the pouring are a kind bunch and politely fill me rum with a single AYE! and allow me hearties to splice the mainbrace and follow the latest sports happenings on the two sets from above.

Many posts for your hands to rock out to the cranked-up juke and loads of fun to mingle with little worry of catching scurvy...for practice with your pirate lexicon click below =)  
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2cKCkbWDGwE
author: omar b.

description:
As it was explained to me, Hobson was an inkeeper at some point in history and he rented out horses to guests, only unlike other places the guests didn't get to pick which horse they were renting; Hobson gave them whichever horse he wanted. And thus the expression 'Hobsons Choice' has come to mean no choice at all. 

What this has to do with the bar on Haight, I have no idea. The bartenders are nice enough to let you pick what drink you want, and you can even order from Asquew grill and they'll phone it in for you. This is primarily a rum bar and I'm not a rum person; Supposedly the mojitos are very good, and there are a couple colorful fruity punches that were fruity and colorful. The bloody marys aren't really anything special.

The Space itself is inviting, with comfortable chairs and couches and big windows for haight street people watching. Hobsons is a better mid-afternoon place than an evening destination. 

So yeah, good stuff, only minus a star for the $20 minimum for a credit tab and the lackluster bloody mary.
author: matthew r.

description:
I only come here on a Wednesday or Thursday because of the people.  It's not too crowded so you can actually mingle.  The crowd tends to be late 20s and older, thank goodness.  This is NOT the place for a beginner drinker.  It's called a Victorian Punch House but also nicknamed the House of 100 Rums!  I haven't yet verified if they actually have 100 different rums.  I lose count after about 6.  Then I forget which 6 I had, so I end up starting over the next time. 

I've had both the red punch and the yellow/orange punch.  The red tends to be less sweet than the other, but mixed together they are also not too sweet.  They have an excellent selection of liquor otherwise.  The beer selection is diverse, plenty on tap and even more in the bottle.  I tend to only come here for one beer anyway,  over and over.  Not sure what it's called but I order it as a "Leine."  

Foooooooooooood!
This is probably the best bar food you will get since it comes from 2 spots down at a place called Asqew Grill.  

Sometimes you will see Family Guy or Robot Chicken on the TVs, or sometimes a game, depending on the crowd.  As for the music, please, OH PLEASE don't play any slow jams or I might accidentally spill a drink on you.  And I'll know you're the one who selected it from the juke box if you are the only one smiling when the song comes on!

The bathroom is spacious, though I don't know why.  It's not a place to get freaky.  Well, I guess it could be if you're freak nasty like that.

There are a few small tables that can fit a party of 4-6 up in front, as well as a yuuuuuge table upstairs that can fit about 8.  Some wooden seats, some plush seats.

I LOVE this place.  I need to go back and start my rum count over again.
author: Karl D.

description:
When did this place become Douchebag's Choice?

I still dig the drinks though.
author: Jay H.

description:
We came in trying to pick up a sailor girl, but ended up staying for a round of Kamikazes.  And almost picking up a sailor boy.

Nothing makes a Saturday afternoon better than an awesome bartender (yay Chris!) and drinking with almost strangers.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Have you ever been so hungover that you cannot sleep?  But, you realize how futile getting up, getting dressed and going somewhere would be; as, you will eventually crash like a lead balloon and pretty much fall over comatose/dead at some point in the very near future?

Has that ever happened to you?

That is SO where I am at right now.

I blame much of my "hungoverness" on the very, very, very - let me say very one more time - VERY strong drinks that super cutie-patootie bartender Mike served me last night as Starla and I took refuge from the cold while trying to hail a cab (never happened, Drue had to come pick our sorry drunk asses up.)

Mike - you are a cute, yet remarkably EVIL man.  Gah.  Brain swollen, hands shaky.  I'm actually kinda sad that I'm attempting this whole three months of no drinking or partying (have I failed to mention that?  Oh, well I'm going on the wagon for three months kiddies - I've got shiznit to do, beeotches!) As a cute bartender who pours a strong drink is a very valuable find in this very expensive city.

Y'all should go visit cutie Mike the strong drink pouring bartender for me while I'm off doing my shiznit.  Tell him and the door guy (Chris) that the tattoo obsessed gothic hooker says "Hey, thanks for the hangover."

Gah.
author: Kate R.

description: Rum flights, rum punch and lots of .... rum.  If you're into rum then this is your place.  They have a great happy hour, friendly staff, TVs and plenty of room.  Everything that makes a good bar.
author: Corey V.

description:
I was completely perplexed by this rum bar.  Unexciting top 40 music from the past 20 years and wide range of clientele.  Lighting too bright for a place so divey. 

Found a fruit fly in my house punch - stick to beer.
author: E. R.

description:
Let me tell you about this place. I forgot when it was built. All I know is one day it was a funky old cafe that was never open for like 3-5 years. You would walk by Haight and Clayton and be like, "is this place ever going to be anything?" It was like the original cafe closed on night and they put the chairs on the tables and that was it, they never came back to open up the next day. There was a class on the same table for a few years. Really weird.
Then one day, bang, it was Hobson's Choice. Man, for three years straight now, we go on my birthday and kill it. We do costume themes and it's like chaos up in there. Cole, the bar keep let's us chill and hang out. I always feel like it's safe place to get crazy. They serve a bunch of funky rum punches that are TOO easy to put down your throat. They have the usual assortment of beers and cocktails but you want some of that crazy ass punch!! I can't wait till next April 15th so I can kill it again! I'll keep the Yelpers in the know!
author: Bill M.

description:
I always been into the mellow atmosphere this place offers, especially on Haight Street. I've been in quite a few times
I made the most AMAZING discovery yesterday!
Hmm... Should I tell you!? I sort-of want to keep it a secret!!!! :-x

Ok, OK!
So, they have my FAVORITE BEER IN THE WORLD Delirium Tremens there. FOR ONLY $6!!

Well, part of drinking a Delirium is that they typically pour it into a super fancy glass, as it DESERVES! They don't do that... Is it ridiculous to be a bit disappointed by the missing piece?! ;) Hobson's is a straight forward kind of joint. I took the chilled beer mug and tried to hid my sorta sad face.
Yes, I'm a nerd.

Anyway, my fave beer ever (and it's not that easy to find in most bars) is about $2-$4 less here then in most spots.

MANY PROPS! YAY BELGIUM!
author: Kellie P.

description:
This. Punch. Is. So. Good.

I'm a fan of rum.  I'm also a fan of rum in delicious juice, in a fun little bar on one of the best streets in SF.  I love getting buzzed after one drink, totally drunk after two, then scarfing down some melty nachos, stumbling over to a crazy blue bathroom but getting sidetracked and petting some dogs on a bench, and then forgetting how you got there in the first place.

That is my idea of a great Saturday afternoon!
author: Laura W.

description: Hobson's Choice.  My friends had a good time debating the philosophical meanings of the name of this establishment.  I was much more interested in the giant bowl of rum punch.  It was tasty and well worth my attention.  Who knows what was in it?  It tasted like a combination of Hi-C and a sweet Long Island.  It was fruity and good and had about a thousand maraschino cherries at the bottom.  We sat in the rear near the bathrooms, a cozy corner that would have been perfect except for the strange wasted person from AZ who kept stopping by to drink punch while licking the ladle.  Really gross!!  The music was chill and the crowd seemed 30ish.  It got younger as the night wore on.  We had no trouble hailing a cab at the end of the evening.  A fun time with a memorable bowl of punch!
author: Anne B.

description: Made a quick stop in here while exploring the city and I'm sure glad we did. The punch bowls are delicious here. It's an awesome place to get a drink, take a seat and watch all the people passing by.
author: Denise P.

description: This is a great little neighborhood place on the Haight.  It never seems to get super jam-packed crowded, or maybe I just haven't been there at the cool times.  Its got a laid back feel and they serve some fun punch concoctions which are all listed on a big board behind the bar for your convenience.
author: Rick H.

description: Take friends, punch bowl will require them. It's a funky atmosphere but nice.
author: Roxy H.

description:
I stopped by Hobson's Choice on a Saturday night to meet some friends.  Even as some of the other bars on Haight appeared to be slowing down, Hobson's was still packed full of people.  It was a little bit noisy inside but I guess that didn't matter.  I had already had enough drinks to make me less than articulate earlier in the night.

I noticed they had an upstairs area to this bar, I never found out what was up there.  This was because I was quickly whisked away in a marvelous adventure to the DNA Lounge that would put a gaping wound in my wallet.
author: Eric L.

description:
Not sure I should be reviewing this place, since I was here on Bay to Breakers and barely able to speak by the time I arrived...

What I do remember: lots of friendly (aka TOLERANT) people who put up with Eva and I staggering around, pointing a fake taser at them and making shooting sounds, tasty drinks, and convenient Haight location.  I'd come back ...if there isn't a poster behind the door with a red X over my face.
author: Sid D.

description: I have no idea what "checking in" is supposed to do, but I signed up for yelp just to say how great this place is.  It's not the best selection of beer, and my negroni may have had a cherry in it, and the juke box can get out of control... but I have great memories here because the place has character, it's not too loud or crowded to have a conversation. The bar tenders are by far the coolest I have encountered in sf, never too busy to smile and say hi, and never too tired or jaded to dance or buy a round when finishing a shift.  My friends like to bar hop, leaving each place after twenty minutes passes without women humping their legs, but I managed to get them to chill out here for a couple hours. #GoodTimeLastNight#
author: Nate B.

description:
Need to take the edge of after a long day? Happy Hour until 7pm! $2.50 drafts or $2.50 famous Rum Punch (2 choices of flavors). What more can you ask for?  A pretty nice buzz can be had and you'll still have money left over. Oh wait, are you hungry? You can order food from Asqew Grill through the bartender and it will be delivered to you at the bar. Nice, eh? 

Cheers!
author: Amy J.

description:
First bar I've ever been to on Haight. I always walked by it and thought how fun it looked. The seats are cushy and the drinks are strong. Being a poor college student I usually stick to the punch, also it helps my jungle juice withdrawals (frat parties I do not miss). The punch is cheap and sneaks up on you and then I make bad decisions.

Also I liked that it was a bar that had music, yet I could still have a conversation with my friend!

Minus a star because of the $20 card minimum. It just encourages alcoholism for people like me who don't believe in cash.
author: Pearl R.

description: All my reviews of bars should be taken with a grain of salt because my memory is always fuzzy. I've only been to Hobson's Choice once but I know my friends love the bar and I had an absolutely amazing time. Everyone (staff and patrons) are incredibly friendly but the true clincher is their punch bowl. $35 for a huge bowl filled with strong punch that can get 4 people legitimately drunk. Not "oh, I'm feeling tipsy", but, "OMG, I only had a couple glasses and now I don't know where I am". Forget drinking at home before heading out; this is the perfect place to start your evening if you're on a budget. As an added bonus, their all-black bathrooms look pretty cool. If you decide to take a picture after finishing the punch, don't make my mistake and use Hipstamatic because your friends will see the picture and assume you're a perv. Whatever.
author: Matthew R.

description:
Best mojitos in SF, can't be beat... or can they? Oh and killer rum punch special... 

And why do they get 5 stars you ask? Because they have a friggin table-top multi arcade machine that does Galaga and Dig-Dug and more!!
author: Joe R.

description:
Ok, if the place isn't packed full of people from who knows where, then I can stand it. The bar staff seem pretty friendly & knowledgeable and they pour nice, strong drinks - just how I like 'em. I'm not into that trendy 'infused' shit, I'm a purist, so they can keep that rum shit. 
Once I went there with a blind friend & the regulars were the only ones there (guess that's an anomaly) they were real nice & bought us drinks & we chatted for a long while about the 'old days'. 
Bonus star for having 2 levels, I don't know what it is about a bi-level bar that makes me soo happy, guess I'm easy that way.
author: Colleen B.

description:
So who knew - Haight-Ashbury is the new Camden Town.

Lots of young people with their trendy clothes ? Check!

Lots of stores selling hemp based tat? Check !

Very low bar-to-store ratio along the streets? Check !

Local actress made good filming an American Express advert? OK, so you're not there yet Haight, but you will be, and there is enough bloody parents having lunch with their kids. I mean come on, this was the town that small town kids ran away to 30 years ago - now they invite their parents to Sunday bloody lunch at Hobson's Choice. Where's the bloody revolution in that?

But Thank the Lord God Almighty for Hobson's Choice. Like an oasis in a desert of feckless drabness. A decent bar which serves decent beer and shows a couple of football games on a Sunday afternoon. A refuge from the mall that Haight has become. sorry SFers, I have been to suburban strip malls in illiniois with more character. You have killed this place. It made me afraid to go to Castro after what I saw here. You are a caricature of yourself. A desecration. I am not asking for a bloody museum, but at least something that gives me a sense of this place and what it is and what it once meant.

I mourn the passing of old SF. The passing of another year of life into nothingness and the eternal blight upon your summers.
author: Paul M.

description:
I ended up here alone (unfortunate scheduling mix-up) and got (unintentionally) drunk on a single drink (the mai tai). My brief run-down:

Drinks: strong, though not "authentic" according to my tiki-drink-mad husband. Personally, I can't tell - I just taste rum. 
Music: bad (on the night I went there, anyway - I think there's a jukebox, so really, the music should be classified as "variable depending on clientele).
Room: cool! Lots of little tables with upholstered chairs (brave for a bar), and a weird little upstairs loft kind of place that really seemed like more a treehouse than a part of a bar.
Ambiance: not bad. There were a bunch of drunk sorority or bachelorette party girls the night I was there, so I guess there's that, but there are also (seemingly) regulars who hang out at the bar (good sign) and cool light fixtures and kind of a neat shabby victorian (maybe - I don't know from history) feel to the place. 

All in all, I'd like to go back and try the punch bowl and hijack the jukebox, but I'm a little scared to think of what this place might be like on a busy weekend.
author: Jordan P.

description: Only reason Im not giving this place 5 stars is because its not the best for the solo drinker. The place is more for groups. I love to go there during football season and drink bloody marys and watch football all morning sundays. They also have wiis for rent, HELLA fun! love the punch. The punch bowl with a group of friends is the thing to do.
author: Lisa S.

description:
giant mixing bowl of rum [house punch] for cheapie.. nuff said..

ok.. ok... i admit it..  i really don't remember all the details, but  that means the drinks must have been strong enough. 

what i do remember: the bathroom was relatively clean for a bar..  there are a few couches, dark enough to hide mystery stains. ick..

someone brought their dog inside.. awesome much?.. 

mayhaps next time, i'll make it past their punch bowl and try their other drinks.
author: Donna H.

description:
Hobson's Choice, I liiiiiike you.  I like you because:
-Bartenders are nice.
-You let Nigel the greyhound inside, which means I get to play with doggies whilst enjoying your beverages
-Your punch bowls, and....
-on that note, I can't remember anything else....
author: Christine M.

description:
Rum. Rum. Rum. It'll make you warm in your tum, tum, tum. 
Don't pass up the chance to try the punch. 

Bring a group of friends. Get a bowl of aforementioned punch and chill upstairs with friends. The place can get loud, its easier to talk up there. 

Despite it getting loud, the place has a relaxing atmosphere. 

Remember that there is a $20 minimum for people with plastic.
author: joanna r.

description:
I may lose some street cred, but this is my local and i'm proud of it. The bartenders know and love what they do. Just order some of their house specials and you'll see. Hobson's happy hour has to be one of the greatest in the city. Just remember to cut yourself off at 3 of those house punches. 

The best thing ever are the huge windows that face Haight Street, which makes for the best drunk people watching ever.
author: Andre L.

description:
the punch here is like totally crazy. seriously. crazy. 

the punch the next day is like a total headache nausea situation.


ahh...favorite college bars.
author: Nikki M.

description: Awesome local watering hole filled with a variety of colorful characters. I'm not a rum drinker but I hear their trademark punch is very good.  An old-school San Francisco gem.
author: Ruth E.

description:
Sugary rum based drinks in a super homey environment. What's not to love?

Edit : Apparently, a lot.
author: Maria D.

description:
I'm only rating this place based on Happy Hour. You probably wouldn't find me in here at any other time.

$2.50 for some alcoholic rum punch. I like rum. I like rum punch. I love cheap rum punch. This place provides me that for happy hour. 

Score.

The couch upstairs is a haven of sorts, and is often overlooked. 

The bartender with the long, black hair is verrrrrry easy on the eyes. His dog is, too...and loves attention/affection. 

The jukebox is...manhandled. That's all I'm saying.

I was a user of this place for a while....all of my "first dates" started here. It was safe, well-lit, in a fun part of town and non-pretentious. 

And cheap. (For happy hour.)

Bonus: get yummies delivered right to your drinking chair, courtesy of Asquew. 

Credit card min: $20.
author: Danyell K.

description:
Things I learned from my night at Hobson's: 

1. A "bro" is a slang term for a Marina guy 

2. The punch will knock you on your ass faster than Mike Tyson 

3. The jukebox is subject to discretion meaning if you're playing 98 Degrees, your ass is likely to get vetoed 

4. Outsiders not from the Haight can be spotted relatively easily (myself included). 

5. $2.50 drinks during happy hour are a steal when a gallon of gas is more expensive 

6. Cheers to Jessica, Nicole, Candice and Connie - marketing machines! 

7. My kidney has declared war on me 

8. My head is protesting existing 

9. Don't stumble into a tattoo parlor afterwards and demand a picture of Mother Mary on your butt
author: Bill P.

description: I'm mostly a beer person, but the punch here is AWESOME. Definitely can't taste the alcohol at all, which is incredibly dangerous. Each glass is only $5, and they have a selection of a few different super fruity punches. The atmosphere is chill, and the bartender was friendly.
author: Samantha L.

description:
My buddy and I just moved into the Haight this past weekend and on Wednesday night we decided to stroll down the block to snag a drink around 9:30pm. Since we live on Clayton, Hobson's was the first place we came to and we decided to give it a shot.

5 stars, slam dunk if you're into RUM. I've always enjoyed a C-Mo shot here and there but i'm by no means a rum connoisseur. The bartender's @ Hobson's most definitely ARE. 

We ordered 2 flights of rum and had a full out tasting bonanza. Not only did they give us the full history for each bottle, they took the time to show us exactly how to taste each one of them. Service was top notch and the rum A grade. Apparently the Rum punch varietals they offer are the meal ticket, but I'm not into that pansy sweet shit, so i didn't even bother. 

Seeing as it was a wednesday, the place was super mellow. I'd imagine it gets poppin Thurs-Sun (they have a full Bloody Mary Bar!) so i'm definitely going to stop in again to check the scene on a more lively night, but for a a few great drinks, good company, and awesome service, Hobson's is the place to be.

Enjoy.
author: Patrick A.

description:
This bar is awesome! The atmosphere is great, the patrons are friendly, the service is fast and the drinks kick ass! (wow .. I sorta rhymed.)

I went with two friends recently and we shared a bowl of the Victorian Punch. It was really reasonably priced and certainly gave the three of us a gentle, tasty buzz.. I am a fan of a variety of drinks but this punch was great in that it was slightly sneaky. The flavors of the liquor aren't overwhelming so it suits everyone in that its pretty strong but it doesn't taste like it. 

YUM!
author: Katy H.

description:
One of the most comfortable day drinking locations in town.  I just revisited for the first time since the coaster war of 1998.  Thankfully they forgot I was the cause of that one. The furniture is ancient, the crowd is chill and there is an ottoman which the most gorgeous man in the Haight suggested I use to put my legs up.  Why didn't I think of that?  Well I was thinkin of puttin my legs up the second I saw him but I don't think that is what he meant?

Anyway they have an awesome selection of beers and big old fashion bowls of punch.  How fun is that?
author: Ian M.

description:
I love this bar.

They have Hendrix Gin here, which I love.

you can usually find me sitting by the window.
author: Chelsea C.

description:
I miss the vomit smell in this place. Someday, I will venture in here again and smell it.

Great Happy Hour... rum punch for $3~~
author: Megan D.

description:
This place makes me feel like a victorian era prospector...in a good way.

Warm atmosphere, good lighting, large space to spread out, great "punches" and askew will deliver food to you! 

Its like partying in someone else's rich grandparent's house. Its a bar with great potential for spontenaeity and whimsy.
author: Serene M.

description: Hard to review a place when they refuse to let you in. Trying to meet up with friends to watch today's Niners/Packers game and was told they weren't letting people in. I explained to the doorman that I was meeting up with friends. He told me no, sorry "management" said I can't let anyone else in. At that same moment someone walked up behind me and said he wanted to order food. The bouncer proceeded to let him in while still denying me entry. Completely unfair especially when the place wasn't even packed or out of control. Then when I pointed out that it was really unfair to let the other person in, I was met with a lecture about "shooting the messenger". Well perhaps so, but when you don't treat people equally or change the rules from one customer to the next that's what's gonna happen. There's no need for me to ever set foot in your trashy second tier bar. Thanks for the memorable experience.
author: Rebecca Z.

description: Great place! Went in this evening for a quick happy hour with a friend and ended up leaving 5 hours and 3 punches later! A little divey-er than I expected from their website, but not at all a turn off. Love their Victorian punch house concept. Not too crowded or too loud (at least on a week night) and there's plenty of room for groups or having some space to yourself for conversation. The Victorian and Gogo punches were excellent and packed a punch. Was already tipsy and didn't really need the complimentary round that the bartender so graciously left at our table (thank you so much!!!), but happily drank it anyway. Super nice service and the food from Askew that they offer is great too (nachos w/ BBQ sauce!) I don't frequent the Haight often, but this place will be on my list for future detours through the neighborhood.
author: Caitlin H.

description: Missed out on the punchbowl but drinks were good, and cheap what more can you ask for.  The upstairs is a nice place to hang out but sometimes it's reserved for special occasions.  I will go back to try a punch.
author: Teresa B.

description:
Hobson's is definitely best on a deserted weekend afternoon when it's a little too chilly to be roaming around out on Haight. They've got a cramped upstairs balcony which is great in theory, but gets a little too stuffy and claustrophobic for my tastes. If you can score a seat in the front window (or any seat with a clear path to the exit), that's where you should set up shop, because it has been known to be infiltrated by sudden packs of douchebags & jocks.

Overall, though, I like & tolerate this place a lot more than I would've just a few years ago. One extra star for the Askew Grill delivery factor.
author: Pete J.

description:
Danger Will Robinson -- the punch is spiked!  What a great way to destroy your liver -- with nice sweet girly juice.  

The seating is comfortable, the crowd is normal (surprisingly so for the upper haight), and the bartenders and waitress are reasonably nice. 

Bonus points for being in a super convenient location -- there are 4 bus lines that run by and there are always a ton of cabs when it's time to stumble home.
author: Eugene F.

description:
Oh dear...where to start with Hobsons...
Upon moving to the city this became my favorite bar very quickly.
The happy hour is incredible with many options for two dollar drinks and the punch? oh dear...the punch. Did you know you can get an ENTIRE BOWL of it for only 20 bucks??? Great to share with friends....but try to have more then two with you cause then you forget where you are and get kicked out....oops?
Either way, I love the vibe in this place, plenty of comfy couches in the back and a cute upstairs area...
Ya...and the bartender with the glasses on Mondays and Fridays is pretty cute (HA!)
BTW....order the MOJITOS!!! Fucking amazing, you'll start doin the mojito dance after the first sip.
Overall...
I love it here....
author: Stacy L.

description:
Douche Hobson's Choice!

I've been here twice and just couldn't get into it either time.  It seems like a frat house complete with old furniture, and frat boys.

One star for the grilled veggie plate
One star for the punches (which I didn't try but I like the concept)
One star for the bartenders who held onto my credit card when I forgot it.
author: Tempe M.

description: I felt very comfortable in this casual bar. I love IPA. They have it. Sometimes I like strong, fruity drinks. They have them. I like hip-hop, old school and R&B. They have it on the jukebox (along with other genres). Good restaurants nearby. Yup.  Marijuana friendly. Yes. Oh, wait, maybe they didn't know ; )-
author: Kent J.

description:
Get a bowl of punch or a flight of rum shots (they have an extensive selection) and enjoy a traditional Haight Street bar.  They have some cool star maps on the second floor, yes they have a second floor, and I found out that Janice Joplin used to live in my apartment.

I like coming to this place during the week days because there seem to always be people here with nothing better to do than drink. It is also right next to Escape from NY Pizza.
author: E-dough R.

description:
Mmmm, love that rum goodness.
Music on the box: Hip Hop and Rap.
Bardog: Check. English Bulldog.
Good friends: Check, my posse rolls deep.
Rum: ARRRR Matey! The finest rum you'll find, there be grog in yer future!
Cheap?: $5 for a rum punch, worth it.
Drink quality: Kicked ass. Had a couple good froo froo drinks, the Pineapple Upside down cake rocks, the House punch kicks ass... and the bartender has impeccable taste in rums when asked for a "good shot of rum". (Pyrat Rum Pistol)

This is the second time I've been here, and the place is consistently pretty cool, on a Tuesday.
author: Dave M.

description: If you wanna hang out with drunk college kids, this is the place to be.
author: Eric L.

description: A good place to get your fix for their specialty bowl drinks with a group of friends.  The place is pretty accommodating as you can bring food from outside vendors to eat in here when the kitchen is closed.  Also has an upstairs section with a large LCD TV which is a nice touch.
author: Lawrence E.

description:
Yes, the punch is great, the $2 beer happy hour special is amazin' as well.

Here's what I really like about it:

1) cozy couches so you can lay back while getting inebriated
2) jukebox with decent selection of music
3) UPSTAIRS ... I always love bars with seperate areas / rooms for your crew ... it was perfect for a birthday when my friends invaded and took over this floor ... it felt like we had a nice place to ourselves.
author: Alex C.

description: My friend with whom I'd been travelling had been to this bar years ago and wanted to go back, so when we walked the Haight we stopped for a drink at Hobson's. I wasn't into hard liquor so I passed on the awesome looking punch bowls for an IPA. The bartender was awesome and funny. Very friendly. I saw they had cool shirts for sale for $15.00 and bought one for me and another for a friend. We relaxed here on a a Saturday afternoon for an hour, hung out with others and just chilled. The place was comfortable and clean, and I will go back the next time I am in the Haight.
author: Devon A.

description:
There's just something magical, or disturbing, about drinking out of punch bowls that are constantly refilled by white 5 gallon buckets of alcoholic mystery...

Love, love love the happy hour here.  $2 house punch, $3 victorian punch, $2 draft beer pints.  It's 2 hours of complete liver mayhem.  And you can do all this while ensconced at one of the tables downstairs for some very entertaining people watching.  

The punch really reminds me of Wop (not the racial slur) and crazy undergrad days in the dorms.  Ah yes, those days when you'd fill a 10 gallon plastic storage tub, dunk your cup into it drinking who knows what, and then throw the cover on and act as nonchalant as possible when an RA would bang down the door.  Drinking?  No sir, we're not drinking in here!  You too can relive those days at Hobson's as you drink their much tastier version of the cheapo crap you downed as a kiddie.

It's laid-back and much cleaner/less scary than other Haight bars.  Really, it's a great place to come as you are, grab a drink and have a great time.
author: Jaime C.

description: Nice spot in the Haight.  The punch is legit and worth getting a couple and bringing in some food.
author: Maggie M.

description: Love this place!  Fabulous bar tenders and great drinks.  You can just walk in and say "I feel like something with a bit of rum, some ginger, some lime - what do you have?"  They will know something great and make you happy!  Love this place :)
author: S T.

description: We love stopping in for a refreshing beverage. I hear the make-your-own bloody marys thing is pretty cool too but we're sold on the punch! My fave is their Victorian punch- served in a tall glass and only $4! Credit cards are accepted here with a $20 minimum. We only see that as a challenge to drink more punch. Great place! We love it! :)
author: Jen G.

description:
I have never had anything but a blah, average sort of experience here (same beer as every other bar, uninteresting/pretentious staff, wretchedly awful food from Asquew next door), and then last night they graduated to absolute jerkdom.

My soccer team rolled in eight patrons strong for a post-game drink, to celebrate both a win and a birthday two days before.   When asked to present IDs, the THIRTY-THREE YEAR OLD birthday boy was asked to leave the bar because his driver's license had expired (guess what) on his birthday.  WTF.  People, we did not look like a young group.  He was not the oldest person there.  I can understand an establishment needing to cover their ass and do not resent anyone being asked for an ID, but PLEASE.  Two days past the expiration date?? A receding hairline?? I'm glad I finally have a solid excuse not to come here again.  Our team has now found a happy home down the street at the Gold Cane.
author: Adelina A.

description:
I love this bar.. not because its walking distance from my place and I can stumble to and fro.. just because it has tons of personality, a great staff, awesome punch (order the house punch with a floater (what I always get for my friends when they come for the first time)), and at times amazing amazing music (pending on who is DJing with their IPOD.  

They also allow food to be delivered/or brought in from outside of the bar.  :) :) A+ + + +
author: Sonam G.

description:
Great place. Great drink selection/beer selection, nice bartenders, and most importantly, it's spacious, unlike my beloved Lower Haight watering holes. 

There's always lots of people here, which is nice, because then you have lots of people you can meet, but you never feel crowded here.

I've heard from friends that the punch is too sugary, but I never get it, and I only review what I get.
author: Mark A.

description:
punch bowls. 

i don't even know anything else about this place but that. 

but that in itself gives this place four stars. 

just do it. enough said. listen to me now. you'll thank me lata. if you remember...
author: Anna C.

description: Looking forward to going here again.  Loved the bloody mary bar!
author: Angela R.

description:
I am reminded of the Pirates of the Caribbean song when I venture to this bar

Yo ho, yo ho, a pirate's life for me.
blah blah blah
Drink up me 'earties, yo ho. 

Maybe it's the rum, maybe it's the random scallawags at the bar, or maybe it's because I'm so drunk I have the urge to rape and pillage (but, you know, really not do those things at all). Regardless, this bar is a good time.

****WARNING****
One of the bartenders overcharges credit cards. Mine was only a couple dollars, so you may not notice it. But that's crazy shady.
author: Ali L.

description: Now I come the Haight for the food and the shopping. Hobson's Choice was the first place I went to the bar in 3 in the after noon. I don't usually drink at this time because it was wan't happy hour. The place is chill and has a retro feel of the way San Francisco used to look. The drinks were ok. The food was coming from another place. And their punch bowl. It wasn't I was expected but damn, plenty of punch there.
author: Matt B.

description: Punch!!!! Punch punch punch! Try it, you must. You have to! The only reason why it doesn't get 5 stars is because I live too far away from it and that's a problem! The bartenders are really cool and nice. Clientele is usually a bit older. More of the business crowd, at least that's what I've noticed. I hate being surrounded by youngsters who ran to the bar right after class got out, and this place is pretty safe from them! Get there early because it can get crowded fast!
author: Alariza N.

description: Super chill lounge, plenty of space, fun environment, a great selection of brew and a beautifuly delicious group friendly punch bowl . Definitely going back.
author: Laura W.

description:
Apparently I've been passing up a gem on Haight for 6 months now. I can't remember why but I think someone told me it was "dirty". 

Well - I went in last night to meet someone for an extra naughty martini, and it was a great little place. Didn't spend too much time there so I can't review the 'tenders or say if they have darts or pool or pinball, but it was a lovely place to have a drink at 8pm on a Friday on Haight.
author: Katie D.

description: Nice staff. Stiff drinks. Smelly basement. We sat in the back area where there were a few tables and chairs and bench seating. It is a small area and people are constantly coming and going from the stairs to the upper level. I guess in addition to their variety of rums, they also have punch that you can buy by the bowl.
author: Andrew Y.

description:
Thursday nights are great at Hobson's.  Doc is on call and mixing up some wicked drinks.  Ask her to surprise you with a tasty beverage and she won't disappoint.  

The Victorian punch is outstanding... however if you have too many of them you won't be standing for very long.

Food from Asqew is a bonus since they'll walk it over to you.  No reason to get up from the bar except visit the loo.
author: Mario C.

description:
This is the place to go for making mistakes.

Every time I've gone two things have happened. I have mysteriously lost money and I have stepped out of the bar plastered and wondering what the hell just happened. 

They're job is getting you drunk around a lot random people you don't know and letting things ride. They do this very well. 

For me hobson's is like the giant hot-fudge sundae of going out drinking. This is where you forget about the consequences and go all out. 

I hardly ever do it but when I do it's fun and I have good stories.
author: Alex O.

description:
Some of my favorite bartenders in the city. Kyle is reason enough to go. Seriously.

However if you need some additional incentive they have very tasty punch. But be warned... while it may go down as easily as juice, the stuff is seriously potent. Take things slow.
author: Taylor E.

description:
When I tell you that I'll meet you at Hobson's in a minute I really do mean it cos that's how close to my apartment it is. Very handy when you are definitely too drunk to make it home by bus or cab...and that's what tends to happen when I drink Victorian Punch. 

I like this place, the floor can be sticky but during the day you can order food from Asquew without even having to leave your drink.
