They definitely could do with more seats, but the bathroom always seems to be clean (at least the womans is). 

I had to take off one star because once they wouldn't let me in. I had recently had my purse stolen so both my ID and my passport were gone, so my only form of ID with my birthday on it was my greencard, which is apparently not a valid form of ID. That makes no sense.
author: Laura D.

description:
I seem to have amnesia when it comes to this place. 

I always forget something about it-whether it be the name, the fact that there's an upstairs, what the cross street is....you get the picture. 

Still though this bar makes me chuckle to myself. For starters if you are a rum drinker, this is your bar. There are over a hundred types here. However last time I was in and asked the bartender for Coyopa he looked at me funny and explained that he had just started and didn't think they carried it. (It's not like it's a difficult bottle to spot out--the bottle itself plays Calypso music and lights up people dancing) Still it is a full bar and they make other concoctions. Their Bloody Marys get about a 6 on the Veronica scale, which by all accounts is promising. Most of the cocktails are on the lower end of the financial spectrum so that's good news to my wallet plus they have an ok happy hour.

Recently, they updated some of their furniture which I actually found disorientating. However, they still have that funky Victorian feel to the bar so that's reassuring. They have an old school table top Ms. PacMan for 50 cents a play and that makes me happy. Also apparently, you can bring your dog in with you because I've seen more than one four legged friend in here. They do take credit cards but it has a $20 minimum. 

I know my honey will see this review and suggest we take one of our partners in crime here. That's fine babe, but you get to carry Gurv the Perv home.
author: Veronica G.

description: Bloody Mary Bar on Sundays.... corner windows... people watching on Haight street.... nuff said
author: Geronimo K.

description:
I don't even have to carpool to a barstool here because it's right up the block from the place where I usually pass out, aka my bedroom floor. The crowd here is pretty ambiguous with no labels or pretense & everyone here seems to be hittin' the sauce pretty hard which makes me feel alright about my own tendancies. Find me here pickled-drunk & swimming in my own BOWL of Victorian Rum Punch...No you can't have any, get your own bowl ya stinkin' lush...arghhhhh!  

At closing time all I have to do is walk out onto Haight St., lay down on one side, roll downhill, and voila...I'm right at my doorstep!
author: NaN K.

description:
"I don't know Hobson, but I know his choice would be Fernet-- and the bartenders are more than happy to join in on the toast. Ordering Fernet here is like choosing the red pill amongst all the blues.

Love the bartenders, love that if you hang out, drinks flow on the house, love that it's the one place I feel relaxed amongst the Upper Haight bars."
author: Chelsea B.

description:
I spent most of my St. Patrick's day here...enjoying the punch, yet all the while wondering why exactly they had punch. Not until the next day, when I passed Hobson's Choice in a rather...err...sober...state, did I read the "Victorian Punch House" description on the window. It all came together for me.

Honestly, one of the better nights I've spent in SF out drinkin' in the bars thus far. It could be that I ran into just about everyone I know in SF there on that day, all in celebration of the shamrock when the Irish pubs had lost their luster. 

Yummy punch - try the coconut/cranberry if they have it!
author: Angela N.

description:
You know what?  I am a sucker for anything old-timey looking.  I am not ashamed to admit this, and truth be told, I like this about myself.

This is a veritable oasis in the Haight-- it comes at just the right time, too-- Just when you've had your fill of wading through all the vacationing gutterpunks, doe-eyed tourists, neo-hippies, high school wastrels, hipsters, and buskers with sitars, it appears! 

It's got this sort of New Orleans thing going on inside that comes through in some elaborate window trim, furniture, wallpaper and chandeliers.  It gives this vibe that tells you, "Hey! So what if it's 2 o'clock in the afternoon?  Have another beer!" 

Maybe it's because it gets a lot of natural light.

Either way, aside from a fun beerlist, they make a killer bloody mary and a very nice hot toddie, which is my drink of chioce on a windy afternoon in the Upper Haight.

No exactly the classiest, cleanest establishment-- but you know what?  Eff you.  It's really fun to be there.
author: Laura F.

description:
ABSOLUTELY LOVE their Victorian Punch !!

Go during happy hour!!! Cheap beer, cheap punch!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: G G.

description:
I love this place. I hate the bartenders who asked for my ID every single time i ordered my drink...after of few (or maybe more than a few) house punches I don't even remember if I was ever issued one of those California id cards...and they ask me for one.

Great atmosphere, lots of travelers...what else do I need? Relaxed crowd..exactly how I like it. 

PS: Take the Pink punch, much better than the orange one.
author: Katja S.

description:
This is a very chill place to enjoy some good punch. It also works well as a starter bar. 
One word of advice, keep an eye on your drink. An unattended glass gets swiped up really quick by the barbacks.
author: Stacy F.

description:
Punch Bowl = Head Ache 

The first time I went here was with a group of friends and we shared a punch bowl. What an excellent way to get a hang over. I didn't care it was so good! The bar also had ample seating, we had 7 people with us and were all found a seat together, on a Friday. They get an extra bonus for having a ton of rum from all over the world. They offered a ton of tiki drinks too and if you know me you'll know that any bar with a tiki drink if a friend in my book.
author: Sharon M.

description:
Happy hour might be cheap, but it isn't a cheap place to drink really... a mojito (which was delicious, but light on the alcohol) was 8 bucks...

It's always too loud in here so you can't talk much and the bathrooms are terrible (or...at least, the ladies room is...I can't speak for the men's room)

On the positive, I've seen them allow a leashed (large breed) dog into the establishment...so kudos to them for that!
author: laura i.

description:
A friend suggested going here since we were showing around a couple friends from Australia and England.  She's been here before and said it was a chill place with good Bloody Marys.  

So we go on a Sunday night and it was surprisingly busy in there.  There was a pretty diverse crowd.  Our friend from down under was getting hit on by this gay guy so I had to save him by pretending I was his fiance.  That was funny.  Hmm, what else? Music was good.  The Bloody Marys weren't great.  At all.  Apparently they gave us a bad batch.  Oh well.  I'd give this place another shot.
author: Jillian J.

description: Wow the drinks were fAntastic!! CAme here with my babe And order victorian punch.. The house punch was delicious.. Bartenders were quite attentive. Cool dive bar to dive in sweet sugar drinks.. Its worth it!!! But the hang over!!! Whoa going to feel it the next day..
author: Stephanie Cindy C.

description: They are known for their rum punches served in a big ole punch bowl....which I didn't get because it was the holidays & I was feeling festive I decided to go with the egg nog special.  It was quite tasty.  I did have a taste of their rum punch & it was pretty good too.  Never noticed this place before it's on the corner in Haight which gives you good people watching views.  Definitely want to hit this place back up.
author: Natacha M.

description: Cool bartenders. Strong drinks. Interesting and comfortable vibe.
author: Andrew K.

description:
5 of us sat right down at 8pm on a Thursday - worth 4 stars ANYWHERE.  I hadn't been here since 2000; I remembered it being much more sceney.  I like it better now.  Chill and neighborhoodsy.

It does have a sour, humid beer stench to it, though.  Otherwise would have been 5 stars.
author: Matt S.

description:
This is a fun place to hang with your friends, people watch on the Haight, and easy enough to step outside for that special smoke cravin' that hits from time to time.  Lively crowd.

You can order from the bar menu (restaurant next door) but don't expect quick service on food orders (helps to phone in your "tip" for faster delivery).
author: Jim W.

description:
A solid choice if you like rum. And want to try the special punch.

Dark, busy bar, but since they're so well known for the rum, good idea to try to come here at least once! My boyfriend and his friend got the punch, another friend got a rum and coke, and I had a Malibu rum. My drink was delicious and strong. The punch was also very delicious, tropical and tangy. 

No guy at the door, and easy to get drinks early Saturday afternoon/evening!
author: Katherine P.

description:
If you're familiar with my reviews, you might detect a *faint* amount of snobbery toward Haight street institutions.  I grew up in San Francisco and attended high school right around the corner from Haight/Ashbury, so I have a very low tolerance for the following qualities that seem to pervade the Haight: high prices, cheesiness/touristyness, bad/rude service, general insincerity/inauthenticity (is that a word?).

The only times I've been to Hobson's, I was there with a large group of middle school teachers.  We ordered one of those gigantic punch bowls and sat upstairs, talking sh#t about the kids (not really, but we did spend a lot of time talking about certain students).  It was great fun, and nice to have our own little corner of the place.  Hobson's does not have the usual nasty qualities of the Haight, and is the kind of place a bunch of exhausted educators can go on a Friday evening after work to get silly and sauced.
author: Emma K.

description:
Pretty cool Irish bar....the punchbowl is dangerous and will get you pretty tanked quickly, so make sure you don't drive there.

There aren't enough seats in this bar though, so sometimes that's not too great.  Overall, a fun neighborhood bar.
author: Aaron M.

description:
I only go on off hours... weeknights, too late, or Sunday middays, so the crowd never seems off to me.  The punch is fun, the deal with Asqew is MARKEDLY convenient, and the vibe is perfect.  Very hip and cool, but way too classic, old, and small to be the aforementioned two.

The barkeeps are a class act, and don't even flinch when you take over the jukebox for four hours.  Yes, four hours.  It is one of those web based ones, so I could find almost everything you could hope for, and me and my buddy illicitly dj'd that place for an entire Sunday shift.

I don't hit bars often.  When I think of hitting one, I think of Hobson's.  It is a great institution for the Haight, and the city.
author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.

description:
Met here for the last day of one of my favorite co-workers, so it was a bittersweet occasion.  All-in-all a very run of the mill place.  Beer came in smaller-than-pint mugs (that were like mini-steins and fun to drink out of).  But they came at pint prices.  The only other thing to set this place apart was a bunch of different rum-punches in bowls behind the bar, and a variety of exotic rums.

There was a nice upstairs area with dirty couches and tables, but it was great because there were about 20 of us, and we slowly monopolized the whole upstairs as tables opened up, so maybe this is a good place for your next big group outing.

There was an upstairs emergency exit that people were sneaking through.  One of my co-workers thought the door went to Narnia, but I'm pretty sure it went to a roof where people smoke pot!

Fun place, but I wouldn't make a special trip.  Maybe I should try the rum punch next time and I'll give it an extra star.
author: Rocco B.

description:
I like to come here when I'm in a rum mood.  You can order Asqew at the bar and they bring it to you from next door.  And the nachos are some of the best I've had in the city (introduced to me by none other than Nacho.)

One thing though...if you plan on visiting, make sure you have your papers.  Boy are they on top of that whole 'lemme see some ID' thing.  A lot of friends have been turned away for having old passport photos, expired licenses, etc here.
author: Neej M.

description:
I love this place because it reminds me of my living room if I was still  in college and had a full bar in my house.  Except I'm not in college anymore.  Nevertheless though the crowd is mixed with college kids, just got out of college kids and late 20s, early 30s professionals, everyone there was having a great time (well except for a trio of kids sitting on a couch on the path to the upstairs, frowning at everyone but it was obvious they weren't drinking enough.  Who frowns at a bar when there is alcohol flowing?)  

The downstairs has the bar, some sit down video games, couches and seats and a jukebox.  Upstairs is a balcony overlooking the downstairs, another video game, couches, and a round table for a group of people to sit and chat and drink.  

The specialty of the place is the rum punch.  The specialty is the rum in general.  They have the house punch and also the newer version, I think it was the Victorian punch.  Either way, both were good, but then again I love fruity drinks.  For the 3 of us we had 7 beers, and 2 punches before we left, and the tab was only $40.  Cheap drinks, no wonder so many college kids were there.  

It is a fun atmosphere, lots of people having fun, drinking and hanging out.  For a Friday, it was packed, slightly nuts to butts but not too bad.  I've been in more crowded bars.  As were were leaving though a gaggle of college girls came in which is fine and dandy for the college boys and men that like college girls but for me that was the perfect time to leave and check out another bar.  

So if you're looking for a good selection of rums and college girls this is definitely your place.  If you're looking for cheap drinks and a cozy place to hang out this is also your place.  

I would come back anytime before it gets too crowded, for drinking maybe between 8-midnight......then it gets so crowded you can't move and it's not as fun.

Updated 2/11/2008
Came on a Sunday after brunch in the Haight, and this was the perfect place to sit down at a table, get some skewers from Asquew Grill (long wait though) , have some drinks and people watch.  Also FYI, you can bring dogs in apparently during the day, as there were 6 dogs running around all afternoon.  They were all amazingly well behaved though.  Great music, not crowded, good drinks and even better people watching, how could you not like the place?
author: Denise B.

description:
Hobson's provides its patron with the three cradinal needs of a constant bar-goer:

1. BOWLS, yes, BOWLS of brightly colored punch with bountiful fruit garnish yet questionable alchohol content.
2. Miss Pac Man
3. A cozy, inviting atmosphere complete with hot foreign bartender/bouncer with long hair.

Prices are good, music is good,  and if you can get a choice seat by the window on Haight street- people watching is unbeatable.

Minus one star for slow service.  Sorry hot, foreign bartender.
author: Brooke M.

description:
Punch bowls? I was pleasantly surprised at this interesting way to differentiate this bar from the rest.  I had the tropical mango flavored house punch bowl (about $20 + tax???) and the red punch bowl that tasted like cherries with malibu ($30).  There are about 15 drinks in each bowl so it is really worth it.  I'm all about the communal method of serving (like a pitcher) because you don't have to go through the time wasting process of ordering every single drink, waiting, deciding, paying, tipping, etc.  The punch tastes like a sugary, diabetic future hangover, but I felt fine this morning.
     They also serve food... or at least had us order it from next door and had it delivered.  Had some good BBQ chicken nachos to go with the punch.  They also have dice and cards that you can borrow to play games as well as good seating areas.
author: Joey S.

description:
Excellent spot. Excellent bartenders. Excellent continuation of a night begun at Cha Cha Cha's. I had 2 local friends tell me it was the best bar in the Haight area. I might be convinced, I just haven't tried enough of em to know!

Major kudos to the bartender who kept making sure only my friends were putting their drinks on my tab...considering how trashed I was by the end of the night, I think I thought everyone was my friend, but I digress.

Definitely a spot I would hit up...especially with that swizz Thai place right by here for dinner beforehand!
author: Irene F.

description:
I think Hobson's Choice is the first bar I ever went to in SF. It was pretty memorable. Scorpion bowls and mojitos. Hmm...they also have pretty good music. 

This place really fits the Haight. Not pretentious. Very chill. Good people. 

Other memorable times: 
-Meeting up here with a guy I didn't care to date and it was only bc I got stuck with him the night before. 
-St. Patrick's Day. My gf from LA threw up in one of the couches and it wasn't even midnight yet. That was a good night. We eventually got thrown out of a cab.
-Haight Street Fair. Meeting a guy who bought the guy I was with a drink, and NOT ME and ends up asking for my name...and then saying that he thought my name was Hottie...where's my drink, dude?
author: Kris O.

description:
I love this place.  Its a very great local bar with a mix of clientele and a great selection of drinks.  Although every time i go i usually get the punch and a beer.  A couple of those and I'm good for the night.

The punch is seriously really good.  Its a mixture they make and it comes in 2 colors.  Orange and red.  I usually order by the color.  Not sure if there's a name for it.  

The bartenders are all pretty friendly, and there's a jukebox there so when you feel like having a karaoke night, just pick your song, and go for it.

Really laid back atmosphere, and while the couches need some upholstering, i still would come here just to knock back a few and relax.
author: Terence P.

description:
We went to happy hour last night at Hobson's and had a great experience. Doc was attentive and timely! Thanks for redeeming yourself Hobson's! 

Hobson's didn't get a 5 star review from me because the music was too loud...I go to happy hour to catch up wtih friends and the music made that a bit difficult (but thanks for broadcasting the Giants game!)
author: Alisa S.

description: Wow I'm a fan!! The punch bowls and the variety of mixed drinks is what I liked most. It's a pretty chill atmosphere. In our area, one dude was reading a book with his dog at his feet, in another corner a group of people were watching a game on t.v. My group....we were the loud drunks taking pictures and trying every flavor of the punches before 7p.m. rolled around. Mission accomplished. $2.50 house punches during happy hour...you add that up with the parade that is Haight St. and this place is right on the money.
author: Greg J.

description: Kind of overpriced. Drinks and beers are served in small glasses. The vibe inside is cool like your kookie grandma's old Victorian parlor. Nice to chill for a beverage but I usually get bored after one. Music can be so-so at times.
author: Steven H.

description: Preface: this is a great bar!!!! But it was sad what I witnessed on Sunday, April 17, 2016. I saw these two super drunk girls verbally assaulting a patron and one of them even threw a pen at the bartender, he kicked them out but the most vitriolic one came back in and began severely harassing and again verbally assaulting the patron--the patron seemed unfazed and sober and had a couple of friends around her trying to deter her from the verbal assault by the visibly drunk girl--(who was being the most hateful person I have ever seen in a bar) but the grey haired bartender would not kick her out b/c the regulars said he wants to eat her ass so bad his head is about to explode. If the owner/s (not sure if it is a man or woman, I've heard it changed hands recently) would be cool with this..... Otherwise, i am going to stay away for a while. The two drunk women ultimately cleared out the entire bar, I saw at least 25 people walk out as all this progressed over about 30 minutes of screaming from these two girls! The patron that was assaulted finally just gave up and left after the girl continued to scream at her. I think that was a terrible dis-service to the owner/s, because, like I said, this is an amazingly fun place.
author: B F.

description: My husband is a true rum lover. He is active duty US Coast Guard and often frequents South America bringing home a variety of rums he's found on his trip. So for his birthday I decided I'd take him to HC for a rum tasting (which they traditionally don't do)  & he & I loved it! Chris, the manager was more accommodating than I could have ever imagined. The bar was packed, but he found us two seats at the bar and gave Ryan a full tour, explaining the notes, flavors and origins of each rum. His friendly demeanor and contagious laugh made us feel right at home.  I highly recommend HC for your rum needs. The atmosphere was friendly and the energy was bright. We will absolutely be returning!
author: Shanelle M.

description:
Punch anyone?

I've been there on a sleepy afternoon for punch to brighten my day, and a rowdy Friday night. It's not the cleanest place and there are no mirrors in the bathroom. But that's not important. The punch is amazing: Strong, cheap, and slurp-able.
author: Halley B.

description: I'm a beer girl, but for a bowl of their yummy punch I convert when I enter Hobsons.  and man o man does that punch creep up.  Super friendly service.  We can always find a cozy table here.  Love love LOVE it.
author: Dina P.

description:
Oh, I like the punch. 

I'll even drink a couple glasses mid-day when shopping the Haight. 

Oh, I like the punch.
author: Jessica D.

description:
Really fun neighborhood bar. I love meeting here for drinks after work. They have a decent selection of beer as well as a number of specialty rum drinks. Their infused rum is Very Tasty. They also serve a couple of different rum punches, both of which are pretty good if you're in a fruity sort of mood.

Bonus: Askew Grill is right next door and food can be ordered from them and brought over into the bar. Tasty!
author: Margo M.

description:
Who says you can't get your drunk on at 11am.

We do and if you don't that ain't cool.Don't harass us about it either.

This place is cool,very cool.I like the vibe when I go here also.
author: Dani D.

description:
there's nothing special about hobson's choice, and that's exactly what i like about it.

basically your epitome of a great neighborhood bar. except it's located on the world famous haight street in san francisco.

regardless, i like this place.
author: Ameer N.

description:
I had such a good time at this place.  Came here on a sunny Sunday in the city and enjoyed a few beers and gave their award-winning Bloody Mary a try.  It was pretty tasty - a well deserved award.  It was a good mix of people and everyone was actually choosing good tracks on the juke box - tons of old school hip hop.  The BF and I dared to try the "Sunday Industrial Special" shots - huge mistake!  It was by far the nastiest shot I've ever had.  Left you with an Absinthe aftertaste, ick!  

The characters you meet there are also amazing.  This guy was obviously hammered blabbing to us about his band the whole time and about how he swears he just gave Quentin Tarantino a copy of his band's cd just minutes before at Kan Zaman.  He finally left and guess what... he came prancing back in an hour later to look for his keys.  He then went on to tell us that his dad was coming to pick him up (he was at least 37 years old).  Hahaha good times at Hobson's!  Oh and the drink prices are veeeerrry reasonable.
author: Melissa P.

description:
What a great bar. This was the first bar we hit when I was on vacation in SF for Outside Lands Festival last week. The friend we were staying with lives within walking distance of this place. Well, on second thought, I guess just about anywhere in SF would be "walking distance" haha.

Anyway, really nice bar. A lot different from what I'm used to at home in OC.

Thanks for the drinks, Doc!
author: Randall T.

description:
I may be biased because I live walking distance but I love Hobson's! I usually never touch fruity drinks but I love their homebrewed concoctions. Especially the bermuda triangle.

One definite plus here is that you can order food directly at the bar from neighboring Askew Grill. I'm a huge Askew fan so I'm never mad at that convenience factor.
author: Danielle M.

description:
Went here with some girlfriends on a night out in the city. It's pretty close to my friend's apartment so we thought we'd check it out in between dinner and dancing for the night.

They are famous for their punches, and I swear the Victorian Punch was made with me in mind! Pretty much my favorite things mixed together in one drink. It was so good I was sure there wasn't any alcohol in it. (Trust me though, there was.) The drinks were decently priced (especially for SF) and I hear their Happy Hour is awesome.

Plus, it was a fun atmosphere! I would absolutely go back.
author: Madeline K.

description: Cool, unpretentious bar. Good beers on tap. My go to spot on the Haight
author: Lee S.

description: This review is purely based on the bartender who worked on Sunday, July 17, the day of the women's world cup.  I was with my husband and we were meeting a friend for bloody mary's and to watch the game. While we were waiting he literally started yelling at this family who wandered in there to catch the score of the game with their 2 10-year old kids, that "KIDS ARE NOT ALLOWED IN THE BAR, MAAM."  I thought that was weird that he got so nasty with them but understood kids weren't allowed. Then it was my turn:   We waited patiently for a seat to open up in the bar.  When 2 stools opened we stepped up to sit down and order drinks.  I, being obviously pregnant (and showing) didn't have my ID, nor did I intend on ordering a drink. He basically started yelling at us, much like he did the other family.  I understand the law but this guy was just an a-hole. No other word for him.  He could have presented his "rules" in a different way. I will never ever effing ever return to this bar.  Any owner of an establishment who keeps a guy around who acts like that won't get my $.  Looks like other yelpers have a problem with their staff too.  Check the reviews.
author: Andrea R.

description: My favorite rum bar in the whole world (so far). Clay makes the best zombie ever. Ask about rum, take a chance to learn and taste new things. And the punch is always great.
author: Lorrie K.

description:
Great little bar in the middle of the Haight.  Perfect when you just feel like chilling with some friends on some sofas.  The upstairs part is cute.  I once got very drunk here on free kaluha shots.  Yes, I am a dork.

Also has the hottest bartender around - ask for Laith.
author: Joanna S.

description:
Hobson's is my favorite bar in the Haight.  I've never been there when it's too crowded, and it's a great place to go with a group of friends.  The beer selection is good, with Delirium Tremens in bottles.  The liquor selection is decent as well and they even have Fernet, which my friends always want when they go to Hobson's (personally, I hate the stuff).

Hobson's also has old-school video games, which is amazing-  I've played Pac-Man many a night.  So, if you're in the Haight and want a laid-back but fun place that is always a good time, look no further than Hobson's Choice.
author: Jessica C.

description:
So not my type of place, but I really liked it here! Great place to start the night, and a welcome change from the faggy place I reluctantly end up at on Saturdays. I felt so butch!! Hahhaha.

Me and like 30 others ransacked this place at 9pm or so, and this place went from quiety dive to overzealous drunks upstairs on the balcony. We had 2 bowls of punch and it liquored everyone up pretty well. It looked like they just dumped 2 bottles of Kool-aid in there and doused in with rum, hell it tasted good and did the trick so who am I to complain??
author: Rocky K.

description:
We came here on a whim while RUNNING as fast as we could away from Milk. 

Minus one star for the groups of girls who were trying to take away the guy that I was mkaing out with. PS...if you ARE the guy I was making out with outside against the window -- please write. 

From what I remember -- cozy place. Good drinks. Friendly customers. Especially friendly when my cousin grabs the closest guy next to her on the way out the door and sticks her tongue down his throat. Oh and nice bouncers who let us sit on their stool.

Am deifnitely planning a re-visit. Make-out boy:: be there!
author: Amanda K.

description: Laith is an awesome bartender!!!! There is also an awesome Tha inoodle place down the street when you're hungry after drinking. Their punches are super yummy!
author: M S.

description: Those punch bowls are killer.  And they're a pretty good deal.  The place itself is definitely divey and nothing out of the ordinary but it's a great place to catch up and get schwasted with your friends.  I went on a week night so it was not crowded at all.  I imagine it must be popular on weekends though (no idea, just a guess.)  They had stopped serving food when we arrived but were cool enough to let us bring in pizza.  We did feel bad (and awkward) though when the Haight-Ashbury "locals" watched us like hawks right outside the window as we ate......
author: Justine L.

description:
So I went here to meet a friend who lives in NOPA who was showing his sister around the Haight and he wanted a beer....I just wanted a place with a TV so I could see the Giants in extra innings.

Luckily, we found both here! I liked the tiny little upstairs area, where the 5 of us had it all to ourselves, with a little mini-tv to boot! My friend Kathy had some of the rum-punch that they serve out the bowl...apparently, that does the trick! She only had one and had a pretty good buzz going, and some people who had more that one got down right sloppy... Newcastle Pints in the bottle, but that was good enough for me....

Overall, a cozy little place to meet up with some friends...kinda small, so unless the upstairs or little back room is open, might want to try some where else on the Haight...but I'd go back sometime.
author: Matthew S.

description:
I wouldn't plan an evening around Hobson's Choice.  But, if I found myself in this joint later at night, I certainly wouldn't complain.  

Misc. couches are cool, as are multiple levels, but the biggest strength of this place (along with a few others on Haight Street) is the general camaraderie between patrons and staff alike.

Update, 1/13/08:  I increase the rating (from four stars), because I spent all day Saturday at Hobson's, drinking and watching football, and my tab was intentionally undercharged by about $30-40.  These bartenders know how to make you an addict.
author: Sam M.

description:
Hobson's Choice was my choice on a warm afternoon while ducking panhandlers on Haight Street.  One girl in Tina Fey (Sarah Palin?) glasses asked for a dollar and then claimed "my mom would gave her a dollar".  I had to laugh at that but I didn't appreciate her talking about my mom.  So I was thirsty and the Victorian Punch House seemed like the way to go.

I had been in here before, but somehow missed the three punch bowls serving as the centerpiece of the back bar.  Yellow, red Tahitian Treat-looking and orange with glasses of garnishes at the ready.  I was driving, so no punch for me.  But I can see how those punch bowls could be a lot of fun.  

Started up with an Anchor and then followed it up with a Leinenkugel Sunset Wheat that had the juiciest orange wedge I have seen since rec league soccer.  Someone is taking their produce seriously over at Hobson's Choice, 

Friendly barkeep chatting up the locals while taking care of business in what became a somewhat busy bar despite the early hour.  All in all, a pleasant hour spent soundtracked by some Big Daddy Kane and lots of 70's soul on the house stereo mix.
author: Johnny C.

description: Great local Haight dive.  Friendly staff and pretty cheap drinks with plenty of locals to chat your ear off.  My favorite thing is that they let me bring my pup in during the week.  Love the dog friendly SF places!
author: Doxie M.

description:
So this place gets one star for being a lively bar in the Upper Haight and another star for good music, but thats about it. No more stars!!!

I have come here a couple of times as I previously lived in the Haight and each time did not enjoy it at all. The first time I was here, I asked for the following "May I have a jack and coke" and the bartender stared at me as if I had insulted her mothers poodle and blurted "you need to say PLEASE, you understand?". I was a bit stunned because I was pretty polite to begin with and after a long day of fighting the politics of a dumb large tech company, I was just trying to chill out. She served my drink, I gulped it and left to the Gold Cane. The other times I have been here have not not been pleasant either. If you come at the wrong time the people who come here can be somewhat douchebaggie as well.

All in all, save your money and patience go to the Gold Cane (outside patio) or Aub Zam Zam both are solid choices with stiff drinks, friendly bartenders and a good mix of people with never any drama.
author: Fabian O.

description:
i was put off by this place at first. a group of patrons who were already dining here pretended to be bouncers & checked our IDs before we were able to get inside.  after the patrons got their laughs at our expense & watching the whole thing go down, the bartender FINALLY stepped in & stopped the shenanigans.  but all was forgotten once we ordered our drinks.

first round, we (7 total in our party) ordered the house punch.  this concoction was a mixture of silver rum, mango, orange, & pineapple juices with a handful of cherries added for extra garnish.  my rum is usually mixed with coke when i drink it, but this punch was on point.  we could hardly taste the alcohol & the juices werent too sweet to drink.  each person probably got 3 highball glasses worth of drinks.

second round, we ordered the victorian punch - silver rum, coconut rum, pineapple rum, with cranberry & pineapple juices.  this punch wasn't as good to me, maybe because im not a big fan of cranberry juice in any of my alcoholic drinks.

after both bowls of punches were knocked out, everyone was on a good one! we thought, briefly, about going for the hat trick, but decided against it.  the punches had done their jobs.

overall, service was just ok. we requested to have one of the channels on the tv changed, but this never happened.  the music was great - i dont know if thats credit to the bar for having the jukebox or the people who selected the songs.  regardless, i've always wondered what it would feel like drinking at one of those bars that has that "Cheers"-feel to it, & Hobson's Choice allowed me to have that experience!
author: Ric A.

description: This doesn't look like a neighborhood bar. It looks like a tourist trap. But it's not a tourist trap, though tourists would be wise to check it out--it's very unique.  It is becoming my go-to neighborhood bar where, despite the many rums and punches offered, I sit and enjoy a beer. The bartenders are great. The wait staff is helpful. Now, if you are in the mood for something a little special, there's nothing more social than sharing a punch bowl with friends. Here's a tip: get some samples before you order a whole bowl--the three standard ones they have are quite different. Also, consider reserving the upstairs for your group.
author: Megan M.

description:
We came to check this place out on a particularly hot day in the city, and got suckered in my the multitude of fruity rum drinks. I ordered a Blue Hawaiian, Top Shelf Margarita, Victorian Punch, and something else with lots of flavored rums (which is the house specialty). All great beverages for a hot day, but the punch packs more punch (pun intended) than you might guess and I was pleasantly buzzed off just a few drinks.

The staff seemed to be okay, but I'll admit my entire interaction with them was brief. If I could complain about anything, it's that the bar was shortstaffed (there were three bartenders when arrived, but despite the crowd, two of them left or stopped working the bar) and getting a drink took longer than it should have.

The furniture (old couches and such) had all seen better days, but we found a corner to congregate and enjoyed watching the people on the street through the large front windows. The crowd on Haight can be more entertaining than any show or music they might have considered.
author: Jere K.

description:
So...I used to really like hobsons.  Then I realized that the drinks are pretty weak (unless you know the bartender) and small for the price. 

I want to give Hobsons that look my parents used to give me when I f'd up.  Like you knew it was bad when they weren't even yelling, they were just giving you that LOOK.

Other than that I guess I would still stop in and grab a beer and people watch during the day if I was down there.
author: b s.

description:
One of my favorite bars in the city. Intimate, rusticy, cool atmosphere. LOVE the punch, and gin & tonics. bathrooms gross, take hand sanitizer, haha...
I could, and have, sit there all afternoon and drink. Its also a good place for drinks before seeing something at the red vic. good beer also, stella.
author: Lacey P.

description: hobsons is your standard touristy dive bar: could be better, could be worse. i lived right above this bar for 2 years, and didn't even go there while living 30 seconds away. there are other dive bars in the hood with the same flavor, less mean glares, better service (the amount of times i left without paying because the bartender not only forgot i was there, but aggressively ignored me...which i guess is a plus...), and better patrons. order beer by the bottle as the taps aren't always great. do NOT order the punch, unless you want a raging hangover within mere minutes of consumption.
author: Chelsea C.

description:
My caveat is that I've only gone to Hobson's on Sunday to watch out-of-town football games ... but this place is great!

The owners (I've only met Greg and Mike) are extremely friendly and generous people.  Many times, I've seen Greg start conversations with random folks and then get them free drinks. This weekend, he even gave away Hobson's Choice T-shirts. 

The bar is unpretentious, but still offers a creative selection of beers and assorted mixed drinks -- especially their classic rum punches.

Gotta love a bar with a creative theme and friendly people!
author: Ron E.

description:
The word I had in my head while I was at this bar and the one that remains: weird. I just can't figure out what kind of a place this is. The music was upbeat and definitely varied. I heard Wham!, The Beach Boys and Bob Marley within a half hour. Nothing about this place seems coherent. The sitting area had incredibly comfy chair/couch items and the tiny upstairs loft looked promising for future ventures.

I'd return with a look on my face mixed between puzzled and happy.
author: Jay U.

description:
Good memories or Bad memories..

Cool place to  chill out with friends and drink.



However,my last time here I was already hammered ...stumbling from the other bar across the street. Pushing my way in with a friend to get more sloshed...Yes,I was feeling good at a certain point but my friend wanted to leave.

As we were leaving I spotted a cute guy who I said "hello" too. He actually pulled me back to him and I was like I have to go...Why on earth would I want to leave with her when I could have had some 
tipsy play time thingy going on with this cutie.

Where are you at now my dear?
author: Mattee M.

description:
hahaha, i'm reading all these negative reviews and i totally agree.  But I LOVE the Punch House.  Well, no I just really like it.  There's no ego in there, which I love.  Just do you!  My man says mostly chicks hang out there, which is funny because I've had so many instances with sketchy, scamming men.

Despite all the negative reviews, I'm totally comfortable there, i love the red walls and comfy seats, and i really enjoy the idea (and taste!) of the the punch. so there.
author: Hella M.

description:
bloody mary bar! punches! 90's hiphop via the bartender clay's ipod! beer! people watchin! smack talkin! football! FUN!
that said there are a few things that hobson's is missing:
a pool table
a dart board
frosted mugs for beer (id have to say this one is inexcusable)
still hobson's choice is one of my favorite bars and one of my favorite places to spend a sunday afternoon!
author: Miss T.

description: Good drinks and lots of space so it's easy to find a table. The only thing stopping this place from picking up that final elusive star is the bartenders feel they have the right to decide what does and does not go inside of a mojito. I assure you, one can make a mojito with Flor de Cana.
author: Sean K.

description: "Sundays only: Bloody Mary Bar!" was written on a sign outside of this lively bar.  Who knew so many people would be down to drink on a Sunday afternoon?  Upon further inquiry, the friendly bartender explained that you order any vodka you want and add whatever condiments you'd like:  there is premade house bloody mary mix or make your own with clamato or tomato- celery salt/pepper/garlic/garlic powder/tabasco/hot sauces/horseradish/ etc all provided.  Add your own: peppers/pickles/artichoke hearts/celery sticks/olives/onions.  I used to make my own bloody marys with Mr. T's bloody mary mix and olives, but this bloody mary bar put my bloody mary's to shame!  I ended up going with the house mix because it was darn good, in combination with my ketel one vodka ($7.50).  I sat down in the window seat with my boy and enjoyed the liveliness and my spicy drink.  Fantastic.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
i think this bar has the best music ever. in the 2 hours i was there, they never played a shitty song. good music and good drinks = best combination. 

today, i was DYING for any kind of happy hour so i came here just in time for discounted rum punches. why is punch called punch, anyway? i preferred the victorian punch over the house punch but they were both good. i wish happy hour lasted longer than 2 hours!!
author: kristin e.

description: came here during my first visit in haight and it was awesome. the bowls of punch behind are worth trying plus they're super cheap, especially during happy hour. a lot of old school hip hop and classic rock was playing so that was a plus too. i mean, i know this place is probably infested with hipsters but idgaf because i had a great time with friends here and this place is like the epitome of a perfect bar in my world. must come back soon.
author: Christina T.

description: i love coming here with a few friends, pitching in for a tub of punch and leaving with the worst stomach ache of my life.
author: Joseph N.

description: I love Hobson's specialty drinks.  So good!  The lemonade punch is especially addicting. And my favorite bartender works here.  He is smokin' ow ow and free shots rock!  The vibe is also always energetic and fun.
author: Justine D.

description: Hobson's Choice is a good times local bar in the Haight. I remember getting a drink there to calm my nerves before I interviewed at my nearby apartment. I have been a frequent visitor since, and I particularly enjoy their punch bowls. They like to make sure you have a minimum of 3 people to order it. I have gotten away with telling them that my other friend is "on his way". I wouldn't really recommend that - that ish is potent.
author: Lara C.

description: I met a group here for the Haight-Ashbury Fair. It wasn't yet noon, so I opted to not sample the Bloody Marys. I ordered a Mint Julep instead, in honor of my annual trip to the South. The bartender was friendly and professional. The seating area downstairs (I did not go upstairs) was spacious around the edges of the room, with plenty of room for standing and talking with friends.
author: Marcus M.

description: A fun place to waste an afternoon with friends. I love the rum punches, be careful, before you know it you've had way too many :)
author: Alex W.

description: Love the Sunday Bloody Bar and the punches are great too.  Ask for the dice and play liars dice!  If you lose you have to wear the dice cup on your head until the game is over.  We created that rule last time we were there.
author: Carrie H.

description: I had just gotten the most amazing tattoo and needed a place to rest my foot, when my Husband and I came a crossed Hobson's Choice. Mike the bartender was AWESOME...!!!  And the Punch was delicious...!!! A must visit if in the area...!!!
author: Wendy S.

description:
what the heck was in my drink? seriously. i am sitting here eating a cup o' noodles, watching The Ultimate Fighter, writing this review COMPLETELY HAMMERED.

anyways, that little fruity concoction was good and went down smooth. and for only $2.50 during happy hour? cant beat it. great atmosphere too. loved the dogs that were roaming around. the chicken that jessica couldnt finish(i think from across the street, but they deliver to the bar) was great and a large portion. i am totally a garbage disposal when it comes to food. 

great time. apparently no more libs in the near future, but let's do happy hour for sure. this is too much fun. but yeah, i think i was drugged tonight...
author: Andrew T.

description: I'm not a big fan of rum, so that may be biasing my review.  Hobson's Choice definitely favors the rum.  The bartenders are generally good, but can be asses when it gets busy.  This is definitely a bar that I favor during the less busy times and avoid when it is crowded, and I have to say that the buckets of punch are pretty weak.  Askew Grill will deliver food here though which is a bonus.
author: Quinn S.

description:
i just moved to lower haight. i gotta say, im pretty lucky to be so close to Hobsons! even tho the punchbowl gave me a hella hangover, it all paid off because i still had money in my wallet the next morning and the jams were poppin' off! 

pretty sure ill become a frequent flyer.
author: Jessica T.

description: I like this place. I've been here a few times with some friends and the big bowls of punch are perfect for sharing. I like that there's a small upstairs area big enough for groups to drink and chill. The atmosphere is nice and it's never been insanely packed when I've gone. It's in nice area with a bunch of other little shops and eateries around which is perfect for getting drunk-food. It's a nice place that's not hard to get to and has what you can expect from any normal bar in the city so I would definitely recommend going there with some friends to check it out.
author: Kathryn B.

description: I go by this place daily, and it's always intrigued me. Well, no more. Went last night. The first thing I noticed was the odor. Not sure what it was, mung, cleaning products? It was not pleasant.  I do dig the very worn comfy mismatched chairs. And seems like a good bar for the under 30's. What I didn't like was $17.50 for 2 drinks on HAIGHT St? Please! They do have my favorite vodka, Hanger One Kaffir Lime! Oh so yummy. Oh well, on to The Gold Cane!
author: C B.

description: I only had a sip of the orange rum punch, but it was delicious!  I love beer, however, so I had a pint of their summer wheat on tap.  It was perfect and served up in a funky, chilled Hobson's Choice mug which I love.  We got there around 1045 to get a drink before a midnight showing of 'The Room' at the Red Vic.  It was crowded and busy but all of the people were really happy and welcoming and I felt like I was at a friend's house party.  It was great.
author: Christie S.

description: I really like this place. Another gem in the Upper Haight. Happy hour is great-- cheap rum punch, 2 bucks! What's to complain about that?
author: Chantal H.

description: Pass the spiked punch please, but from the nice bartender, not the usual pretentious pricks that work here.
author: Christina S.

description: Since moving to the Haight, Hobson's Choice has become a staple of my bar-hopping experience (bar-hopping really isn't an appropriate term, because once i'm at hobson's, I normally don't leave).  The bartenders are always friendly and really do take care of the patrons who frequent this spot.  The juke box is a cool attraction, as you are able to play hard-to-find music.  I'm not a very adventurous drinker, as I stick to what I like, but I have heard many a drinker rave about the punch.  I will say that I prefer to go here during the week, as it gets pretty crowded on friday and saturday nights and I can't stand shuffling around in a bar to get a drink.  Overall, I love this place.
author: Jason F.

description: You could say Hobson's Choice is to rum as The Alembic is to bourbon.  Or you could say that rum is to bourbon as Hobson's Choice is to The Alembic.  You won't find any Churchill Downs meticulousness here, but rather a carefree, punchbowl-fueled sloshfest as good as any booze cruise (Ok ok, the punch is definitely higher-caliber than that.  But the music seriously belies their pretense of Victorian charm).  Though I must say, sitting on the balcony with the windows open during Friday's heat wave was easily the closest I've come to replicating the "Plantation Nights" Caribbean feel in SF (if only I'd worn my linen pants).  I think next time I'll skip the punch in favor of sampling their rum collection, worthy of any retired sea captain's cellar...now if only they would refine the atmosphere to match.
author: Wes M.

description: Great atmosphere and great specialty punch drinks! Grab a table upstairs with some friends and you WILL have an awesome night!
author: Mike L.

description: Hobson's Choice has a bit of a split personality. On one hand it's an old fashioned bar with chandeliers, Victorian fonts and a long wood bar, on the other hand it focuses on tropical drinks and sells t-shirts that say, "mojito?" or "zombie?". But it's this strange juxtaposition of classic San Francisco and island fever that makes it charming and relaxing, a great place to go for happy hour and to people watch from the cushioned window seats. And you can bring your dog!
author: Sara W.

description: Me likey a mixture of the two rum punches. Usually I shy away from mixed drinks due to inconsistency in alcohol content. However, I am always pretty happy after one of those bad boys. I am in favor of the "bring in your dog" policy at Hobson's. I also had a fleeting (we're talking hours) crush on the bartender that looks like a much less retarded and more granola version of Evan Marriott, the first Joe Millionaire. I think he said something like "welcome back, (mispronounced name)" when he carded me. Blew my mind to be remembered, or maybe he was just says that to every lush that walks in, assuming this is not her first or last visit to Hobson's. In any case, I like the riff raff that frequent this place. Wish they'd clean their bathrooms a little more, but they probably would say the same about me and my bathroom. Friends let stuff slide sometimes.
author: Bri B.

description: So my roommate dragged me out here to hang out with her girl friends but we got stood up since we were late. Nonetheless we grabbed a drink chilled and people watched. The place was busy on a friday night. Mainly a white crowd with very few asians but not to a point where you stand out. So we were alright, the drinks were reasonably priced. Plenty of street parking, the bar tenders were nice and the music wasn't anything to worth remembering. Good kick it spot but eventually she said lets get on out of here and go to skylark and get crunk.
author: Justin G.

description: one of my favorite happy hour spots.  their victorian punch is an absolute must try!
author: Kae B.

description: The nice thing about this place is that it really has a local feel about it.  You get a pretty eclectic crowd, but everyone gets along and I've never seen any drama.  It has a Victorian decor thing going on, but really looks like a hodge-podge of garage sale furniture; the plus side it that it's super comfy.  The staff is the best - attractive, edgy, but still nice.  Tip: get the a rum floater on your rum punch - I like the house punch.  Another tip: the punch is stronger than it tastes.
author: Ann W.

description: Met a couple friends here for happy hour. And was pleasantly surprised. $2.50 beers & other assorted drink specials. A five rum bar with all the makings for a fun time. We also ordered food from Asqew from the bar. It arrived quickly & tasty. A nicely executed symbiotic relationship. Two thumbs up.
author: Katharine R.

description: I have been here twice now.  I am very picky about the way a Bloody Mary is made and I love me some Bloody Mary's!   This DIY Bloody Mary Bar on Sundays is the perfect solution for my dilemma.  I think it's around $5 for the glass with ice and well vodka.  I suggest well vodka as all the flavors in a bloody mary completely overpower the taste of the liquor anyhow.  The fixings include a choice of tomato juice or clamato juice, or a pre-made bloody mary mix, various hot sauces / steak sauces / worsteshire sauce, garlic, limes, lemons, pickled artichoke hearts, pickled beets, pickled peppers, hearts of palm, olives, salts / peppers, celery stalks.  I proceed to fill up my glass with as much as possible....oh the deliciousness!  One word of caution...the first time I went here it was a female bartender and she was very skimpy on the bartender.  This past Sunday it was a black dude with tattoos and he poured a normal amount of vodka (thank you mr. bartender)!
author: Celeste G.

description:
This is the best rum bar in the city, boasting at least 5 XO rums that I know of, and have tried.  Lots of punch and fruity rum drinks for the ladies as well ;).  I used to go more regularly when the bartender Chance was there, but now the bartending staff is not as good.  He would make caipirinhas with well muddled limes.  And was generous with his pours of the XO rums... haha.
My favorite rums I had there (in order):
1) Mount Gay XO.  Easily as good as some single malts out there.  very complicated, smooth, not too sweet, and just tasty overall
2) Pyrat XO.  Really sweet and caramelly but gave me a nasty hangover the next day
3) Brugal XO.  Harsher than mount gay, but still good.
and I can't remember the names of the other two, but they just weren't as good.
4) Appleton Estate XO.  Not quite as smooth as the Mount Gay--it wasn't quite as complicated, and the finish was not quite as smooth and lasting.  But still not bad.
So they lose a star for music that's not my favorite, and because Chance isn't there to pour drinks for me anymore

UPDATE 6/24/06----------
Damn, there were a LOT of hotties here tonight.... wow.  Lots of birthday celebrations going on, but it was still quite cool.  So the last time I was here and got a caipirinha, the bartender Laith barely muddled the limes and passed it to me.  That was quite disappointing.  TONIGHT, I thought I'd chance it again, and Laith followed through with flying colors, making a perfectly muddled caipirinha.  I was impressed.  He also made me a "brain damage" aka "brain hemmorhage" aka "the abortion" despite him warning me about it...hahahaha, lots of girls were grossed out by it, but it was worth it.  Didn't taste too bad, except the texture....  The drink is a shot with peach schnapps poured in first, with baileys layered on top.  Then you dribble a little bit of grenadine right in the middle, forcing some of the baileys into the schnapps, which curdles the baileys.  The grenadine then sits at the bottom, looking a lot like blood.... yeah...totally awesome!  hahahaha  gross, but quite the spectacle.  Laith made it perfectly.  Hobson's is back up to 5 stars for me now.
.
author: Fong L.

description:
so loud that i can't have a real conversation.  i don't understand why all the girls want to go here.  it's loud and obnoxious and annoying but i'll put up with it for some girl.  and it's too loud.  potential hobson's exchange:

stef: hey gaus!  let's get out of here and go somewhere else!!!

arthur:  what?!?!!?!

stef:  this is like the upper haight's version of the marina!!!

arthur: what!?!?!?!?!  i can't hear you!!

stef :  let's go to another bar!!!

arthur :  you want another drink from the bar!?!?!

stef : another bar! 

arthur :  okay!!  i'll buy you another drink!!

stef :  no!  we'll get another drink at another bar!!!

arthur :  another gin and tonic coming your way!!!  (arthur turns and goes to the bar.)

stef :  no, wait--no!!  fuck.

arthur (twenty minutes later after finally getting the drink at the bar):  stef?  stef?!!?!?  where are you?

stef (by text message):  i'm at deluxe.
author: Stef A.

description:
this is my new favorite bar.

upon moving to the bay area in august... i had not had much luck with good bars. kitty's... yes i love it for reggae, bars in the Marina... IM SO GOOD. but can a girl just find a plain ol' good bar?

aaaand i am introduced to Hobsons Choice.

super nice staff, HOUSE PUNCH IS BOMB.

the only thing i don't like about Hobson's... is the bar food is Asqew. Where i'm from... thats not bar food.

But thats ok, 4 dollar House Punch makes up for it.
author: Latisha W.

description: There IPOD selection is on point. Everything from classic hip hop to the best of Prince.  I stop by here every now and then to catch up with friends over a nice cold frosty beer.  The crowd is diverse, and it's in the heart of upper Haight St
author: Robert M.

description:
i love hobson's!

the very very eclectic crowd, the ol' sooooo tasty punches (ginger lemonade please!) and the very chill atmosphere, Hobson's is most def. the place to be @ during happy hour or on a rare hot sunny afternoon in the haight. Drinks are always made to perfection, the bartenders know their shit, i love it, and it's a great place for conversation! They also have food to order, but its really just askew's menu, i wouldn't recommend it.. i ordered nachos once and got charged 13 and change, a rip off IMO... (minus one star).. 

other than the hole in my pocket the nachos left me, come to hobsons order their signature punches and/or bloody mary's! sooo tasty!
author: Alex C.

description: I guess they must deal with a lot of cockheads, but none can be as big a dick as that tall bartender. He brings the whole place down from a comfortable neighborhood bar with a cozy atmosphere to an undergraduate tourist stinkhole. The other bartenders are pretty great. Still, that one tall not-very-cute 'tender drags em down. One star.
author: Conor C.

description: Floor to ceilling windows that look out onto Haight Street, loud funky tunes and best of all a great Happy Hour ($2 beer and House Rum Punch) make this a go to evening starter.
author: Robin S.

description: I love this place. Given that I can walk here in less than 5 minutes this is definitely going to be my go-to bar. Cool laid back place to hang with friends and they serve alcoholic punch out of a bowl! Last time I went I got free shots from the bartender and met a guy named Pirate Jerry. What more do you want?
author: Nicole F.

description: Before coming to Hobson's, I never enjoyed Rum as a sipping drink. I was missing out! A good unadulterated glass of rum can last you a long time, start a fire in your tummy and make you mad drunk. Go here and ask the bartender to recommend something in the $8-10 range.
author: Joe R.

description: Hobsons is bar none THE BEST place to people watch. The fishbowl windows allow for maximum viewing pleasure, and the dark and stormies, (Jamaican rum and ginger) are the best way to get your afternoon buzz on in the Haight. AND you can order from Asqew next door wihout having to wait in the lines. I highly reccomend the ultra cheesy nachos. It's more than enough for three, and you can feed the dogs your leftovers.
author: Jennifer S.

description: my kind of place!! mai tai mondays.. im there :) they were really good and not pure mix, mostly alcohol actually. I really want to come back and try their punch, i have heard great things (if your goal is a drunk silly night that is). This bar is so laid back and perfect for a chill night grabbing drinks with friends.
author: Barbara C.

description: Not a bad bar, with good beer selection. I was amazed at how crowded it was on a late Saturday afternoon. A bar that fills up by 6 pm or so is all right with me. Wow, this must be where all the cool kids hang out.
author: Michael E.

description: This bar was pretty busy on a monday evening, which is impressive for a laid back Haight bar. The crowd was good looking but not too hip, seemed like a lot of tourists. Bartender was damn cold but maybe I caught him on a bad night. All in all, I was kind of bored with this place and left when my glass was empty.
author: Jane K.

description: Super Yuppie bar! If your a yuppie enjoy.  If you're not avoid this place like the N1H1.They ripped off Club Deluxe's long time Bloody Mary Sundays idea. Come on guys get your own gimmicks.
author: Johnny B.

description: Not a bad little bar in the upper haight.  The service isn't anything special, and they have one of those damned internet jukeboxes, but it's still not a bad place to do a little drinking with some friends.  Your female friends will no doubt be a fan of the large bowls of punch they serve here, and they have Shiner Bock on tap now which makes this ex-pat Texan a happy man.  It gets a little too crowded on the weekend, but then most bars in this town do.  I'd say they're a pretty average 3 star bar, but I've got to throw them an extra star for being one of the closest places to my house where I can get a nice cold Shiner.
author: Joshua W.

description:
the $20 minimum the guys over at hobson's choice require on all orders paid for on plastic is sure to get you drunk if you're buying your own brews. especially when you're on an IPA kick like i am. and i got pretty drunk here the other night. thank you.

also, i've been here a few times over the past three years and one thing i know which i always warn people about and they NEVER effin' listen to is that, while the punch is delicious and doesn't taste dangerous, it will knock you on your ass. go ahead, don't listen to me. just promise me you won't drive afterward. i ride a bike and like my brain inside my head where it belongs..
author: Jeremiah W.

description: My bar of choice when I feel like drinking some really yummy mango punch and hanging out with a few smelly hippies.
author: Matthew R.

description: I was really drunk here form the rest of the bars down the street, but the drink was still stiff and delicious. There was a loud friendly party time crowd! woooooooo!
author: Jacquelyne M.

description: Perhaps I never wanted her hand clutching my left cheek; it's warmth betraying a couple living as a carnal beat-bop of sorts. I think she was the bopper, though I won't elaborate. She took me here once. Never having quite enough words to exchange we chose the table directly adjacent to the entrace. Two queen chairs facing each other, a beer-drunk table shaking off any excess wordiness. A cocktail turned into two. The door opened and closed. Beating ensued.
author: Marc M.

description: I barely remember being in here the other week as I stumbled in here after 8 hours at Kezar Pub (see review) but I remember them having the best jukebox ever. Bathroom was pretty bad but beer selection was good, bartender was nice and crowd was pretty cool - have no idea what time I was there but I know it was still kind of light out. Would like to go back with my wheels on next time...
author: Kate S.

description:
drinks....yummy (especially the punch -- and during happy hour it's $2.50)


crowd........agreeable


bartenders......stellar


hobson's choice.....MY choice :)
author: april s.

description:
Great punch!
I came here on Saturday night after reading about places that serve giant punch bowls.  This place is near my house, so I walked over.
I didn't get a bowl of punch, but tried two different types in single serving glasses.  Each punch was delicious, fruity, came with a piece of fruit, and got me pretty toasted.
I saw these guys with a punch bowl near me saying "dude we keep filling up and it's like it's not getting any lower."  Then there was an interaction between to parties, one of which was looking for his hat at the punch bowl's table.  The guys with the bowl thought he was asking for punch, so they gladly gave him a couple glasses to join in.  The point of this horribly illustrated story was to say that the punch bowls are plenty to go around, and even contain enough to give free cupfulls to strangers.
I got a seat in the sweet upstairs area.  There was a cocktail waitress who was very attentive.  For a Friday night, I was happy with the super short bathroom line and ability to get seats. 
I'll be back.
author: Light Bulb J.

description: Sometimes packed, never exclusive, this is a great bar. Every time I've come here I've had a great time. Love, Love the cosy couches and stuffed chairs upstairs. Be sure to tip the bartenders and they will be sure to treat you nicely. Otherwise they'll pretty much ignore you.
author: Kat C.

description: I'm not sure what night "Stef" went to Hobson's but I have never experienced it that loud and that crowded.. Its definatly a mix of people any night you go.. I woudn't say it's anything close to the Marina.. the bar tenders are awesome (especially Kyle) and I would recommend the house punch both of them are good.. There is always plenty of places to sit and a really great atmosphere.. if you are looking for something mellow go there during the week.. I haven't tried the food yet.. someone let me know how it is!
author: Danielle K.

description: Great spot for unique drinks (such as the two kinds of punch) with a internet jukebox so you can listen to whatever you want. My friend was in the mood for some old-school rap, so he pretty much controlled the music for an hour complete with Outkast, Wu-Tang, Pete Rock, EPMD, Public Enemy, Brand Nubian, etc etc. Interesting crowd mix of locals and tourists and the corner seats make for good people watching as they stroll on by...
author: Nicolas H.

description: People watching, bouncers with a sense of humor, and all the stuff you've heard about the booze is true.  I think I can expect to have my most random conversations and encounters here, and for SF that says a lot.  Last time it was an hour of discussion on how gay my shoes were, with plenty of random strangers happily enlisted to proffer opinions.  Fuckin' rad.
author: K M.

description: Hobson's Choice serves punch. By the bowl. Which is a whole lot of punch! I prefer the red Victorian variety, it's a bit more tropical and refreshing vs the orange house punch. Two bowls of that will get a pretty large party completely trashed. Of course being a bar there's plenty of other drinks to choose from and the bartenders seemed very nice. But I'd probably just come back for the punch. Sometime after the memory, or lack thereof, fades a bit...
author: Will A.

description: In full disclosure, I've never actually bought a drink from this place.  My five star review is because the guy who worked the door on Sunday afternoon is my hero.  My partner and I were walking down Haight street just checking out the shops.  We passed two guys and they started following us.  They started yelling at my partner saying really inappropriate things, essentially verbally harassing her because it was obvious we were together and she's more femme than I am.  We both felt really uncomfortable so we ducked into the first door we passed.  It happened to be Hobson's Choice.  As soon as we entered we ran into a guy asking us for our IDs.  My partner explained what had just happened and that we were just trying to get away from them.  The guy kind of looked at us funny because I'm sure I had a really pissed off look on my face but then he saw the two guys loitering outside of the bar.  He said, "I won't have that happening in front of my bar," and went outside and basically stared them down until they started to move away.  My partner and I then crossed the street and went on our way, thanking him as we left.  We weren't in the mood for drinks that day, but needless to say, that will be the first bar we go to next time we're in the area.
author: Christina C.

description:
wow, 4...5 stars!? for hobson's choice? i don't mean to insult the place, but...umm....
on the positive side there are a couple of really cool bartenders, and i hear wednesday night used to be goth night before my day. the victorian punch is good too. 
other then those few...every time i go in i'm surrounded by dudes, bros, and older frat guys. thats prettty much the vibe here,  dudes and bros. and its not that i don't like dudes and bros.  its just that there are so many.
author: Joanna R.

description:
Good scene.  Drinks are good, esp if it's happy hour.  

It can be a bit of a jam-job at peak times but there seems to be quite a bit of turnover  so you can normally get a seat at the bar.

Special star for serving askew grill grub.
author: WP D.

description: The daytime bartender here confiscated my fake id three days before my 21st birthday.  My friends have gotten cut off from drinking too much here.  The bouncer insists on eyeing every girl from head to toe who walks through the door.   I'm not really that wild but this place seems to bring out the rowdy in me.  Must be the Victorian punch.
author: Melissa Y.

description: Great atmosphere, nice prices, bomb ass punch.
author: Andrea S.

description: Great cheap fruity drinks!! sometimes its hard to get a place to sit but the crowd is always fun so it really doesn't matter if u sit or stand, as long as you have a drink in your hand! Also, I've never waited in line for the restroom, as a girl, that's a big deal on a Friday or Saturday night!
author: Manda G.

description: Nice place. People were friendly and the price was nice. Gets a bit crowded but me and my cousins enjoyed ourselves there. I'd go back there to hang out and drink.
author: Larry V.

description: Rum punch bowls AND I can bring my dog with me? Perfect.
author: Jlyn C.

description: If you are into frat girls vomiting technicolored punch listening to the worst music ever, this place is for you. The whole place just screams "date rape" and the bartenders are complete JERKS! They should change their name to "Hobson's is a BAD Choice".
author: AMY J.

description: Okay, here's the dealio, I was dog-sitting this weekend and this was the closest dog friendly bar so I thought I'd check it out.  (ps, dogs are such dude magnets, what's the deal, can't talk to us directly just our dogs?  sorry, tangent)  I was dissapointed to find that the only available table had a heap of dirty dishes and a super sticky surface to bat.  Eventually someone cleaned it up, but not until I was half way through my beer.  I mean, do they even serve food here?  It was weird.  My beer was pretty good and I enjoyed the orange slice embellishment.  The crowd was pretty lively and cool for a Sunday, except for the drunk guy who kept coming over to grab at Marley (dog) and spill his beer all over his head...that was a little weird.  All in all, this is an average bar that allows dogs...I will not be there again, until Aunty Claire is dog sitting Mr. Marley and needs a drink.
author: Claire C.

description: Hobson's is great because it has a lot of personality while still being laid back.  Who doesn't love the giant punch bowls behind the bar?  The service is good, the jukebox is good, and whenever I've gone it's been busy but not cramped.  I've also always had a ridiculously fun time when I've gone.  Maybe it's all that rum punch...  Also, I heard a rumor they serve Dark & Stormys (for a bar that boasts having the largest rum collection in the country, they better!).  I'm excited to go back and confirm this rumor.
author: Christina D.

description: Screw this place. Dick bartenders and $5.25 Guinness. 'Nuff said.
author: Joe G.

description:
ok, here's the deal.  if you know me you know i love fruity drinks. so shit that has like an umbrella or it's in a Polynesian cup ya know.  Hobson's has these awesome drinks like the "Victorian Punch" which is like 3 types of rum, something else...and then something else.  Guess what?  IT IS GOOD.  So good that you'll drink like 3 of them in 5 mins and then be tipsy.

It's not just the drinks though, i dig the atmosphere.  It's on a corner on haight street so you get the old school regulars there and the bartenders are super cool and are usually playing some good old school hip hop as well (at least when i go.)  Also, it's the perfect day drinking spot!  Another thing I'm a big fan of.  FRUITY DRINKS + DAY DRINKING + CRAZY PEOPLE + DOGS =  A place a recommend.

PS.  i go there by myself and it's totally cool/comfortable so for all you losers out there join me! REVOLUTION!
author: Noah b.

description: My friends and I randomly landed here on a Saturday night and could not have been more pleasantly surprised by how great this bar was. It was a really chill crowd, more diverse than what we're used to, great comfy seating and reasonably priced drinks. They also played great music. It's nice to find a bar that isn't totally nuts on a Saturday night.
author: Meg M.

description: I happened into the Hopson's choice and saw some kids in the window, in a gorilla suit, dancing and throwing comic books at us. I'll never drink the fruit mix cocktail/boner cure ever again. maybe.
author: bryan o.

description: The punch was ridonkulous, and not in a good way.  Best part was that it was easy to get seating on a Friday night.  If you need a place to wait until there is room at Alembic, you could do worse.
author: Aaron T.

description: Total college bar, complete with frat boy types, a male to female ration of 4:1 and a broken gallaga game.  However, I will say this: (1) the drinks were damn cheap (only $4 for the rum punch...which looked like the kind of party punch that is responsible for all kinds of schnanigans by thousands of college freshman every year) and (2) everyone seemed like they were having a good time.  That's good enough for me.
author: Jason S.

description: Having been here once for two beers - I have no place writing a real review. However, the cute bartender girl did pour me two Guinness the proper way and left a heart shape in the head. That's more than I could ever hope for. Thank you :)
author: Tolga E.

description: When I first moved to SF this was the 1st bar I ever entered. While I lived in the Haight this was one of my favorite meeting places. Comfy old chairs, interesting characters, and a huge view of Haight St. antics. Great happy hour ($2 rum punch) & laid back bartenders.
author: Kat F.

description: The people are down to earth and remind me of home :).  Music is great!  T-Shirts are even better.  I Likey!  So will you!
author: samit P.

description:
Picture it: Christmas Eve 2006. Figuring we'd all like to have a very David Lynchian Christmas Eve, the bf and I and the last remnants of our urban family left in town decided to head down to Aub Zam Zam for a bevvie. Cue lots of deep conversations about literature and whatnot, peppered with self-reflection about what the last year had brought. Cut to the swinging lone red overhead light. Fade to the drunk homeless person who snatched tips from the bar and took off like Marion Jones never could. Split screen of drunk bartender pursuing drunk homeless person and dragging her back and dapper old man passing out at bar. All this while the jukebox was wailing about somebody done somebody wrong. Too David Lynchian, even for me.

Then picture the contrast of arriving at Hobson's Choice after that scene. Hobson's that looks and feels like an amalgamation of every crappy off-campus apartment people hung out in, complete with battered furniture and hideous flocked wallpaper and stopped-up toilet. Hobson's with its year-round delicious punch that tastes as good after a long day of summery daytime drinking as it does on a wet Christmas Eve. Hobson's that allows the cute puppies to come in and hang out with the mixture of frat boys, hipsters and regular joes. Hobson's that molds itself to whatever you want your night out to be. You want to buy a bowl of punch and get suckered into thinking it has no effect? Knock yourself out! (Just wait until the fresh air hits you and you go from sober to knee-walking drunk in 60 seconds.) You want to sit on a battered couch and talk baseball? Please do! You want to play some tunes on the great jukebox and bs with the bartender? Why not! A great place to start or end a night depending on how much punch you want to have.
author: Leah S.

description: Fun bar with a great crowd. I always meet really intersting people everytime I'm there... christian rock band members and roadies, "The Bachelor" look alikes, random biker guys that buy you a drink on their way out the door just for the heck of it ...you name it!
author: Tanger T.

description: Hobson's has got to be one of my favorite happy hour spots in the city.   You can't get much better than $2 beers.  The bartenders are dope, they usually always hook it up somehow.  The crowd is chill and interesting.  I always leave Hobson's happy and with a good story to tell.  Also a good place to watch the game and shoot the shit.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
They serve punch that packs a punch.  Believe you me, it's a creeper.  You can get a bowl of punch for $30.  The five of us reached the bottom of the yummy punch bowl in no time.  I'm not sure if I was on a sugar high or buzzed... but I felt giddy!

Not in the mood for punch?  Of course there is a full bar and a small selection of beers on tap.  Hungry?  You can order food that is delivered from next door.  Might I suggest the nachos with BBQ sauce.

The iPod selection on the weekends is great.  The big windows make for great people watching.  The victorian style chairs in the back are a good spot to get away from the crowd.  Hobson's is a chill place to share some drinks with good friends.
author: Ashley Q.

description: You know when cheap, sweet rum punch and castoff furniture is magical and awesome? When you're in college. Which is when I was frequenting Hobson's Choice. It's kind of too bad that the crowd skews lame, because it's right in the neighborhood and the interior is comfortable as hell and the bartenders are always cool. But, c'est la vie. Life changes.
author: Megan W.

description: It's the Marina bar for people who want to hang out in the Haight and for aspiring Marina people with real college IDs and fake driver's licenses.
author: Jess H.

description:
i love:
