- their couches that swallow me whole. omg i just realized that they're probably dirty. why didnt i think of this when i was drunk? (rhetorical question)
- THEIR BARTENDER/BOUNCER. he's devastatingly cute.
- their house punch.
- being drunk.

the crowd was pretty mixed. you hav the sorority grls who cant dance, the frat boys who cant dance, the hipsters that you swear wake up in the morning thinkin "gee what can i wear on my emaciated frame today that makes absolutely no sense which is the reason i am hot shit", the old men who holler at anything bc they think that if you holler at everything you're bound to get sum action sooner or later, and gods like me. 

i dont remember anyone being too friendly... seems like this is a place you go with a group of friends.

i've never been offered such a plethora of drugs on the walk back to the car.
author: Lillian P.

description: Punch Bowls!!!!!!!!!!!  nail down a bench and table up front, get some friends and a few punch bowls and let the fun begin!
author: Chard M.

description: This place is a great neighborhood bar, with a friendly staff, tasty drinks, and reasonable prices.  I think this place could be like the bar in Cheers if we lived in imaginationland and there weren't so many people who hoped to call it home.  Sit at a table near the window, watch some cracked out woman on the street fight with a bread stick (cuz its Haight and that's what people do), order a bowl of punch with friends (the red stuff was strong), and get krunk (again, when in Rome...).
author: Charles C.

description:
This is my local, so of course it gets 5 stars.  Why would I hang out in a place that isn't 5 stars?

The best thing about this place is the bartenders.  Spend a little time here, and you'll make some great friends on both sides of the bar (the regulars are cool too).

The punch is awesome, the Sunday morning bloody mary bar is a great hangover cure (they finally have Sunday Ticket in HD), and the happy hour is killer.
author: Scott L.

description: It was past 5'oclock and we were in need of a cocktail. After spending the afternoon wandering the streets of Haight, we decided to stop in for a drink. Great atmosphere inside with little vintage elements scattered inside. They have a PacMan original video game table across from the bar and a great seating areas throughout. Their bloody mary's are really good and I could have had another one, but I needed some food in my stomach before that would have happened. Cool place to kick back and grab a drink with friends.
author: Meredith O.

description: Good mixed drinks, *excellent* cushy chairs, fun atmosphere.  Now if only those hot Irish boys who hang out there were gay, it would be perfect.
author: Paul H.

description: I like this place cause it's very casual and laid back. Typical neighborhood bar. I like to come here with friends to just chill. The atmosphere might not be my style but that's good enough. Their punches are good! I like my pear cider =) I know, I know, it's not even a real drink. Whatever.
author: Perry S.

description: My a**hole brother is an investment banker in the rural Midwest.  The first time he came to San Francisco with his other a**hole investment loser buddies, he called me from this bar.  OF COURSE!  It's for a**holes!  It's a total poser bar -- that specializes in rum and pseudo-Victorian decor.  I live around the corner and never go here -- why?  It sucks.  Unless you're some sort of frat boy retard, avoid this place at all costs.  There's nothing charming, welcoming or cool about this sticky rat's nest.  We call it Snobson's for a reason.
author: jamie s.

description: nice and cheap, cool ass bartenders and DELIRIUM TREMENS plenty of choices here.... I'm glad we ended up here last night... also glad that i was able to hold my alcohol as I almost spewed all over the bar here.... I'm gonna blame the bartender for getting me drunk near last call .... you should know when to stop giving me freebies! =)
author: John R.

description:
Damn cheap happy hour is all I can really say. All I had were the punches:

$2.50 house punch
$3.50 "special" punches

I thought their house punch was better than the other two available. Certainly not much alcohol in it, but I guess a fair amount for $2.50.
author: Jeffrey T.

description:
I'm torn in writing this review. The bar itself is pretty unique, serving more rum than Captain Jack Sparrow himself could handle.  This is also one of the few bars that will serve a zombie the right way and still maintain its drinkability. It can get somewhat crowded, but I guess I should expect that.
Now on to the bad part of the review.....
Last time I was there, my credit card was double charged, and when I called the manager to ask about it, he basically accused me of being too drunk to remember what I had purchased.  Luckily my bank believed me and it was all taken care of.  
I haven't been back, but I am somewhat tempted.
author: Jeremy S.

description: Chill place in the Haight to grab a rum-infused drink and kick back on a couch.  Diverse crowd gathers to make almost anyone feel comfortable.  The arrogant wait staff adds to a dark and mysterious scene.
author: Josh D.

description: Hobson's is the neighborhood Haight St. bar. Always packed on Fri and Sat nights, you'd be better served going there to have a drink with an old college buddy on a lazy Sunday afternoon. The happy hour during the week is also worth checking out,  where you can try one of the house specialty punches.
author: Nishan K.

description: Maybe something was wrong with their fridge last night, but all the beers on tap were on the warm side.  They tried to make up for it by chilling the glasses, but that only made my hands cold.
author: Rego S.

description: This is a neighborhood bar for a friend of mine so we go here after dinner a lot. I love the rum punch and other very strong drinks. The atmosphere is just very comfortable and friendly so we always have fun drinking too much and chatting on comfy chairs or couches all night. It has always been a mellow,  good time. Don't love the hangover I always seem to have but it isn't there fault I suppose...
author: Lilly O.

description: Jennifer M lies.... I have a not so happy story to tell. Me and a large group of my friends were hanging out here one night. I think I was about the last person to order a drink and I show the bartender my id, which i didnt realize had just expired, not good enough, so then I went on to show him another photo id (military id) with my bday on it.... not good enough.. i showed him library, costo cards... it  just wasnt good enough. So the bastard bartender told me leave.... what an ass! I had to go collect dust outside with haight street bums while all my homies drank inside!
author: Natalia J.

description: It's not really a "chill" place to hang out. With the music, usually blaring rap, pounding on each wall, I would consider it a good place to know that your conversation was being heard by no more than half of your party (should it be a party larger than three people). Yet, Hobson's is a solid neighborhood bar. It has a jukebox full of various musical genres, lots of space, an eclectic collective, and "punch", a cheap rummy drink full of sugar that makes you forget your name, should you dare to consume half the bowl.
author: Shannon F.

description: Fun place to go on a rainy Saturday afternoon with some friends.  I drank the House punch (orange) and it was delightful.  So delightful I had four glasses of it.  Great atmosphere, super sweet music and what a place to people watch.  Its on a bus stop so you have a slew of people always hanging out in front of the bar.  Grab a seat at the front tables to people watch - you might even see a guy dressed up as a bunny hopping down the street.  I will have to go back and enjoy their happy hour specials.
author: Bianca R.

description: Great bar. Very friendly staff. When I lived in SF I loved coming here and became friends with the bartenders. They make DELICIOUS mojitos and it's very cozy and friendly. There is a VERY diverse cliental. Sometimes the Haight street kids can be annoying, but overall it's a great place.
author: Emily L.

description: Great punch. IT'LL GET YA DRUNK, as Samuel Jackson  says. Also, one of the only accessible bathrooms on Haight Street. For those of you who know how annoying it is to find a bathroom in the Haight, this has a HUGE redeeming  quality. Overall a classy place.
author: Todd J.

description:
you can't beat $2 punch from 5-7. i love all the beat up couches and tables, too.

negative: the green fluorescent light in the ladies' room freaks me out..you can't see any leftover pee on the seat, which brings out my inner germophobe.
author: Laura A.

description: Saturday afternoon punch bowls.  Go home before it gets dark.
author: Ryan P.

description: This place is easy going.  You come in, get your drink, and have seat on the couch to relax and chat with your buddies.  Particularly nice when friends from out of town come on a Saturday morning and you can spend the afternoon in the clouds. Don't recommend it every weekend, but on a nice hot summer day, nothing beats it.
author: Adam O.

description: Best place to watch a Laker game, especially if you're a Detroit fan. Stay away from the punch. It's evil.
author: Babs P.

description: Nice, chill place to hang out and drink a beer (or three) at the end of a long day. Not too loud or pretentious (it isn't like you find too much of that in this neighborhood). The crowd is a pretty good cross-section of the Haight.
author: Dana L.

description: My quest for a quaint, diverse, and cozy little neigborhood bar with a great happy hour is over!!!  When my out-of-town buddy stumbled across it and told me to meet her there after work, I was skeptical.  But once I walked in and saw all the friendly faces and heard the great tunes on the juke, I knew I was home.  The couches are great for lounging after a long day, the rustic old bar is stocked with attentive and conversational bartenders, and the happy hour is phenomenal!  $2 draft beer with a dozen choices (if I don't watch out, I just might get a "Fat Tire" during the winter with this deal) and $2 home-made rum punches served in generous glasses.  Met some welcoming regulars immediately and promised I'd be back... again & again & again!
author: Tara G.

description: One of my favorite places in the Haight. I had my first mojito here. There are great drink specials and cozy nooks to slip into.
author: Liana V.

description: Incredible place to go if youre a Pirate. (Best rum selection in the city!) Barstaff VERY attentive and patient. Punch, very tasty but dangerous. Beer selection could be a little better, but they are a rum bar, so its fine. Kind of an obnoxious frat guy crowd at times, but all and all a decent place to catch a ballgame or a conversation about comics with the bartender!
author: Mick F.

description: Definitely my favorite bar in the Haight.  It's a fun crowd and a great mix of people.  I've found the bartenders to be pretty nice too.  It's a great atmosphere and I love the comfy seating.  Even when it's crowded, it's a good place to hang out with a friend and talk.  Lots of interesting people to watch and meet too!  Oh, and the drinks are made well, and there's a decent selection of beer.
author: Barbs J.

description: I always feel at home at Hobson's... the antique velvet couches and the generally laid-back clientelle make that easy.  I just have to remind myself not to feel TOO at home by ordering too many of those ridiculous rum concoctions that make me hurt for days.  Ah, but it hurts so good...
author: Andrew E.

description: This was the first bar I ever visited in the city many, many, many years ago. Now it's a neighborhood favorite of mine. Have yourself a Dark & Stormy or a Hurricane, and sink into the couch next to the bar with a good friend.
author: Rob H.

description: What a fun place. My boyfriend and I stumbled across Hobson's one day after shopping on Haight. They have a weekday happy hour from 5-7p.m. where they have beers and their house punches for $2. I had one of the house rum punches and it was super strong, but really good. It was a very chill and comfortable atmosphere! Great place to hang out and relax.
author: Gladys C.

description:
i used to like this place. i wanted to like this place since i live so close. but i don't know -- maybe it's just not my crowd but i've just seen a lot of weird things go down here. i'd say this place has a cult following, but i just don't get it. 

if you go, do realize you can order asqew next door though-- which equates to another star in my review.
author: Jon N.

description: The punch. That is what this place is all about. I'm surprised I was still standing by the time I walked out of there. Another great thing is that Asqew will deliver food into there for you, that is awesome, being that Asqew is just sooo yummy. The duo together can just not be beat. They have a great jukebox, friendly bartenders and a little upstairs to hang out in. Plus they benefitted the Stop Aids Project with Bar Aids this year. Yeah for them!
author: Erin O.

description: Excellent rum selection. Very impressed by the barkeeps' knowledge of the rums they have. Great place, indeed.
author: Rahul T.

description: this bar is located just on the heart of Haight street.. i recommend for the fact the own and management care for their business and for their customers as well... some times it is a hit or miss situation in here, but if you ever have some problem in  here in past they will try to fix it for you.
author: B H.

description: I just came back from here, and I'm definitely buzzin. First off all, my friend and I were drawn in by the crowd of Santas (hello Santacon), what could be better than boozin it up with Mr.Claus? I got really excited when I saw the punch bowls, and even more excited when I saw the GoGo punch, it has ginger in it, GINGER! I love ginger more than anything, so, I had to order the punch. They have several TV screens and here, and I didn't even know where to look, when I first got there, on one TV there was Grey's Anatomy, and on the other was Girls Gone Wild. I didn't know whether to look at the sad family crying over the critically injured dad, or the girls shaking their boobs. I had a gin and tonic after my delicious punch. The staff seemed nice. Maybe it is just because I'm a lightweight, but the drinks didn't seem weak. Yay, I'm all about Hobson's Choice, I will most likely return soon, if nothing else, but for the punch!
author: Paige C.

description: My friends and I go here for the rum punch alone.  If you haven't tried it yet, you need to.  Very tasty!
author: Jenna M.

description:
Great Bar! Every time that I am in the Haight - i always have to stop here. They have the most amazing Rum here - even some obscure ones that I have only had in the country that it is made in. 

Simply Fantastic!

minus one star for some nasty seating.
author: Ryan W.

description: Strong drinks, nice ambiance, good crowd.  It's the best bar on the Haight strip.
author: Helen C.

description: Have to have to try the red punch.  it'll kick your ass once you try to get up.  Definitely great place to hang out. very friendly atmosphere and the bartenders are pretty friendly (hey! he even taught me how to flavour my liquor at home)  The place is ALWAYS crowded whenever I go. Even if you show up alone, you'll be able to find friendlies to caht with.
author: Steffy W.

description: Great punch, great beers on tap (I'm a little pissed that sunshine wheat is no longer on tap), and excellent Sunday nights!  $2 Fernet shots on Sundays, how about them apples?  If you're a Fernetie, then do yourself a favor and swing by Hobson's Choice on a sunday night.  You might find me there with a shot of fernet w/ a ginger back while depositing all my loose change into the mp3 jukebox so I can download Journey's greatest hits.  I like it there.  Oh yea, and they have a partnership w/ Asqew Grill...it's nice if you crave kebobs or nachos and don't want to leave the bar.
author: Jonathan V.

description:
I can't tell you how many great nights I've had here and never noticed until the next day. For some odd reason I think that it's too crowded or I've spent too much money, and need to venture out onto the street to head to Alembic or some other crappy joint. Well, no sooner have I left than I feel a longing to go back. When I do get back in there, we order tall cans of Coor's Light and get ready to head back home. 
They take ccards which is a plus for me since I'm always in the red. I'm not a liquor drinker, but my friends complain that the drinks are made too strong...to which I say, "And you ordered alcohol for what?" Check it out if you haven't----plus, people can always be caught making out there. I'm kind of a weirdo...
Sorry in advance for showing my age, but there are quite a few college kids that come here. They don't really annoy you as you might think they would, and in fact they often are the best thing about this bar. 

A Plus: you can tell the bartender what you'd like to eat at Askew, and they'll order it and get it for you!
author: Mike M.

description: Great bar if you time it right.  Hit up happy hour on a friday.  $2 rum punch.  Nice atmosphere of people getting off work and gearing up for the weekend, easy parking, comfy seats, big place, cute bartenderess...  Last time I was here was late night on a saturday, coming from an apartment-wide dance party.  A girl we were with stole my buddy's sk8board while wearing heels and a mini and made it four blocks down the middle of the street before loosing it stop-drop-and roll-style through an intersection.  So this place gets rowdy, not wild (bad), but loose and inappropriate (good).
author: Jimmy C.

description: Seating is limited, however, get there early and settle in for the evening while enjoying the most amazing concoction ever invented. Last night my friend and I stopped in for a rum punch which we guzzled in under 5 minutes. This stuff goes down smooth! We may have had 3 or 4 more, but who's counting? They are only 4 bucks a pop which is decent considering some bars charge $10-$14 for a good cocktail. I feel surprisingly ok this morning, it must be from all the vitamins in the fruit juice. The only weird thisng is there were 3 or 4 dogs in the bar, cute, but I'm allergic.
author: Emily W.

description: Just realized that all my reviews sound the same: great happy hour, nice staff, blah blah. But, same goes for Hobson's. It is literally the closest bar to my apartment, so even though it's not my favorite place, I have had a drink there once or twice. Then I found out that dogs are allowed M-Thurs, and my world changed. I LOVE DOG FRIENDLY BARS! Beware of the punch - it is super sweet and will require that you swallow three fistulls of salt after consuming one.
author: Cat S.

description:
Good place to get drinks with lots of friends. Space can get packed, but on a quiet night it is especially good. Bartenders are chill. There's even a old-school arcade machine across from the bar.

It gets 4 stars from me because I like the place, but it loses that one star because it can get packed, and because the music ain't that great (but hey you can ALWAYS change it on that machine). Aside from the crowd, I honestly dislike some of the yuppies who show up trying to act hard.

Overall Hobson's is okay, 4-star worthy don't get me wrong, mainly because the drinks are pretty good.

Addition: I'm not gonna downgrade this place because of this experience I had on Friday, but here goes. So my friends and I, a rather large group, were sitting in the back. There was a private party upstairs in the "loft" which contributed to quite a bit of foot traffic in the back. It was REALLY PACKED. No room to walk to the exit packed. Of course, it's a Friday Night after all. Anyways, my friends and I were enjoying our drinks and company, when this random guy comes up to our table. One of my friend's girlfriend was saving his chair by putting her leg on the chair. So back to the random guy who comes up and gets into an argument with her over the chair. He wasn't even part of the party, I don't think anyone knew him there, nor was he welcome. I was just observing, mainly because I was too tired to care. So he got into it with another person in party, and he just kept at it, arguing that he had a right to that chair, which seemed pretty ridiculous especially when the second we surrendered the chair, he decided to leave anyways.
author: Michael C.

description: We came in here at about 11pm on a friday night and it wasn't too crowded. We found 4 seats at the bar and ordered a round of drinks. The service was quick, must have been because they had 3 bartenders for the small bar. A table opened up and  we moved to the table where the seats were a lot more comfortable. This is a good place if you want to hang out and have a couple of beers with some friends, but I don't see it being more than that.
author: D J.

description: Come here during happy hour (I think it's something like mon-fri: 5-7 or something around those lines) and drinks are only $2.50! My friend Tina introduced me to the punch here and that's what I usually start off with now. They also play some pretty good music (hey, as long as it's not top 40's..) and the bartenders are cool. The crowd here is pretty chill as well, nothing pretentious and no creeps, so 4-stars!
author: Sheena C.

description:
so, i'm not a barfly, per say, i like to have a nosh if i'm gonna drink, so a place like Magnolia 
http://www.yelp.com/biz/magnolia-pub-and-brewery-san-francisco#hrid:YKvXXqSUHzm9ETY3X3vskg  
is more my style.
However, here's the magic secret about Hobson's.
THEY ALLOW POOCHES!
they have to be super chill and promise not to pee on anything or bite anyone.
But you can hang out INSIDE with your fabulous fourlegger and imbibe!
Yippee for dogs and alcohol ( but don't share the alcohol with the dogs. yeah?)

and, as a thousand people have said before me, the punch is super yum. 
There are actually two kinds of punch- i prefer the House punch ( orange pineapple) over the Victorian punch ( cranberry and coconut rum i think)

and how can you beat a $2.50 happy hour?
author: Melody O.

description: My friends used to come here and I used to secretly want to tell them that the Gold Cane is cheaper and better and you get a way better cross-section of alkies in there that at least it's entertaining. But Hobson's is really just, seriously, meh. The bartenders are kind of dicks, and the people that go there I'm not too impressed with at all. The drinks are way too sweet here and their rum isn't that good either, despite having rums from different islands in the Caribbean. The punch is a serious rip off, I used to get some weird rum sugary drink that was pretty decent and there was a happy hour for it or something. But overall, so not impressed with this place. You could get some Asquew served to you from around the corner though. Which is nice. But that's probably the only perk you have there.
author: Gina R.

description: I always end up at this place after giving my friends an abbreviated tour of SF. This time around I ended up here on a Sunday afternoon to discover the Bloody Mary bar! It was awesome. There are so many items to pick. The only negative is that you could possibly screw up your bloody mary by making some weird combinations. A little too much horseradish and it's all over. If you're a newb,  the best advice is to ask the bartender.
author: Kara S.

description: Yea, it's pretty choice. ;) Har har.. No really, perfect for watching a Sunday football game. The punch is yum, the bartenders are great, the crowd is whatever, but at least not gushing wish sports driven testosterone so again, great for the Sunday game. Oh, and you can order food yummy super bad for you food from next door and they just bring it right over!
author: Lily K.

description: Love the punch! Cheap and delicious! You may not taste the liquor at first, but just wait. Don't say I didn't warn you. The prices in this bar are very good and the music was a fun mix of everything. Get there early for comfy seating or stand in the crowd that forms later in the night.
author: Carly W.

description: Oh my god! Sitting with a group of friends at one of the window tables people-watching on Haight St while downing $2 happy hour rum punches (they don't like it when you call it "jungle juice") and eating food from Asqew Grill next door....life doesn't get much better than this!! I've had MANY a plastered afternoon in this place!
author: Evan R.

description: A nice respite when not busy.  The funrtiture is cozy too.  If you want privacy there is an upper balcony - I used to meet up with a group weekly there for the social hour and we would usually stake out that area for privacy, ,but do beware of the furniture up there which is a bit more worn and used.  One time I happened to get quite alot of bites after sitting on a couch up there - I believe it was flea-ridden!  So I recommend staying below where the digs are a bit more above board.  Oh, and for maximum effect, sometimes those house punches can pack a wallop!  I have had only a couple drinks from the punch well and managed to get a mighty buzz!
author: Femita J.

description: My favorite bartender works here! She's a wiz with the alcohol, makes things taste like candy.....soooo very dangerous, but oh so good!
author: Abby A.

description: Music is dope. Drinks are a bit overpriced given the scene.  Doc rocks!
author: K B.

description: This is a really odd bar, which is why I love it. It's got the decor and feel of a coffee house with the random furniture and dilapidated couches, and the rum punch is an unusual specialty you won't find everywhere. I like the laid-back vibe in the afternoon. Great place to kick back with a good book or your laptop and chill.
author: Elizabeth D.

description:
This used to be a pretty cool spot to grab a drink or two in the Haight Street neighborhood until they apparently got a couple of new extremely rude bartenders. 
This fat bartender, I believe named Kyle, is a complete asshole.  Apparently he used to be a door man and is now a bartender at Hobson's Choice. I don't know, he should probably stick to opening doors for people and not serving them drinks.  
This fool is one of the rudest person I have even encountered in my live.  He served us short drinks, tried to scam us, and when we tried to talk to him about it  told us to get out of the bar.  He also totally mistreated a couple of bar regulars that were sitting next to us.  And they have been coming there for like 10 years! Big mistake. 
Basically, it comes down to this - there are too many good bars in San Francisco and this is no longer one of them.  I used to come there all the time, but now I would rather take by money elsewhere. 
Don't go there!
author: Kirill E.

description: Yummmmmmmmmmy PUNCH!  I can easily have 2 or 3 of them, and be plastered before I even know it.  Then, I get the super munchies and order the Asqew beef nachos (mmmmm), and before long, I have consumed enough calories for the entire month.  Maybe they should try a DJ, though, I already spend a fortune on drinks. I would like to save some of my bills instead of using them on the Jukebox-only to never hear my song because it's 123rd in line. but YAY PUNCH!
author: Michelle R.

description: I *love* rum homies. And if you do, you should go here. Waiters are knowledgeable, jukebox is sweet, it is never overly packed, and drinks are reasonably priced. I only wished I lived closer so I could hobble home wasted as opposed to finding a damn bus at 2AM!
author: Sean C.

description: Ah the punch, gets me every time. Good choice of vodkas. Bouncers are always really nice. Of course gets a bit packed but a pretty nice crowd.
author: Laurie K.

description: If Lewis Carrol and Jerry Garcia opened a bar up together, I'd imagine it would turn out something like this. There is definitely a Mad Hatter Victorian meets hippy vibe going on here. Super cool, laid back clientele are nestled in old booths, and couches under century old chandeliers. I'm partial to the Dark and Stormy's, but if you're up for a trip to Wonderland, I'd recommend ordering any of the punches in the crystal bowls behind the bar!
author: Kelly C.

description: I've always had good times kicking back a few with some friends.  This is actually one of the first bars I ever went to in the city... ah, the memories.
author: Stephanie P.

description: One of the most delightful afternoons I've spent drinking in a looooong time. Chris the bartender is a honey, and the regulars aren't bad either!
author: Juliette T.

description: Hawt Damn, I love me some rum punch! Any bar that will serve me rum punch deserves a 4 in my book! Great bar to happen upon if you're ever on Haight..can get a wee crowded and for some reason (like zeitgeist) I think to go to this bar only in the day time. Wait...does that make me a boozer?!
author: Inome C.

description: Fun for a night out, their punch bowl is good for a large group.  Cute chairs and seating, a cool place to meet a friend for a drink.  The window is great for people watching on the Haight.
author: Joy W.

description: Love this place, great beer on tap, good jukebox, always a fun crowd.  Jukebox is never a let down, with the interesting groups usually in there, the mix of music is all over the map. Go for the atmosphere, stay for the punch.
author: Jeffrey Q.

description:
I love this bar!  Good people, good music, good drinks.  A great place to relax, chill, and have good conversations.

the bathrooms could be better though....but what do you expect, it's a bar.
author: Pinkyton C.

description:
Okay so maybe I am a little biased cuz I used to work there. But it is my favorite neighborhood bar. Plus I only have to stumble across the street to get home.

It is a full bar that specializes in rum. They have a great selection of all spirits.

I can bring my dog in there. Which he loves cuz there is just a wonderland of people to scratch his butt. That dog lives for butt sratching. No pets on friday or saturday night. Not even Ferets. Sorry Paris.

The downside is that sometimes, I drink too much Fernet and it is all Chris's fault. After all why should I take responsiblity for my actions?

Sunday night is industry night and Fernet shots are only two bucks.

Given that I do stand up, there is always some super trashed person (besides myself) to give me more material for my routine.

They have a bunch of tv's and NFL Sunday ticket on Direct TV. You can watch a game, drink some beer, and eat some nachos all while rubbing my dog's butt. Life doesn't get any better than that
author: Yayne A.

description: Hobson's choice, what can I say about this haight-ashbury atmospheric bar, first of all, the drinks are good at bargain price, bartenders are entertaining, mix crowd, sometimes you'll see college students, then extreme haight crowd, crazy old timid bouncer, basically substantial place to hang. Loud music from a jukebox? kinda wierd, a plus is its 3 stories I think, you can people watch from a balcony seating and sit/relax in privacy.
author: Adam C.

description: I am on the quest to find the best mojito in the city, this place ranks up there, but only when doc makes it.  Besides that, this is a cool little place to chill, and hang out druing the week, good happy hour as well.  And they allow dogs to chill here.
author: brian m.

description: Good bar to get down and have a few drinks. Sitting with friends, people-watching, on the second floor by the railing is always amusing. You know it's a good time when Mitch-dogg takes off his shirt and dances on tables.
author: Steven K.

description: My favorite local bar! I recommend the Victorian punch with a dark rum floater. There is nothing like it anywhere else. Trust me I have been as far as Florida.
author: Ellen S.

description: This is a great bar with the best bartenders!  I love how they select the music from their own IPods.  The punch is yummy but be careful...it's sneaky!
author: a e.

description:
Went here on Saturday for the first time ... All I have to say is get a BOWL!!!!!!  THe bowl's are giant salad bowls filled with delicious spiked punch.  It is ideal for three people looking to get saucy before moving on to the next place.
Overall this place is comforatble as all hell with big cushiony chairs and roomy tables for ultimate bowl consumption.
Five stars because its on haight - just expect at least 10 people to solicit money for weed, booze, or well thats pretty much it.  
HOorAy! FOR  dobsons choice!!!
author: Buddy Garrity L.

description:
good happy hour 4-7:00 $2.50 draft and  punch.  cocktails $5 and it's a decent pour.  gets noisy but it's airy so you don't feel like a sardine. 
nice bartenders.
author: regina k.

description: my buddy from so cal had to tell me about this place before i even found out about it...can u say $2.50 beers....sippin on jacobs sunset wheat/hef type beer...awesum hh crowd....add this spots to your list of stops bar hopping the height...excellent location for foot traffic & for the height folks to look in & stare at every1 havin a good time...tvs & more tvs showing espn & giants games is a plus...
author: elmer d.

description: Great spot for people watching.  Look for the GM, Chris, he will be happy to introduce you to the wonderful world of Fernet if you are not already familiar...
author: Tony S.

description: GREAT bar in the haight. I love to get a window seat and drink my beer while watching all of the people walk by. The only downfall is the place can get really crowded on the weekends. I have to say its hard not to go there considering its 200 feet from my house.
author: joshua b.

description:
if you want to feel better about your life, then i recommend day drinking here on a Sunday.  you'll meet all kinds of people who'll make you think that your life is pretty alright comparatively.

drinks are decent.  you can oder nachos from the restaurant next door and have it delivered to your bar seat.  not too shabby eh?
author: apurba p.

description: it is a good bar. it has nice tv on the second floor to watch also. The crowd last night was definite giants fans. Mostly guys were there. uggh. Oh since it in the haight ashbury district, you have to put up with kids who ask you for if you want any marijuania. overall, the bartenders gave me quick service and the patron are sports fans!
author: Stanley L.

description:
used to be a major regular here and knew all the bartenders. now i dont go in as often but i still have a good time when im in there. like the punch and they have interesting drinks that are suppossedly monthly but not quite. they are creative and theres tons of rum.great mojitos, and great happy hour. lately i feel like the crowd here has gotten older, and less of a random mix which is what i used to enjoy about it. but hey, its still a good time if you go with friends, even if it is noisy and they have a big ugly jukebox now.
one thing thats definitely worth 5 stars: NACHOS. seriously they are huge and amazing. i love the nachos. they make my life happy. you need a few people working on those to finish them, and the kitchen doesnt stay open late so let that be known.
author: lissy d.

description: Tasty punches, and delicious rums are the reason to stop by Hobsons if you ask me.  I can find myself thirsty in the Haight, and not wanting beer, therefore the CHOICE is Hobsons.
author: Kevin Q.

description:
I love this bar and the bar staff, but evidently people puke here a lot, because many times it smells like barf.

They also sell an interesting swill (i've not been brave enough to try it) that sits in a large jug. Reminds me of Steinbeck's Cannery Row gang of bums who'd cobble leftover liquor in a jar to get their buzz on.
author: service p.

description: There Saturday night punch goes down like water, but gives you quite a punch. It's definitely not quiet in here, but the music is pretty good and they usually have one of two games on at the bar.
author: A D.

description:
I've been to this bar several times before and the service isn't always top quality, but last night 11/10/07, my friends and I were treated horribly by staff of the bar.  My friend and I walked outside to smoke a cigarette.  When we tried to get back in, there were two white bouncers - pudgy and about 5'6" - that said it was last call and we could not go back into the bar.  Neither bouncer said anything when we walked out to smoke.  They just decided to go on a power trip and piss off all the customers of their bar.   We both had full drinks and our jackets inside that we were not allowed to go get.  

One of the bouncers, he said his name was Stan, but was obviously lying, also said to my friend that her "dancing was horrible."  He verbally attacked my friend when in reality she was the reason that everyone was dancing in Hobson's.  The staff also ruined the dance party by switching the music from Michael Jackson to Pink Floyd way before it was last call.  They were really really against their customers having a good time.  I am completely disappointed in this bar.
author: alicia g.

description:
I'm writing this review before I even go there tonight because I already know it's my favorite local bar. I have lots of bars at my disposal, but I always come here because it's just gritty enough, just colorful enough. I also come for the music - you'll the soundtrack from "Menace to Society"  and classic David Bowie back to back. The bartenders are always good to me and that goes a long way. 

Oh, and I could care less about the punch.
author: alison m.

description: Went here for the first time the other day and was pleasantly surprised.  I am not usually much of a bar perso, but I found the atmosphere here to friendly and positive.  Just being inside here is a fun night out.  But then, of course, there are also drinks, and they are delicious.  So you can have a fun and delicious time.
author: Isabella H.

description: Ok its embarrassing, but my wife and I both love the punch and comphy bar stools here when you can snag a couple.  Great spot that is what a local watering hole should be.  Not stuffy or pretentious, leave your attitude at the door.
author: Mike and Nance B.

description: two punch bowls between 5 people is highly recommended if you want to get plastered. cool crowd, victorian decor, and lots of punch. what's not to love?
author: r t.

description: this is my favorite bar in the city.  most the locals hate it because they think its the trendy bar in the haight....  they play the best music, have the cheapest drinks, plenty of tables to sit, bartenders are great, huge windows for people watching, and they serve great food (askew grill makes the food next door but they serve you at the bar)
author: timothy d.

description: Hosted a happy hour with some friends from Grad School last night. The bar was a great venue. Plenty of space, the bartenders were very friendly despite being insistent on seeing ID for everyone. Great beer selection, the regulars were very pleasant, and Game 7 NBA finals were on the TV yet everyone seemed really laid back and cool. Plus, there are dogs that just hang out at this place.  I love it!
author: Jonathan L.

description:
great drinks good bartenders but there was this one guy varg.. one of the coolest dudes for sure, he was a cool ass bartender until this lil faggot ass bouncer  mouth out to varg. so he wacked that lil punk rock beezy behind the bar.. i guess your not suppose to hit sumone with a ponytail.

the other big guy kyle he knows how to get u fucked fast.. i started my night off with a drink called "abortion", let me tell u one thing the toilet looked like a aborted a small fetus or sumthang..
author: matt m.

description: this place fucking sucks. this place also belongs in somewhere like tucson arizona, a total fratty college town . i will admit ive had a decent bloody mary here. i will also admit ive tried their house special weird punchy drinks with rum and shit, and enjoyed it. i will also admit this place has shitty music. a weird boring "i like totally live in the haight that makes me counter culture right even tho I totally am not a free spirit at all and i go to wine parties and talk about artisan cheeses" crowd. the weekends make it even more of a nightmare. there used to be a hot tall bartender though, ihope he doesnt work there anymore bc id hate to see him hurt when i blow up this place
author: Lauren V.

description: the house punch is soooo good! they are not shady with their cherrys....lol
author: alessandra t.

description: so i'm drunk. yes, plastered. how do i spell so well? well, yelp spell check of course. i thought i'd credit hobson's choice to getting my  night started off right. thank you, hobson's, for your wonderful hobson's punch. i dont know what the hell is in it, but i sure drank a lot of it and damn... i am currently trashed. it was tasty, cheap, and served quickly so i definitely will not complain. the only thing i can say about this bar is that (from my understanding) no food is served (hence the -1 star). hobson's you seem like an excellent haight bar that i will definitely frequent ESPECIALLY since youre hobson's bunch is only $4. thanks for getting my night of drunken debauchery off right.
author: Aly L.

description: Love that bloody mary bar.... makes me wish it were Sunday Funday everyday!
author: Nors P.

description: a great crowd and good drink selection (lots of beers)...my main problem  with it is that it's really really bright for a bar--the light hurts my drunken eyes!!
author: Roshni R.

description: Hobson's Choice is one of those bars that is probably only average for night life but excellent for weekend daytime drinking and that is what I am basing my rating on.  This is the time when it could also be called "the watcher's bar" because literally that is one of the best facets.  If you're lucky the best seats are probably right in front where you can sip drinks and people watch as tourists and shoppers mix with the haight locals.  If you're not doing this then its great to watch an undermanned team of friends try to take down one or more of the huge rum beverages and swear they won't be drunk afterwards.  If none of these sound good then you can always sit at the bar and watch sports on the TV.  In any case most of these events are fun between chats with friends and the couches, while not the most practical, definitely add a bit of panache missing in some bars.  Give it a Saturday afternoon with some people you like and see if it changes your mind.
author: Steven R.

description: Ok, I'm just gonna declare this my favorite bar in the city (even though I've only been living here for a month)...  I love how everyone gets the house punch, even the big buff dudes, without feeling girly... you get that Hawaiian punch anywhere else and people might start making fun of you, but not at Hobson's.  Cool bartenders, cooler drinks, and no d-bags when I was there... just a bunch of cool folks on a Friday night having drinks and watching the Giants game...  The only negative is the lack of parking, but that's to be expected.
author: Christine H.

description: I was in from seattle and stopped in here (by chance).... on a Sunday before our flight left.... thank god we found this place! The bloody mary bar was amazing and the punch was great. The food was surprisingly one of the best meals I have had in a long time. Thanks! I'll be back for sure.
author: Jaime K.

description: Always a good time!  Cheap drinks, bad music, and lots of seating!
author: L M K M.

description: I don't usually frequent rum bars, but this one gets an exemption. Cool clientle, cozy nooks to sit, fun neighborhood.
author: Matt G.

description: my god how i loathe the haight! came here just to prove a point to my friend, that i can go to bars, where i can't stand.
author: Pickle R.

description: grade-a mojito's. a nice place to be on a nice day, if you're feeling like tipping a few back.
author: Dean E.

description: sweet location for a bar especially if you like to people watch all the weirdos on haight. its vintage and really laid back. i dont really remember much this night but i do know i will be back here.
author: andree t.

description: I discovered this haight bar only but a week ago through the very person that invited me to Yelp. Hobson's Choice blends coffee house conversation with bar stool banter with its medley of seating options and space specific moods  from your typical bar tables in dim light to plush, velvet love seats, arm chairs and sofas under a warm, almost red glow. A great place to meet up with friends to begin an eventful evening and perhaps end up at again to wind back down.
author: Sequoia N.
